name: The Ludovico Technique
description: Instead of firing tears, Isaac controls one floating tear that hover over obstacles. This tear deals constant damage when held in place over an enemy.
effects: [['Instead of firing tears, Isaac controls one floating tear that hovers over obstacles. This tear deals constant damage when held in place over an enemy.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} The Ludovico Technique is a [[special item]].'], ['Ludovico tear is piercing and spectral by default.'], ['Ludovico tear movement speed is determined by the [[shot speed]] stat.'], ['Ludovico tear hits per second are determined by the [[tears]] stat, maxed out at 30 ticks per second.'], ['When {{E|Death}} uses his {{I|The Hourglass}} attack, the tear is slow to respond but then moves so quickly that it is nearly impossible to use effectively.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} When there are no enemies in a room, the tear slowly floats towards the player.', ['The {{I|Brimstone}} ring still follows when the player is outside of it.']], ['If multiple Ludovico Techniques are acquired (via {{i|Diplopia}}, {{i|Crooked Penny}} or on a [[victory lap]]), then additional smaller tears will orbit the main tear.', ['A maximum of 15 smaller tears can orbit the main tear.']], ['The Ludovico tear is larger than normal, but does not gain size from damage as much as normal tears.']]

name: Cricket's Head
description: Increases [[Damage]] by 0.5, and increases damage multiplier by x1.5.
effects: [['+0.5 [[Damage]].'], ['x1.5 Damage multiplier.']]
notes: [['The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from {{i|Magic Mushroom}}, from the combination of {{i|The Book of Belial}} and {{i|Blood of the Martyr}}, or itself (by using an item such as {{i|Diplopia}}, for example). However, it will stack with any other multipliers, such as {{i|Sacred Heart}}.']]

name: Libra
description: Gives 6 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}, 6 {{E|bomb}}s, and 6 {{E|key}}s and balances out all [[attribute]]s.
effects: [["Continually balances Isaac's primary [[attribute]]s - [[damage]], [[range]], [[tears]], and [[speed]] (has no effect on [[luck]], [[shot speed]], {{dlc|nr}} or [[tear falling speed]]).", ["This effect is ''NOT'' one time only - Libra will rebalance Isaac's attributes whenever they are changed by an item, effect, etc. including temporary effects such as the {{i|The Book of Belial}}."]], ['Grants 6 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}, 6 {{E|bomb}}s, and 6 {{E|key}}s.']]
notes: [['The balancing is based on [[Isaac]] as the character himself; he gains no bonuses or penalties to any stats from simply having Libra on its own.'], ["The game calculates Isaac's speed, range, tear delay, and damage before using them in Libra's balancing formula. This has the following notable effects:", ["{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac's Speed or Tear delay are already at their internal soft caps (2.00 and 5 respectively), items that increase them specifically will give no stats.", ["The only exception would be items that decrease tear delay, and then only if Isaac's tear delay isn't at the hard cap of 1."], "{{dlc|r}} If Isaac's tears stat has reached the soft cap corresponding to 5 [[fire rate]], basic tears ups no longer add bonuses, only direct tear delay upgrades will. Likewise, direct fire rate increases have no effect if the absolute maximum of 120 has been reached.", ['Speed adjustments, despite the stat being bounded between 0.1 and 2.0, always have an effect.'], "{{Dlc|r}} Speed and range will positively scale as they increase; the higher these stats already are upon receiving a boost to either one, the bigger the boost to the rest of Isaac's stats. Range scales especially quickly, making large range upgrades like {{I|My Reflection}} and {{I|Tiny Planet}} very powerful with Libra.", "Items that apply multipliers to Isaac's tear delay ({{i|Mutant Spider}}, {{i|Brimstone}}, {{i|Dr. Fetus}}, etc.) can be fired more rapidly with less damage.", 'Damage upgrades become less effective. In return, speed and range upgrades now increase damage and tears.', "Items that affect the stats of Isaac's tears after they're fired ({{i|A Lump of Coal}}, {{i|Blood Clot}}, {{i|Proptosis}}, etc.) do not go through the balancing formula and work as normal."]], ["{{dlc|nr}} Libra's balancing formula values tear delay higher than the other stats and damage less than the other stats. This makes standard tears ups give more stats than a standard range or speed up, and standard damage ups give less stats than a standard range or speed up."], ["{{dlc|r}} Generally speaking, if an item increases Isaac's damage per second, Isaac will receive a stat bonus. If the item lowers fire rate and increases damage, or vice versa, in a way that results in loss of DPS, Isaac's stats will go down."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Since tear falling speed is not involved in the calculations, items such as {{i|Mini Mush}} or {{i|Kidney Stone}} that increase tear falling speed but lower range are mostly detrimental.'], ['Stat upgrade [[pills]] have more utility, providing bonuses long after their stat could be usefully increased.', ["In order of effectiveness, the pills are: ''Range'', ''Tears'', then ''Speed Up''.", '{{I|Placebo}} with stat upgrade pills provides a constant source of stat increases.']]]

name: 1up!
description: Gives Isaac an extra life. Upon death, he will respawn in the most recent non-hostile room with full health, after which 1up! will disappear.
effects: [['Gives Isaac an extra life. Upon death, he will respawn in the most recent non-hostile room with full health, after which 1up! will disappear.', ["If Isaac has no Red Heart Containers, he'll respawn with a Half [[Soul Heart]] instead."]], ["The 1up! mushroom begins following Isaac like a familiar upon pickup, but doesn't do anything. It disappears when its life is used up."], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [['Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. 1up! is {{dlc|nr}} 1st {{dlc|r}} 2nd in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus|n}}.'], ['{{c|???}} / {{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted ???}} / {{c|Tainted Bethany}} / {{c|Tainted Forgotten}} will each respawn with 3 {{e|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc+|a+}} {{c|The Forgotten}} will respawn with 3 filled {{e|Bone Heart}}s and {{c|The Soul}} with whatever Soul and Black Hearts he had on death.', ['Dying as The Soul respawns him with a Half Soul Heart and The Forgotten with whatever Bone Hearts he had on death.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Dark Judas}} / {{c|Tainted Judas}} will respawn with 2 {{e|Black Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Jacob}} will respawn in his ghost form if he had been turned into his ghost form before dying.']]

description:
Isaac fires two tears at once, one from each eye.
{{dlc|r}} 0.75x [[damage]] multiplier.
effects: [['Isaac fires two tears at once, one from each eye.'], ['{{dlc|r}} 0.75x [[damage]] multiplier.']]
notes: [['Unlike other multiple shot items like {{i|Mutant Spider}} or {{i|The Inner Eye}}, 20/20 does not reduce the rate of fire.'], ['The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating 20/20, {{i|The Inner Eye}}, {{i|Mutant Spider}} and {{i|The Wiz}} is 16, or 20 with the {{C|Keeper}}.']]

name: 3 Dollar Bill
description:
{{dlc|na}} Gives Isaac a random tear effect every room.
{{dlc|a}} Gives Isaac a random tear effect every few seconds.
notes: [['{{dlc|na}} If a run is quit, and then continued, 3 Dollar Bill will have a new random tear effect for the current room.'], ["Items that are required to charge like {{i|Brimstone}} or {{i|Monstro's Lung}} can have their charge amount change when gaining a new tear effect, depending on Isaac's new [[Tears]] stat. This can cause fully-charged items to need more charge time."], ['{{dlc|na+}} The {{i|Proptosis}} effect is bugged for 3 Dollar Bill, and will only fire half the range it would normally (damage is increased normally).'], ['{{dlc+|a}} Unlike {{i|Fruit Cake}}, which can only modify individual tears, 3 Dollar Bill can modify stats as well.{{dlc-}}']]

name: 9 Volt
description: Reduces the charge of any [[activated item]] by 1. Any 1 charge items instead have timed recharges.
effects: [["Fully charges the current activated item upon 9 Volt's first pickup."], ['If the current activated item has a recharge time of more than 1 bar, then it will grant 1 bar of charge whenever the item is activated.'], ['If the current activated item has a recharge time of 1 bar, then it will change the item to have a timed recharge of 15 seconds. The recharging of the item only triggers so long as there are enemies present in the room in any fashion. Empty rooms do not cause recharging to start.'], ['If the current activated item already has a timed recharge, 9 Volt makes it start at half charge when used, effectively halving the time to recharge and allowing quicker reuse.']]
notes: [['Enemies generated through a {{Machine|Slot Machine}}, {{Machine|Shell Game}}, {{Machine|Hell Game}}, {{Machine|Rotten Beggar}} or breaking Urns/Skulls will restart the charging process, even though a cleared room still counts as cleared if enemies are spawned in it.']]

name: Ball of Tar
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[slow]]ing tears. Isaac leaves a trail of [[Creep#Black Creep|slowing]] [[creep]] behind as he moves, impeding enemies' speed.
effects: [['Adds a chance to shoot [[slow]]ing tears, reducing the speed of enemy movement and any projectiles they fire.'], ['Isaac leaves a trail of [[slow]]ing [[Black creep]].']]
notes: [["The probability of shooting a slowing tear depends on Isaac's [[luck]], going up to 100% at 18 luck."]]

name: The Battery
description: [[Activated collectible]]s can store an extra level of charge, allowing them to be used twice in one room.
effects: [['[[Items#Activated_Collectibles|Activated items]] can store an extra level of charge, allowing them to be used twice in one room.', ['Extra charges appear in yellow over the normal charge meter.']]]
notes: [['The Battery does not affect self-recharging activated items.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Self-recharging active items can charge the yellow meter, allowing Isaac to use them twice immediately.']], ["{{dlc|r}} If the recharge time of Isaac's held item is less than 6 and he picks up a {{E|Lil' Battery}}, it'll overcharge the item for the remaining charges left in the Lil' Battery."]]

name: The Belt
description: Increases [[speed]] by 0.3.

name: The Black Bean
description: When taking damage, Isaac farts, causing [[poison]] damage to all enemies in range.
effects: [['When taking damage, Isaac farts, dealing poison damage to all enemies in range, {{dlc|r}} as well as knocking them back and pushing away nearby projectiles.', ['The initial fart deals 5 damage and the poison deals 21 damage over time.', ["{{dlc|a}} The damage over time is Isaac's tear damage for 6 ticks."]]]]

name: Blood Bag
description: Grants one filled [[Red Heart container]], restores 4 {{E|Red Heart}}s, and increases [[speed]] by 0.3.
effects: [['Grants one full [[Red Heart container]].'], ['Restores 4 {{E|Red Heart}}s.'], ['+0.3 [[speed]].']]
notes: [['This item can be found and picked up multiple times when generated by a {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}.']]

name: Blood Clot
description:
{{dlc|nr}}Tears fired from the left eye have +1 flat [[damage]], +5 [[range]], and +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}}Tears fired from the left eye have +1 flat [[damage]] and +2.75 [[range]].
effects: [['+1 flat [[damage]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +2.75 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].']]
notes: [['The damage bonus is unaffected by both positive and negative damage multipliers.'], ['{{C|Azazel}} has a chance to fire a beam with the damage bonus. His range is unaffected.'], ['{{C|Cain}} has a 50% chance of firing a shot with the effects of Blood Clot whenever he fires since he can only shoot from his right eye.'], ['{{C|The Forgotten}} has a chance for Blood Clot effects to apply to his melee or ranged attack. When Blood Clot effects are applied the bone will turn red. When throwing the bone club, his range seems to be unaffected.'], ['Every other set of tears {{C|Keeper}} fires contains the Blood Clot effect.'], ['{{i|Chemical Peel}} applies to the same eye and the effects stack.', ['Generally, every interaction and synergy that applies to Blood Clot also applies to Chemical Peel. See its page for a full list, with only differences listed here.']]]

name: Bloody Lust
description: Increases Isaac's [[damage]] whenever he takes damage, up to six times. The bonus resets when entering a new floor.
effects: [['[[Damage]] increases as Isaac receives damage. The damage increase stays for the whole floor, but resets upon entering a new floor.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The first three times Isaac is hit, his damage is increased by 0.5. The next three times Isaac is hit, his damage is increased by 33%.', ['{{dlc|r}} Damage is increased by flat amounts: +0.5 for the first hit and an additional +0.2 for each hit, until +1.5 at the sixth. The maximum total is +6.0.'], 'Any damage taken past the sixth hit does not further increase damage.']], ['Isaac becomes redder as his damage increases.']]
notes: [['{{C|Samson}} starts with this item by default.']]

name: Blood of the Martyr
description: Increases [[damage]] by 1, and turns Isaac's tears into blood tears.
effects: [["Increases [[damage]] by 1, and turns Isaac's tears into blood tears."]]

name: Bob's Curse
description: Gives 5 {{E|bomb}}s and grants Isaac's bombs a [[poison]] effect. {{dlc|r}} Gives Isaac immunity to poison.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["Grants all of Isaac's bombs a [[poison]] effect."], ['{{dlc|r}} The bombs leave a lingering green poison cloud after exploding.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Gives Isaac immunity to poison effects such as those from destroying [[Mushroom (Obstacle)|Mushrooms]] and {{E|Sick Boom Fly|n}}.'], ['{{transf|Bob|item}}']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Super Sloth}}.']]

name: Bobby-Bomb
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Bombs gain a [[Tear Effects#Homing|homing]] effect, slowly moving towards the nearest enemy.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ['Bombs home in on enemies.']]
notes: [['This item can make bombing out of rooms difficult, as the bombs may slide towards enemies and away from the door.']]

name: Bomb Bag
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{E|bomb}} every 3 rooms.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{E|bomb}} every 3 rooms.', ['The first drop happens after 2 rooms.', 'The bomb dropped can be a  {{E|Double bomb}}, {{E|Troll Bomb}}, or a {{E|golden bomb}}.']]]

name: Boom!
description: Grants 10 {{E|bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants 10 {{E|bomb}}s.']]
notes: [['Effectively a much weaker version of {{i|Pyro}}, which grants 99 bombs instead of 10.'], ['Can appear as a pedestal item when using the {{P|0 - The Fool?}} with 10 or more bombs in inventory. Multiple copies can spawn, depending on bomb quantity.']]

name: Box
description: Spawns various [[pickup]]s: 1 {{E|Penny|display=coin}}, 1 {{E|key}}, 1 {{E|bomb}}, 1 {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}, 1 [[card]]/[[rune]], 1 [[pill]] and 1 [[trinket]].
effects: [['Spawns:', ['1 {{E|Penny|display=coin}}', '1 {{E|key}}', '1 {{E|bomb}}', '1 {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}', '1 [[card]]/[[rune]]', '1 [[pill]]', '1 [[trinket]]']]]
notes: [["The Box's [[pickups]] can be of any variety:", ['Coin: Nickel, Dime, Lucky, Sticky Nickel, Golden', 'Bomb: 1+1 Bombs, Troll Bomb, Golden Bomb', 'Heart: Double Heart, Half-Heart, Soul, Half-Soul, Black, Eternal, Gold, Bone, Rotten', 'Key: Golden, Charged Key', 'Card: Reversed Cards', 'Rune: Soul Stones', 'Pill: Horse or Golden pills', 'Trinket: [[Golden Trinket]]']], ['{{Dlc|r}}Dropping this item as {{C|Tainted Isaac}} and picking it back up will not spawn consumables again.']]

name: Breakfast
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]
notes: [['If the [[Treasure_Room_(Item_Pool)|Treasure Room Pool]] runs out of items, it will only contain Breakfast from that point onwards.', ['Once Other [[item pool]]s run out of items, they will only contain Treasure Room Pool items. This means that if the Treasure Room Pool was also exhausted, that item pool will only contain Breakfast.', ['With {{i|Chaos}}, every fully depleted item pool will only contain Breakfast.']]], ['{{dlc+|r}} Breakfast spawned via exhausted item pools cannot be rerolled via {{i|Genesis}}.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Brimstone
description: Tears are replaced by a laser beam that pierces through all enemies and obstacles in its path and deals high damage. Can only be fired after a short charge-up period.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced with a charged blood laser beam. The beam is [[piercing tears|piercing]] and [[spectral tears|spectral]], dealing damage to all enemies and ignoring all obstacles in its path.", ["The laser deals damage equal to Isaac's damage and deals damage each tick.", ['These ticks occur every 1/15th of a second (once every 4 frames). However after the first damage tick, there is an additional pause for ~0.12 seconds (7 frames). Damage ticks work normally after that.', '{{Dlc|nr}} Brimstone ticks 13 times over the course of 0.9 seconds (54 frames).', '{{Dlc|r}} Brimstone ticks 9 times in ~0.63 seconds (38 frames).'], '<math>\\text{Charge Time (s)} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay)}) \\approx \\frac{1}{\\text{Fire Rate}}</math>', '{{Dlc|r}} Starting from 15.00 [[Tears|fire rate]], the beam can last indefinitely as long as fire key is held, and higher fire rate results in higher damage and larger scale.', ['<math>\\text{Damage per Tick} = \\frac{6 \\times \\text{Damage}}{\\text{Tear Delay} + 1} = \\frac{\\text{Damage} \\times \\text{Fire Rate}}{5}</math>']]], ['[[Tears]] down: {{Dlc|nr}} Tear Delay Ã— 3 / {{Dlc|r}} Fire Rate Ã· 3.'], ['{{Transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Brimstone is a [[special item]].'], ["{{C|Azazel}} starts the game with a short-ranged, slower charging version of Brimstone. Without the long-range version, his mini-brimstone won't have enough length to use any homing items.", ["{{Dlc|a}} His Brimstone's shorter range can be increased with range up items or pills."]], ['Multi-shot effects like {{I|20/20}} will increase the number of beams accordingly, with exceptions listed below.', ["Although extremely unlikely, Isaac can shoot a total of 16 blood beams at a time via multi-shot items. If the number of blood beams would exceed this number, the beams' span will instead widen."]], ['The beam will apply [[Tear effects]] and does so frequently thanks to its high tick rate.']]

name: Brother Bobby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around shooting tears that deal 3.5 damage. {{dlc|r}} He shoots more frequently than most familiars.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around shooting tears that deal 3.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Brother Bobby shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Brother Bobby shoots twice per second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Brother Bobby is functionally identical to {{i|Sister Maggy}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Brother Bobby has a higher tear rate than {{i|Sister Maggy}}, whereas Sister Maggy has increased damage.']]

name: Bucket of Lard
description:
{{dlc+|nr}} Grants two empty [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart containers]], heals Isaac for a {{E|Half Red Heart}}, -0.2 [[speed]].{{dlc-}}
{{dlc+|r}} Grants two [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart containers]], heals Isaac for a {{E|Half Red Heart}}, -0.2 [[speed]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Adds 2 empty Red [[Heart container]]s.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Adds 2 full Red [[Heart container]]s.'], ['-0.2 [[speed]].'], ['Heals for a {{E|Half Red Heart}}.']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Super Gluttony}}.']]

name: Bum Friend
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that picks up {{E|Penny|display=coins}} for himself, giving random [[pickup]]s in return. Does not spawn [[collectible]]s.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar who follows Isaac and picks up coins on the ground. (He does not fill up a familiar "slot".)'], ['After picking up 6 coins, Bum Friend will drop a pickup.'], ['After that, Bum Friend has a 67% chance to drop a pickup after picking up 3 coins and a 33% chance to drop a pickup after picking up 4 coins.'], ['{{transf|Super Bum|item}}']]
notes: [['Bum Friend cannot pick up {{e|Sticky Nickel}}s.'], ['Bum Friend can pick up {{e|Lucky Penny|display=Lucky Pennies}}, but it will simply count as a regular Penny and will not grant [[luck]].'], ['From a scoring perspective, Pennies that Bum Friend picks up count towards your [[Schwag bonus]] on daily runs. (only applies to Afterbirth and Afterbirth âœž dailies)']]

name: Cat-O-Nine-Tails
description: +1 [[damage]], +0.23 [[shot speed]].

name: Celtic Cross
description: Grants a chance to trigger the {{i|Book of Shadows}} effect upon taking damage, creating a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 7 seconds.
effects: [['Grants a chance to trigger the {{i|Book of Shadows}} effect upon taking damage, creating a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 7 seconds.']]
notes: [['The base chance of creating the protective shield is 20%'], ['The activation chance of this item depends on the [[Luck]] stat and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.'], ['The shield negates health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.'], ['Does not prevent Heart Container loss from [[Health Down]] pills or {{r|Devil Room}} Deals.'], ['Does not prevent damage from {{i|IV Bag}}.']]

name: The Compass
description: Reveals the locations and types of all special rooms on the map, except {{r|Secret Room}}s and {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.
effects: [['Reveals the locations and types of all special rooms on the map, except {{r|Secret Room}}s and {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.']]
notes:
[['The following rooms will be revealed if they exist:\n
'], ['{{r|Arcade}}'], ['{{r|Boss Challenge Room}}'], ['{{r|Boss Room}}'], ['{{r|Challenge Room}}'], ['{{r|Clean Bedroom}}'], ['{{r|Curse Room}}'], ['{{r|Dice Room}}'], ['{{r|Dirty Bedroom}}'], ['{{r|Library}}'], ['{{r|Mini-Boss Room}}'], ['{{r|Planetarium}}'], ['{{r|Sacrifice Room}}'], ['{{r|Shop}}'], ['{{r|Treasure Room}}'], ['{{r|Vault}}\n
'], ['When combined with {{i|Blue Map}} and {{i|Treasure Map}}, the entire floor is revealed, identical to the effect of {{i|The Mind}}.'], ['The Compass will reveal if {{E|Greed}} / {{E|Super Greed}} had replaced the {{r|Shop}} by displaying a {{r|Mini-Boss Room}} icon alongside the Shop icon. It might also reveal if Greed is present in a {{r|Secret Room}}, and thus, the location of the Secret Room itself.']]

name: The Common Cold
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[poison|poison tears]], dealing damage over time when inflicted.
effects: [['Adds a chance to shoot [[poison|poison tears]], dealing damage over time when inflicted.', ['{{dlc|na}} The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.', "{{dlc|a}} The poison hits 3 times, dealing a total of 3x Isaac's damage.", "{{Dlc|r}} The poison hits 2 times, dealing a total of 2x Isaac's damage."]]]
notes: [['The chance for a tear to be poisoned depends on the [[luck]] stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(4 - (Luck / 4)). At base luck (0), the chance is 25%, maxing out at 100% at 12 luck.', ["Due to how this formula works, increases in activation rate are only seen with every 4 points of luck, as this formula rounds down after dividing Isaac's luck by 4."]]]

name: Chocolate Milk
description: Grants charged tears that deal greater damage when fully charged.
effects: [['Grants charged tears that deal greater damage when fully charged.', ['Tear damage scales from approximately 10% damage at a minimum charge to 400% damage at full charge.', 'The numbers above occur with very high tear delay. A high tears stat can increase the minimum damage dealt, but decreases the maximum damage dealt.', "{{Dlc|r}} At 30.00 fire rate or above (0 tear delay or lower), charging is no longer needed. Higher fire rate results in higher tear damage. At 120.00 fire rate, tears deal 4x Isaac's damage."]], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears down: Delay'], ['2.5.']]

name: Chemical Peel
description: Tears fired from the left eye have +2 flat [[damage]].
effects: [["+2 flat [[damage]] to tears fired from Isaac's left eye."]]
notes: [['The damage bonus is unaffected by both positive and negative damage multipliers.'], ['{{C|Cain}} has a 50% chance of firing a shot with the effects of Chemical Peel whenever he fires.'], ['{{i|Blood Clot}} applies to the same eye and the effects stack.', ['Generally every interaction and synergy that applies to Chemical Peel also applies to Blood Clot. See its page for any differences to what is listed here.']]]

name: Charm of the Vampire
description: Heals Isaac for a {{E|Half Red Heart}} for every 13 [[Monsters|enemies]] killed. {{dlc|r}} +0.3 [[damage]].
effects: [['Restores a {{E|Half Red Heart}} for every 13 [[Monsters|enemies]] killed.'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.3 [[damage]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc|a}} As {{C|Keeper}} and {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, [[Health#Coin Hearts|coin hearts]] can be restored with this item.'], ['The healing effect is useless for characters that cannot use Red hearts.', ['{{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Bethany}} will gain one blood charge when it activates.']], ['{{E|Shopkeeper}}s count as an enemy.'], ["{{dlc|r}} This item removes Isaac's reflections in the water/blood visible in some floors."], ['The healing counter also applies to enemies killed by familiars.']]

name: Champion Belt
description: Increases [[damage]], but also increases the chance of [[champion]] enemies appearing.
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ['Increases the chance for [[champion|champion enemies]] to appear by 15%.']]
notes: [['While more champions likely mean a tougher run, players will also profit from a higher amount of [[pickups]] available to them, thanks to many champions dropping items upon death.'], ['The belt does not affect the appearance rate of champion [[boss]]es.'], ["This is one of the only raw DMG up's in the [[Shop (Item Pool)|shop item pool]]."], ['{{dlc|a+}} The chance for champions to appear does not increase in {{s|The Void}}.']]

name: Ceremonial Robes
description: Grants 3 {{E|Black Heart}}s, and +1 [[damage]].
effects: [['Grants 3 {{E|Black Heart}}s.'], ['+1 [[damage]].']]
notes: [['When purchased at a {{r|Devil Room}} by {{c|???}} (or another character who has lost all Red Heart containers) this item effectively converts 3 {{E|Soul Heart}}s into 3 {{E|black heart}}s, increasing damage at no downside.']]

name: A Dollar
description: Gives Isaac 100 {{E|penny|display=Pennies}}.
effects: [['Gives Isaac 100 {{E|penny|display=Pennies}}.', ['This does not extend past the normal cap of 99.']]]
notes: [['The Dollar can only be found from a {{M|Slot Machine}}, as a starting item for {{c|Eden}}, or using {{i|Spindown Dice}} on {{i|Boom!}}.'], ['Rerolling this item with the {{i|D4}}, etc., will not remove the coins acquired.'], ['Multiple copies of A Dollar can be found in the same run from different Slot Machines.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Since the normal coin cap is 99, the full 100 coins can only be seen if Isaac has {{i|Deep Pockets|n}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The item cannot be crafted using {{i|Bag of Crafting|n}}.'], ['When {{P|Soul of Jacob and Esau}} is used, this item is given to Esau, as there are no alternative items for it based on [[Item Pool]]s, resulting in you getting 99 coins again.']]

name: Cube of Meat
description: Creates an [[orbital familiar]]. Collecting additional copies gives it the ability to shoot tears, then chase enemies to deal contact damage, then deal even more contact damage.
effects: [['Spawns an [[Orbital Familiar]] around Isaac which blocks shots and deals contact damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} It deals 105 damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 53 damage per second.']], ["Each subsequent Cube of Meat obtained are combined with the first one (increasing its 'level'), changing its characteristics:", ['Level 2: Gives the orbital the ability to shoot tears that deal 3.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} It shoots once every second.', '{{dlc|r}} It shoots once every 0.73 seconds.'], 'Level 3: Changes it from an orbital to a Meat Boy that chases nearby enemies dealing contact damage.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} It deals 7 contact damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 12.5 contact damage per second.'], 'Level 4: Increases the size of the Meat Boy larger and increases its damage.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} It deals 11 contact damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 25 contact damage per second.'], 'The fifth Cube of Meat will create a new Level 1 cube, and start the cycle again.']]]
notes: [['Multiple Cubes of Meat can be collected in a single run.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The orbital orbits Isaac significantly faster.'], ['{{e|Famine}}, {{e|Pestilence}}, {{e|War}}, and {{e|Death}} will always drop either a {{i|Ball of Bandages}} or Cube of Meat. After the first one drops, further Harbingers will only drop that same one and never the other for the duration of the run.'], ["The ticking rate for Meat Boys' contact damage causes them to often deal damage twice once they touch an enemy, making their first second of DPS up to 1.5x higher than normal."]]

name: Cupid's Arrow
description: Grants Isaac [[piercing tears]] that travel through enemies (but not obstacles) instead of breaking on impact with them.
effects: [['Grants [[piercing tears]] that travel through enemies (but not obstacles) instead of breaking on impact with them.']]

name: Daddy Longlegs
description: Daddy Long Legs' shadow follows Isaac and occasionally stomps enemies for 40 damage total.
effects: [["Daddy Long Legs' shadow follows Isaac and stomps on enemies for 20 damage per tick, with each stomp capable of hitting a single enemy twice for a total of 40 damage. The delay between stomps is approximately 4 seconds."], ['In a room with multiple enemies, Daddy Long Legs will prioritize on monsters with the most health first.', ['If all monsters are of the same type, the familiar will attack the closest enemy.']], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['The foot stays down for about 1 second, and enemies who wander into it will also take damage.'], ['This item deals enough damage to kill most early enemies in one hit and is especially powerful against enemies with multiple segments like {{E|Larry Jr.}}']]

name: Dead Bird
description: After Isaac takes damage, spawns a flying [[familiar]] that chases enemies for the current [[Rooms|room]], dealing ~5 damage per second.
effects: [['Taking damage summons a [[familiar]] that chases enemies for the remainder of the current [[Rooms|room]], dealing 2 damage per tick (~4.3 damage per second).']]
notes: [['{{C|Eve}} starts with this item by default.']]

name: Dead Cat
description: Sets Isaac's [[Red Heart Container]]s to 1, but grants 9 extra lives. After dying, Isaac respawns with 1 Red Heart Container.
effects: [["Sets Isaac's Red [[Heart container]]s to 1.", ['Does not remove {{E|Soul Heart}}s or {{E|Black Heart}}s unless picked up as {{C|???}}, {{dlc|a+}} {{c|The Soul}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{c|Tainted ???}}, {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}, or {{C|Tainted Bethany}}.', '{{dlc|a+}} Does not remove {{E|Bone Heart|n}}s unless picked up as {{c|The Forgotten}}.']], ['Grants 9 extra lives.'], ['Upon death:', ['Isaac respawns in the previous room with 1 Red [[Heart container]].', "{{dlc|nr}} Any active items in Isaac's possession will lose all its charges."]], ["The head of Guppy begins following Isaac like a familiar upon pickup but doesn't do anything.", ['When Isaac has lost all of the lives provided by this item, the Guppy familiar will disappear.']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{e|Super Pride}}.'], ["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Dead Cat is {{dlc|nr}} 2nd / {{dlc|r}} 4th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, and {{c|Lazarus|r}}' inherent extra life."], ['{{dlc|na}} Picking this item up as {{c|The Lost}} does not show the number of lives remaining, but still functions normally.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} If picked up as {{c|The Forgotten}}, his Bone Hearts are reduced to 1 but {{c|The Soul}}'s Soul Hearts remain unaffected. The reverse is also true."], ['The lives are added after the "picking up an item" animation has ended, so characters that die while the animation is playing will not be revived by this item.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The effects of the {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, {{i|Missing No.}}, or a 1- or 6-pip {{r|Dice Room}} will not remove the lives granted by this item.'], ['Additional Dead Cats can be picked up during a run, increasing lives well past 9. {{dlc|nr}} Only the first dead cat counts toward becoming Guppy.\n<!--'], ['Picking up Dead Cat when the player has 0 Red Heart containers and greater than 11 Soul Hearts can cause the player to go over the normal 12 cap by up to 1 heart temporarily. (cannot reproduce, can anyone provide insight?)-->'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} This item counts as 9 items, so if Isaac is trying for an early portal to {{s|The Void}} after beating {{E|Mom}}, this will significantly boost the progress closer to 20 items.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If {{c|Jacob and Esau}} take the item, only the brother who takes it will be set to one Red Heart Container on pickup. But if they die, both are resurrected with one Red Heart Container.'], ['{{dlc|r}} If {{c|Tainted Jacob}} takes this item after being touched by {{E|Dark Esau|n}}, he will return to his previous Red Heart total upon reaching the next floor.', ['Dying as Tainted Jacob after being touched by Dark Esau and carrying this item will respawn him in the previous room in his lost form. Making it to the next floor will still return him to his previous Red Heart total.']], ['{{dlc|r}} During the {{E|The Beast|n}} sequence, Isaac is respawned on the spot upon death, as opposed to doing so in a previous room.']]

name: Dead Dove
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['Useless for {{C|The Lost}} and {{C|Azazel}}, who have spectral tears and flight by default.']]

name: Demon Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and automatically fires at enemies in its reach.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and automatically fires at enemies in its range 3 times per second, dealing 3 damage per shot.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]

name: Dessert
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Dinner
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Distant Admiration
description: Spawns an attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|circles]] further out than {{i|Halo of Flies}}, but closer than {{i|Forever Alone}}, dealing 75 damage per second.
effects: [['Spawns a red attack fly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|that circles around Isaac]], and deals 5 damage per tick or 75 damage per second on contact.', ['The fly circles farther out than regular orbitals, but closer than {{i|Forever Alone}}.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]

name: Dr. Fetus
description: Tears are replaced by {{e|bomb}}s that benefit from bomb-enhancing effects and slide for a fixed time after being fired.
effects: [['Tears are replaced with {{E|bomb}}s that explode approximately one second after being fired.', ["{{Dlc|na}} Each bomb deals 3 times the character's normal [[Damage|tear damage]].", "{{Dlc|anr}} Each bomb deals 5 times the character's normal tear damage plus a flat 30 damage. The flat 30 is not affected by damage multipliers.", "{{Dlc|r}} Dr. Fetus has two formulas for calculating the damage it does. At first, each bomb deals 10 times the character's normal tear damage. If the previous formula would lead to the bombs doing more than 60 damage, the bombs instead deal 5 times the character's normal tear damage plus a 30 flat damage. The flat 30 is not affected by damage multipliers.", '[[Tears]] down: {{Dlc|nr}} Tear Delay Ã— 2.5 / {{Dlc|r}}Fire Rate Ã· 2.5.', 'The [[range]] and [[shot speed]] stats both affect the velocity at which the bombs are fired out. Delay before the explosion is not affected by either.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bomb velocity formula has not been updated to account for the new [[range]] stat so it uses [[tear height]] for calculation (and not the actual range stat), resulting in range stat effectively not working for Dr. Fetus with exceptions being {{I|Number One}}, {{I|Kidney Stone}}, {{i|Pluto}}, and {{i|Inner Child}}'s revive, which make velocity absurdly low."], '{{Dlc|r}} Bombs grow larger or smaller with tear size modifiers and deal no knockback to each other.', ['{{I|Angelic Prism}} Split bombs still deal knockback to each other.', '{{I|Brimstone Bombs}} The brimstone beams deal knockback to other bombs.']]]]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Dr. Fetus is a [[special item]].'], ['R U A Wizard? Does not affect Dr. Fetus.'], ['Dr. Fetus overrides multiple [[tear effect]] items, but benefit from some (but not all) bomb-enhancing effects like {{I|Mr. Mega}}.', ['{{Dlc|a}} Many more synergies have been added, and all passive bomb modifiers affect Dr. Fetus.']], ['Dr. Fetus bombs deal half a heart of damage to Isaac. Other explosion damage is not affected.', ['Self-damage is increased to a full heart if the bomb would deal 85 damage or more. This includes effects from bomb modifiers, not just raw base damage.']]]

name: E. Coli
description: Enemies that touch Isaac are transformed into {{E|poop}}.
effects: [['Enemies that touch Isaac are transformed into {{E|poop}}.'], ['{{transf|Oh Crap|item}}']]
notes: [['Bosses cannot be turned into poop.'], ['Poop created by this item is not grid-aligned, and flashes red when hit, similar to damaging [[monster]]s.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Poops produced by E. Coli crumble upon being attacked, identically to regular poops.']], ['If you touch the middle section of a {{E|Grub}} with E. Coli, it will then split and become two heads (rather than destroying and spawning {{E|Maggot}}s).'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{E|Mulliboom}}s can be turned into poop without taking damage.'], ['The poops vanish if the room is left and then returned to.'], ['{{dlc+|anr}} Poops created by E. Coli do not heal Isaac when he has the {{transf|Oh Crap}} transformation.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Poops created by E. Coli heal Isaac when he has the {{transf|Oh Crap}} transformation.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Forever Alone
description: Spawns an attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] a long distance from Isaac, dealing 30 damage per second.
effects: [['Spawns a blue attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] a long distance from Isaac and deals 2 damage per tick or 30 damage per second on contact.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Super Envy}}.']]

name: Fate
description: Grants [[flight]] and one {{E|Eternal Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants [[flight]] and one {{E|Eternal Heart}}.']]
notes: [['Taking this item as {{c|Keeper}} will grant [[Blue Flies]] instead of the Eternal Heart.']]

name: Epic Fetus
description: Isaac's tears are replaced with guided missiles, like those used by the {{i|Doctor's Remote}}.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced with guided missiles. Pressing the fire buttons spawns a crosshair that can be moved freely, summoning a missile to its position from above 1.5 seconds later.", ["Missiles deal 20 times Isaac's damage."]]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Epic Fetus is a [[special item]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Epic Fetus overrides most items in the game and has the highest priority of all tear modifiers, over {{i|Brimstone}} and {{i|Mom's Knife}}."], ["Isaac's tear delay determines how quickly a new (set of) missile(s) can be fired after the previous one has landed. Barring very high tear delay, this has little effect on damage rate due to the delay of the missiles themselves."], ['Missiles benefit from some bomb modifier items, though at a lesser scale compared to {{i|Dr. Fetus}}.'], ["Stacking multiple copies of the item causes a barrage of missiles in quick succession without resetting the crosshair's position, up to sixteen at a time."], ['Epic Fetus missiles usually deal a full heart of damage to Isaac.', ['Self-damage is only half a heart if the missile would deal less than 85 damage. In practice this is not common, as even a small damage stat increase will cause the missiles to go over the critical damage level.']]]

name: Gemini
notes: [['Status effects will equally affect both Contusion and Suture even if it was only applied to one of them. This includes effects granting knockback such as {{i|Knockout Drops}}.', ['This also applies to Green Champion Gemini despite the twins being completely separated entities.']]]

name: Leo
description: Isaac can destroy [[rock]]s by walking into them.
effects: [['Isaac can break [[obstacle]]s by walking into them.'], ["Increases Isaac's size."], ['{{transf|Stompy|item}}']]
notes: [['Walking into [[Bomb Rock]]s will cause them to explode.'], ['[[Mushroom (Obstacle)|Mushrooms]] may hurt Isaac with a poison cloud if walked into.'], ['[[Polyp]]s may hurt Isaac with blood shots or red creep if walked into.'], ['[[Flight]] does not prevent the effect from occurring.'], ['Holes in the ground can be filled if Isaac walks into adjacent rocks from the right direction, similar to bombs.'], ['{{E|TNT}} Barrels will not be destroyed or explode on contact, however {{E|Movable TNT}} Barrels will explode and may deal damage to Isaac if walked into.'], ['Allows Isaac to walk over and destroy {{E|Red Poop}} without taking damage. Isaac will still take damage if he is standing on it when it reforms.'], ['Walking into an Angel Statue in the {{R|Angel Room}} will trigger the boss fight, and Isaac will take damage as the Angel spawns on top of him.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} Nullifies effects of One Makes You Small [[pill]]s, One Makes You Larger pills, and other items which decrease size, such as {{i|Caffeine Pill}} and {{i|Binky|n}}.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} [[Rocks#Spiked Rocks|Spiked Rocks]] can be destroyed, but depending on Isaac's size, angle and velocity they may still hurt him."]]

name: The Ladder
description: Allows Isaac to walk across gaps one square across by automatically placing a ladder between the two walkable sections.
effects: [['Allows Isaac to walk across gaps one square across by automatically placing a ladder between the two walkable sections. Enemies can not walk over the ladder.']]

name: Jesus Juice
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[damage]], +0.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[damage]], +0.375 [[range]].

name: Ipecac
description: Replaces tears with explosive and [[poison]]ing projectiles fired in an arc from the mouth.
effects: [['Replaces tears with explosive and [[poison]]ing projectiles fired in an arc.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Tears down - (Delay'], ['2) + 10'], ['{{dlc|r}} 1/3 Fire Rate'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tear Falling Speed]] is set to 13.'], ['+40 flat damage (See [[Damage#Effective Damage|Effective Damage]])'], ['Tear size multiplier: 0.4x'], ['{{dlc|r}} -0.2 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Minor range down.'], ['{{transf|Bob|item}}']]
notes: [['Enemies within the blast radius of an Ipecac explosion will also be [[poison|poisoned]].'], ['The damage boost mitigates the very small tear size multiplier.'], ["Ipecac's damage bonus does not apply to [[Burn]] or [[Poison]] fully; only {{Dlc|nr}}+4/{{Dlc|r}}+2 is applied to their damage per tick."], ["Character damage multipliers do not apply to Ipecac's flat bonus."], ['Since explosions that deal less than 85 damage hurt Isaac for half a heart, Ipecac shots usually hurt Isaac for half a heart.', ['Self-damage is increased to a full heart with 85 or higher damage stat.']], ['Explosions that deal more than or equal to {{dlc|nr}} 100/{{dlc|r}} 166 damage shake the screen.'], ["{{dlc|r}} The height of the shots scales with range. At base stats, Ipecac shots won't be able to fly over obstacles, but the more range ups Isaac gets, the higher shots will be launched."], ["{{dlc|r}} It is possible that with low shot speed and high range/tear height, Isaac won't be able to hit obstacles up close with Ipecac shots."], ['{{dlc|nr}} The range of the explosion is a circle roughly 3 blocks in diameter, regardless of damage.', ["As Ipecac's explosion range does not scale with tear size, with enough tear size increasing items (e.g. {{I|Death's Touch}}), it can become nearly impossible to hit enemies with Ipecac's explosions."]], ["{{dlc|r}} Ipecac's explosion range increases with tear size."], ['Using Ipecac in a {{R|Crawl Space}} will cause the tear to bounce off the ceiling, bounce off the floor at a low height, and eventually explode. The same applies to using it on a Crawl Space wall.']]

name: The Inner Eye
description: Grants triple shot but decreases [[tears]].
effects: [['Isaac fires a spread of three tears at once.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears down: (Delay'], ['2.1) + 3', ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears fired per second']], ['0.51.']]
notes: [['The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating {{i|20/20}}, The Inner Eye, {{i|Mutant Spider}} and {{i|The Wiz}} is 16, or 20 with {{C|Keeper}}.']]

name: Infestation
description:
{{dlc|nr}} 1-3 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn every time Isaac gets hit.
{{dlc|r}} 2-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn every time Isaac gets hit.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} 1-3 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn whenever Isaac takes damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} 2-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn whenever Isaac takes damage.']]

name: Hot Bombs
description: Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs leave behind fire that damages enemies upon contact.
effects: [['Isaac gains +5 {{e|Bomb}}s on pickup.'], ['Placed bombs deal damage to enemies on contact and will leave behind a fire that damages enemies on contact upon exploding for 10 seconds.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The fire does 22 damage per tick (66 damage per second).', '{{dlc|r}} The fire can block four shots and/or deal four ticks of contact damage before expiring. It deals 23 damage at full durability, 17.25 damage after taking one hit, and 11.5 damage otherwise for a maximum damage of 63.25 damage.', "Fire from a Hot Bomb doesn't damage Isaac.", '{{dlc|nr}} Bombs deal 1 point of contact damage to enemies.', '{{dlc|r}} Bombs deal 16 contact damage to enemies.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac can no longer take damage from fire.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac produces a large circle of light, mitigating {{cu|darkness}}.']]
notes: [['If a {{e|Hopper}} touches a Hot Bomb, it will become a {{e|Flaming Hopper}}.'], ["The contact damage does not scale with Isaac's damage and is completely removed if Isaac acquires another bomb item that overrides the flaming bomb graphic such as {{i|Mr. Mega}} or {{i|Glitter Bombs}}."], ['{{e|Big Horn}} will throw Hot Bombs at Isaac that deal contact damage.'], ['If eaten by a boss such as {{e|Chub}}, a Hot Bomb will continously deal damage to the boss until it explodes.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Negates the damage from the floor of lava in {{e|The Beast|n}}'s chamber, but not from its fire inhalation attack."]]

name: Holy Grail
description: Grants [[flight]] and one Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals an additional {{E|Red Heart}}
effects: [['Grants [[flight]] and one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|red heart}}']]

name: Harlequin Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires two tears at once in a V-pattern.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires two tears at once in a V-pattern which deal 4 damage each.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Harlequin Baby shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Harlequin Baby shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]

name: Halo of Flies
description: Spawns two [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]] that block enemy shots and deal contact damage to flies.
effects: [['Spawns two [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]] that block enemy shots.', ['Pretty flies kill some [[fly]] enemies upon contact.', 'The orbital limit of three flies cannot be surpassed with this item, reducing its effectiveness if Isaac has two or more orbitals.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['Orbital flies can also be obtained by other means, such as {{m|Slot Machine}}s and [[pill|Pretty Fly]] pills.'], ['The following types of flies are instantly killed when they come in contact with the orbitals:', ['{{e|Army Fly}}', '{{e|Attack Fly}}', '{{e|Dart Fly}}', '{{e|Fly}}', '{{e|Hush Fly}}', '{{e|Moter}}', '{{e|Pooter}}', '{{e|Ring Fly}}', '{{e|Super Pooter}}', '{{e|Swarm}}']]]

name: The Halo
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.25 [[range]], +0.3 [[speed]], and +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.375 [[range]], and +0.3 [[speed]]. Heals 1 additional {{e|red heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Red Heart container|Heart container]].', ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|red heart}}.']], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]

name: Habit
description: When Isaac is hit, his active item gains 1 room's worth of charge.
effects: [["When Isaac is hit, his active item gains 1 room's worth of charge."]]

name: Guppy's Tail
description: [[Room Clear Awards]] have a 1/3 chance of being replaced with a {{E|Chest}} and a 2/9 chance being replaced with nothing.
effects: [['Grants a 1/3 chance of replacing [[Room Clear Awards]] with a {{E|Chest}} or a {{E|Locked Chest}}, but also a 2/9 chance to replace it with nothing at all.', ['{{dlc|a}} The effect does not apply to {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} dropped in [[Greed Mode]].']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["The drawback to this item is that Keys become much more scarce, while increasing the amount of Locked Chests. This makes taking Guppy's Tail a potential liability early on."], ["Due to any found Chests containing [[item]]s while in {{s|Chest}} or {{s|Dark Room}}, Guppy's Tail can be a good way to quickly stack up more upgrades before facing the final boss."], ['This item has no effect in [[Greed Mode]] other than counting towards the Guppy Transformation.']]

name: Guppy's Hair Ball
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that loosely follows behind Isaac, which blocks shots can be swung like a flail to damage enemies. Grows bigger by killing enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a hairball [[familiar]] that loosely follows behind Isaac, blocks shots, and can be swung like a flail to damage enemies.', ['The ball deals 5 damage per tick, but grows, increasing damage by 2 each time it kills an enemy â€” up to 5 times for a maximum of 13 damage. The damage it deals per tick (each half-second) is (level Ã— 2) + 3.', 'The hairball level decreases upon entering a new floor: if level 2, it reverts to level 1. If level 3 or 4, it reverts to level 2. If level 5, it reverts to level 3.']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["The hairball's hitbox is the same size regardless of level."], ["{{dlc|na+r}}If Isaac has transformed into {{transf|Guppy}}, Guppy's Hair Ball spawns Blue Flies when it deals damage."], ["If [[Blindfolded]], the ball occasionally spawns a [[Blue Fly]] while it's damaging an enemy.\n== In-game Footage ==\n{{#ev:youtube|sLWq7VX-INU||inline}} {{#ev:youtube|Uw0P9YrkPD8||inline}}"]]

name: Guppy's Collar
description: Grants a permanent 50% chance to respawn with 1/2 of a {{E|Red Heart}} after [[death]].
effects: [['Grants a permanent 50% chance to resurrect on [[death]].', ['Resurrection leaves Isaac at half of a {{E|Red Heart}}, or half a {{E|Soul Heart}} if he had no Red Heart Containers.']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Guppy's Collar is {{dlc|nr}} 4th / {{dlc|r}} 6th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, {{i|Dead Cat|nr}}, {{c|Lazarus|nr}}' inherent extra life ({{dlc|r}} swap the order of the previous two), and {{i|Inner Child}}."], ['It is possible to obtain two collars by finding one in a {{E|Red Chest}}, without picking it up, and then finding another collar in a different Red Chest. {{dlc|nr}} However, this does not have any additional effects and does not count towards transforming into Guppy.', ["{{dlc|r}} Obtaining multiple copies of Guppy's Collar now grants extra lives, depending on how many copies are obtained (obtaining a second collar displays the lives count as '2?', and so on). The chance for Guppy's Collar to activate is defined with separate rolls, but increases the odds for one of the collars to revive Isaac. Additional collars also count towards the Guppy transformation."]], ['Resurrecting in a {{r|Curse Room}} may trap Isaac if he has no way of recovering health or exiting them without losing health.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} Resurrecting via Guppy's Collar during a [[Daily Challenge]] will count as a death, even if the run is eventually completed."]]

name: Guardian Angel
description: Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots, deals 105 damage per second to enemies, and increases the speed of all orbital familiars.
effects: [['Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second ({{dlc|r}} 53 damage per second) on contact.'], ['Increases the speed of all orbital familiars.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}This item belongs to the [[Seraphim (Transformation)|Seraphim]] set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['The increased orbital speed improves odds of being protected from enemy shots.']]

name: Growth Hormones
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[damage]], +0.4 [[speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1 [[damage]], +0.2 [[speed]].

name: Ghost Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires [[spectral tears]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires [[spectral tears]] that deal 3.5 damage each.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Ghost Baby shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Ghost Baby shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['This item has a low chance to spawn from [[Rocks#Skulls|skulls]].']]

name: Infestation 2
description: Spawns allied [[Blue Spider]]s from killed enemies.
effects: [['Spawns an allied [[Blue Spider]] from each enemy that is killed.'], ['{{Dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['Enemies do not spawn Blue Spiders when killed by anything not controlled by Isaac (environmental hazards, charmed enemies, death upon clearing room, etc).'], ['Enemies do not spawn Blue Spiders when killed by Blue Spiders.'], ['Blue Flies can also spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['Enemies killed by [[familiar]]s will spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['Destroying dead {{E|shopkeeper}}s will spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['Killing {{E|Pin}} will give one Blue Spider for each of his segments.'], ['Killing {{E|Chub}} will spawn a lot of Blue Spiders.'], ['Killing a {{E|Homunculus}} or a {{E|Begotten}} will sometimes spawn a Blue Spider for each segment in the chains holding them to the wall.'], ['{{E|Dark Ball}}s spawned by {{E|Little Horn}} can also drop Blue Spiders upon death.']]

name: Piggy Bank
description: Gives 3 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} on pick-up. Every time Isaac is damaged, he will drop one additional penny.
effects: [['Adds 3 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} on pickup.'], ['When Isaac takes damage, there is an equal chance for 1 or 2 Pennies to drop.', ['When held by {{C|Keeper}} or {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, it will drop 0-1 pennies instead.']]]
notes: [['If {{C|Keeper}} or {{C|Tainted Keeper}} collects this item with 1 health coin, it will heal a coin and add 2 coins to his inventory.', ['{{Dlc|r}} If {{C|Keeper}} has unlocked a third health coin, collecting this item may heal 2 health coins and only provide a single coin to his inventory, depending on whether he has 1 health coin remaining or 2.']], ["Unlike the coins dropped from being hit by a shot from a {{E|Keeper}}, {{E|Greed}}, or {{E|Super Greed}}, the coins that are dropped from the piggy bank are not subtracted from Isaac's total."], ['Can appear in the shop and the item room on the same floor, but picking up multiple copies of the item does not cause its effect to stack.'], ['The drops from Piggy Bank, unlike {{t|Swallowed Penny}}, are locked to normal pennies, instead of random types of coins.']]

name: Dark Matter
description: +1 [[damage]], adds a chance to shoot [[fear|fear tears]].
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ['Adds a chance to shoot [[fear|fear tears]], causing enemies to run away from Isaac.']]
notes: [['Fear tear effect depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 20 luck.', ["This makes Dark Matter significantly better at inflicting fear than {{i|Abaddon}} or {{i|Mom's Perfume}}."]]]

name: The Bible
description: On use, Isaac gains [[flight]] for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Instantly kills {{E|Mom}}, {{E|Mom's Heart}}, and {{E|It Lives}} when activated, but kills Isaac when used on {{E|Satan}}.
effects: [['Gives Isaac [[flight]] for the current room.'], ["Instantly kills {{E|Mom}}, {{E|Mom's Heart}}, {{E|It Lives}}, including their {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} variants, upon use."], ['Using The Bible on {{E|Satan}} will kill Isaac instantly upon use.'], ['{{transf|seraphim|item}}'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['Using The Bible on {{E|Isaac}}, {{E|???}}, {{E|The Lamb}}, {{E|Hush}}, {{E|Mega Satan}}, {{E|Delirium}}, {{E|Dogma}}, {{E|The Beast}} or {{E|Mother}} has no special effect and does not kill Isaac.']]

name: Gimpy
description: Gives chance of spawning a {{E|Soul Heart}} when taking damage. Enemies have a chance to drop a {{E|Half Red Heart}} after being killed.
effects: [['When Isaac takes damage, there is a chance that a {{E|Soul Heart}} may spawn.'], ["[[Monster]]s have a chance to drop a {{E|Half Red Heart}} after being killed. Chance depends on killed monster's base health."]]
notes: [["Gimpy's Soul Heart drop chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 50% at 22 Luck."]]

name: Placenta
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], and a chance to regenerate a {{E|Half Red Heart}} of health every minute of gameplay.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] when picked up.'], ['Isaac has a chance to regenerate a {{E|Half Red Heart}} every time the in-game timer hits a new minute (00:01:00, 00:02:00, etc).'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}} when picked up.']]
notes: [['The regeneration can happen multiple times in the same room, so there is no need to move between rooms to continue regeneration.', ["{{dlc|nr}} However, regeneration '''does not occur''' when standing in a {{R|Crawl Space}}."]], ["Regeneration will only occur when Isaac has Red Heart containers or '''something equivalent''':", ["{{c|Keeper}}'s and {{c|Tainted Keeper|r}}'s coin hearts will regenerate, one coin at a time.", '{{E|Bone Heart}}s regenerate like red hearts.', 'Consequently, characters with no applicable health -- {{c|???}}, {{c|The Lost}}, {{c|Dark Judas}}, {{c|Tainted Bethany}}, {{c|Tainted Judas}}, and {{c|Tainted Lost}} -- do not benefit from the effect.']]]

name: Pyromaniac
description: +5 [[bomb]]s. Grants immunity to explosion damage and causes explosions to heal Isaac. {{dlc|r}} Also grants immunity to fire.
effects: [['+5 {{e|Bomb}}s.'], ['All explosions heal Isaac instead of damaging him. If Isaac has no [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart containers]] or full health, no damage is taken.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Explosions heal one full Red Heart.', '{{dlc|r}} Explosions heal one half Red Heart.']], ['{{dlc+|r}} Grants immunity to damage from {{e|Fire Place}}s or enemy fires, but does not heal Isaac.', ['It does not protect the player from taking damage from the {{e|White Fire Place}} in {{s|Downpour}} II, making it still possible to acquire {{i|Knife Piece 1}}.', 'Isaac is immune to the lake of fire in the fight against {{e|The Beast}}, but not to her fire inhalation attack.{{dlc-}}']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Pyromaniac is a [[Special Item]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Makes the player immune to {{e|Mom}}'s, {{e|Satan}}'s, and other enemies' stomp attacks, making those fights substantially less difficult.", ["Due to the immunity to Mom's stomping attack, {{t|Mom's Toenail}} has improved usefulness."]], ["{{dlc|nr}} Makes the player immune to {{e|The Cage}}'s, {{e|The Adversary}}'s, {{e|Mega Satan}}'s, and {{e|Ultra Greedier}}'s rock wave attack."], ['The item is unable to produce {{e|Soul Heart}}s, {{e|Black Heart}}s, or {{e|Eternal Heart}}s, making Pyromaniac a little less effective if used with {{C|???}}, {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|The Lost}}, {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}, or {{C|Tainted Bethany}}. However, these characters still gain immunity to explosions, with {{C|Tainted ???}} benefiting the most out of all.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Makes the player immune to fires left behind by enemies and their hot bombs, as well as projectiles from {{e|Red Fire Place}}s and {{e|Purple Fire Place}}s, but '''not''' the fireplaces themselves."], ['{{e|Ultra Greedier}} uses explosive attacks almost exclusively. As a result, Pyromaniac makes characters nearly invulnerable against him.'], ['One of only two items that grant full immunity to explosive damage, the other being {{i|Host Hat}}.']]

name: Midas' Touch
description: Enemies that touch Isaac are temporarily [[Petrification|petrified]] and turn to gold. Any enemy killed while in this state will drop {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}.
effects: [['Petrifies and turns enemies into gold upon contact with Isaac.', ['Enemies killed while in this state will drop 1-4 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}.', 'When held by  {{C|Keeper}} or  {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, enemies will drop 0-1 pennies instead.']], ['Enemies that make contact with Isaac take damage equal to the number of [[coin]]s he has.', ['{{dlc|r}} The damage is 3.5+0.2']], ["the number of Isaac's coins. The damage caps at 23.30 with 99 coins.", ['Damage is dealt up to twice per second per enemy.']]]
notes: [["With Midas' Touch, some effects that create {{E|Poop}} may instead create {{E|Golden Poop}} (see Synergies for details)."], ["If an enemy doesn't deal contact damage, Midas' Touch can safely be used on it to create extra Pennies. {{E|Fly|display=Flies}}, {{E|Bulb}}, {{E|Mulligan}}, and {{E|Host}} are the most common enemies this can be applied to.", ["If Isaac has 13 coins or more when using Midas' Touch on {{E|Mulligan|display=Mulligans}}, they will die and release flies, hurting Isaac.", 'With {{i|Skatole}}, {{E|Hive}}s and {{E|Swarmer}}s will constantly spawn black flies, meaning they can create endless amounts of coins.', "{{dlc|nr}} As {{E|Mom}}'s foot and {{E|Satan}}'s feet don't deal contact damage, Midas' Touch can be used against them to great effect."]], ['{{dlc|a}} When used against {{E|Ultra Greed}}, his [[Damage scaling|armor]] will be partially impaired to a 25% efficiency.'], ["Spawning Multiplayer [[Babies]] while the player has Midas' Touch will give the Midas' Touch effects (freeze on touch + damage) to the baby itself. This can be abused, considering the baby's invincibility frames upon spawning:", ['Spawn the baby using the Enter key. It is invincible for a short period.', 'During this period, stay in contact with enemies to freeze them and damage them.']], ["This can be used to gather 99 [[coin]]s very quickly, and in turn, deal massive damage with Midas' Touch damage component."], ['{{dlc|r}} Petrified enemies that are [[Freeze|frozen]] will not drop any coins on death.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Midas' Touch can be a great item with {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, as you can run into enemies and get even more coins. Just be careful to not kill yourself."], ["{{dlc|r}} Both Midas' Touch and {{i|E. Coli}} affect {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}'s body, causing enemies that touch the body to freeze and turn into poop respectively."]]

name: Mom's Underwear
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]]. Spawns 3-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] on pickup.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns 3-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] when picked up.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Caffeine Pill
description: Grants +0.3 [[speed]], reduces character size, and gives a random [[pill]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ["Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit."], ['Upon pickup, gives Isaac a random [[pill]]. If he is already holding a consumable, it is forcibly dropped to the ground.']]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} It will still drop a pill even if the player has {{I|Starter Deck}}.']]

name: Screw
description: +0.5 [[tears]], +0.2 [[shot speed]].

name: Soy Milk
description: [[Tears]] are smaller and do much less [[damage]], but fire in very rapid succession.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Reduces [[tear delay]] by the formula: (delay / 4) - 2'], ['{{dlc|r}} Multiplies [[fire rate]] by 5.5x'], ['0.2x [[damage]] multiplier.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} 0.5x tear size multiplier.', ['{{Dlc|r}} -0.3 tear size.']], ["{{dlc|r}} Drastically reduces [[knockback]] from Isaac's tears."], ["{{dlc|r}} Automatically charges and fires charged attacks, such as {{i|Brimstone}}, {{i|Monstro's Lung}}, and {{i|Chocolate Milk}}, providing a different effect per item. Also removes the charge bar on them. See [[#Synergies|Synergies]]."]]
notes: [["At base tear rate, Soy Milk sets the player's tear delay to the game's minimum value of 1, for 15 tears per second. This is much lower than the normal minimum tear delay; see [[tear delay|the tear delay explanation page]]."], ['{{dlc|nr}} At base damage, Soy Milk is a very small DPS up. With a tear delay of 8 or lower, Soy Milk becomes a DPS down. The more tears per second before obtaining Soy Milk, the greater the decrease in DPS.'], ["Soy Milk's damage down stat also significantly decreases tear size."], ['The endless stream of tears effectively increases directional knockback.'], ['Due to the high fire rate, items that cause tears to inflict [[status effect]]s activate more frequently.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Soy Milk is a [[special item]].'], ['Charged items which do not affect tears such as {{dlc|r}} {{i|Maw of the Void}}, {{i|Sumptorium}}, and {{i|Revelation}} are not affected.']]

name: Lunch
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Butter Bean
description: Upon use, Isaac farts and [[knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies {{dlc|a}} and projectiles. {{dlc|r}} Enemies pushed into walls or [[obstacles]] take 12 damage.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac farts and [[knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies.', ['{{dlc|a}} Projectiles are also deflected.', ['{{dlc|r}} Enemies pushed into walls or [[obstacles]] take 10 + 2']]], ['(floor - 1) damage. Projectiles that are reflected also deal damage to enemies']]
notes: [['{{dlc|a+nr}} If Isaac swaps Butter Bean for a different active item, then picks up Butter Bean again, it has a 10% chance to transform into {{i|Wait What?|n}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When a run is started, the game may replace Butter Bean with {{i|Wait What?|n}} in item pools. Both items are generally not available in the same run.']]

name: Best Bud
description: When hit, spawns a quickly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbiting]] attack fly similar to {{i|Forever Alone}} for the current [[Rooms|room]] that deals high damage.
effects: [['Upon taking damage, spawns a white attack fly for the duration of the current [[Rooms|room]]. The fly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] Isaac at medium range, similar to {{i|Forever Alone}}, but with much higher speed.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The fly deals 5 damage per tick (75 contact damage per second).', '{{dlc|r}} The fly deals 10 damage per tick (150 contact damage per second).']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]

name: Mom's Wig
description: Adds a chance to spawn [[Familiar#Blue Spiders|Blue Spiders]] when firing tears. Restores 1 {{E|red heart}}.
effects: [['Isaac now spawns friendly [[Familiar#Blue Spiders|Blue Spiders]] when firing tears at an enemy.'], ['Heals Isaac for 1 {{E|red heart}} upon pickup.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The spiders are spawned when Isaac is shooting, and up to 5 spiders can be spawned at the same time. More spiders can be spawned if the previous ones died.'], ['The spider spawning chance depends on the [[luck]] stat and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} This item does not work for Lilith since {{i|Incubus}} tears do not count as her tears.'], ['Spiders can still be spawned in rooms without enemies.']]

name: SMB Super Fan
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.2 [[speed]], +0.5 [[range]], +1 [[tear falling speed]]. Fully restores all red hearts.
{{dlc|r}} +1 [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.2 [[speed]], +1.5 [[range]]. Fully restores all red hearts.
effects: [['+1 [[health]].'], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[tears]].'], ['+0.2 [[speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['Fills all Red Heart containers.']]

name: Aquarius
description: A trail of [[blue creep]] is left behind Isaac, which damages enemies. {{dlc|r}} The creep inherits most of Isaac's tear effects, like [[homing]], etc.
effects: [['A trail of [[blue creep]] follows behind Isaac and damages enemies that walk over it.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The creep deals 2 damage per tick or 6 damage per second.', "{{dlc|r}} The creep deals 66% of Isaac's damage per hit."]]]
notes: [["{{dlc|r}} The creep copies Isaac's [[tear effects]] and changes colors based on Isaac's tears.", ['Chance for triggering the effects works like it does for tears.', "The creep's color changes even if the items don't have an applicable tear effect."]]]

name: Polyphemus
description: Isaac fires huge tears that deal massive [[damage]], but [[Tears|fire rate]] is greatly decreased. If a tear kills an enemy, it travels on with any leftover damage.
effects: [['Greatly increased [[damage]]: <math display="inline">{(Damage + 4) \\times 2}</math>'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tears]] down: <math display="inline">{(Delay \\times 2.1) + 3}</math>'], ['{{dlc|r}} Tears fired per second'], ['0.42.'], ['If a tear kills an enemy and has left over damage, the tear travels on with the remaining damage.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Polyphemus is a [[special item]].']]

name: Pageant Boy
description: Spawns seven random [[coins]] around Isaac.
effects: [['Spawns seven [[coin]]s around Isaac.', ['These coins may be any normal type with their respective usual chances: {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}, {{E|Nickel}}s, {{E|Dime}}s, {{E|Lucky Penny|display=Lucky Pennies}}, {{E|Sticky Nickel}}s or {{E|Golden Penny|display=Golden Pennies}}.', 'Denomination of coins that spawn is not affected by [[luck]].']]]

name: Infamy
description: Chance to block projectiles coming from any direction.
effects: [['Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a 50% chance to be blocked.', ['After effectively blocking a projectile, Isaac will briefly flash blue. Isaac in this state can still take damage from another projectile.', 'Can block:', ['Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), but their lines of fire harm Isaac.', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', 'Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.'], 'Does not block:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}).', 'Lasers or beams.', 'Lines of fire from fireballs.', 'Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.']]]]
notes: [["Although the mask is seen only on Isaac's face, projectiles still have a 50% chance to be blocked from any direction."]]

name: Dark Bum
quote: He wants to take your life
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and collects {{E|Red Heart}}s. For every 1Â½ Red Hearts collected, Dark Bum will give a reward.
effects:
[['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and collects {{E|Red Heart}}s. (He does not fill up a familiar "slot".) For every one-and-a-half Red Hearts collected, Dark Bum will generate one of the following:', ['{{dlc|nr}} A single {{E|Soul Heart}}.', 'A hostile {{E|Spider}}.', 'A friendly [[Blue Spider]].', 'A single {{E|Black Heart}}.', '{{dlc|r}} A random [[pill]], [[Cards and Runes|card, or rune]].

notes: [['If Dark Bum enters one of a set of {{r|Super Secret Room}}s which allow only certain types of Hearts to generate in them, he will drop that type of heart instead of what he would normally instead.', ["The one which only allows Red Hearts will cause Dark Bum to consume the Red Hearts on the floor only to generate yet more Red Hearts. Leading Dark Bum around the room to consume the Red Hearts and then leaving the room before he's able to generate anything will avoid this."]], ['Dark Bum will not pick up {{e|Gold Heart}}s, {{E|Blended Heart}}s, {{E|Bone Heart}}s, or {{E|Rotten Heart}}s.'], ["Very beneficial for characters that can't have heart containers ({{c|???}}, {{c|Tainted ???}}, {{c|Dark Judas}}, {{c|Tainted Judas}}, {{c|Tainted Forgotten}})  since they have no use for Red Hearts."], ['{{E|Scared Heart}}s will run away from Dark Bum. Try to pinch them between Dark Bum and Isaac so he can collect them.'], ['From a scoring perspective, Hearts that Dark Bum picks up count towards your Schwag bonus on daily runs. (only applies to Afterbirth and Afterbirth âœž dailies)']]

name: Cancer
description: Adds 3 {{E|Soul Heart}}s. Grants {{i|The Wafer}} effect for the current room after taking damage.
effects: [['Grants three {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['After taking damage, grants {{i|The Wafer}} effect of damage reduction for the current room.']]

name: Gnawed Leaf
description: After standing still and not shooting for a short time, Isaac turns invincible until he moves or shoots.
effects: [['Upon pickup, Isaac gets a small brown ringtail.'], ['After standing still and not pressing the move or attack buttons for one second, Isaac will turn into an [[invulnerability|invulnerable]] statue.', ['Using bombs and active items will remove the invincibility state.', 'Bombs can be placed while stationary and safely be stood on until they blow up if no other inputs are done after placing the bomb. (Unless Isaac is carrying the {{T|Short Fuse}} trinket, in which case the bomb will explode before the invincibility state returns)']]]
notes: [['While invulnerable, {{E|Little Horn}}â€™s pitfall still affects Isaac and will teleport him throughout the room; however, the damage is not dealt.'], ['With items like {{i|Cube of Meat}}, Isaac can easily, but slowly, kill most enemies and bosses without taking any damage.']]

name: Torn Photo
description: +0.7 [[tears]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].

name: The Boomerang
description: Throws a boomerang which retrieves [[pickup]]s, as well as damages and [[Status Effects#Effects|petrifies]] enemies hit for 2 seconds.
effects: [['On use, Isaac readies the Boomerang. Pressing a fire key will throw it in the chosen direction, and it will return shortly afterward.'], ['Any [[pickup]]s hit will return to Isaac with the Boomerang.'], ["Enemies hit by it will take double Isaac's current damage and are [[Status Effects#Effects|petrified]] for about 2 seconds."], ['{{Dlc|r}} Boomerang [[Tear Effects#Effects|pierces]] enemies it hits.']]
notes: [['The Boomerang starts to recharge only after it has returned to Isaac.'], ['The Boomerang can grab [[pickup]]s from afar, even over [[obstacle]]s.'], ['The Boomerang can be used to destroy any {{E|Shopkeeper}}s.', ['If Isaac has low damage, the shopkeeper wonâ€™t get destroyed and will instead flash red as if taking damage.']], ['The Boomerang can damage {{E|Host}} and {{E|Mobile Host}} enemies even while under their shells.'], ["The Boomerang's range scales with Isaac's range."], ["The Boomerang can hit and stun {{E|The Haunt}} or {{E|Lil' Haunt}}s even when they are invincible."], ['The Boomerang is unable to pick up {{E|Sticky Nickel}}s, or {{E|chest}}s.'], ['With enough speed, it is possible to have two Boomerangs in the air at the same time.'], ['The Boomerang can grab troll bombs.']]

name: Goat Head
description: A {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding the first floor and floors after Chapter 4.
effects: [['A {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} Door will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding first floor and floors after [[Chapter 4]].', ['The spawned door will not disappear when leaving and re-entering the boss room.']]]
notes: [['The precise effect involves setting the [[Devil Room#Conditions to make Devil Rooms appear|Devil Room chance]] to 100%, regardless of other effects.', ['Even if taken after a boss is killed, Goat Head will force a Devil / Angel Room door to spawn on that floor.']], ['Accepting a deal with the Devil will prevent any Angel Rooms from appearing, meaning that Isaac needs to acquire the Goat Head in a {{R|Curse Room}}, {{Dlc|nr}} {{E|Locked Chest}}, {{Dlc|na}} {{E|Red Chest}}, from {{E|The Fallen}} or with {{p|Credit Card}}, which would allow {{R|Angel Room}}s to open.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Goat Head and {{i|The Book of Belial}} are the only items that will ensure Angel/Devil Rooms on every floor between The {{S|Basement}} I and {{S|Utero}} II.'], ['{{dlc|anr}} Goat Head will not force a Devil / Angel Room door to open if the boss fight was in a narrow room.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Goat Head has no effect in [[Greed mode]] and is not normally available.', ["It can still be a starting item for {{c|Eden}}, a bonus item from {{i|Eden's Blessing}} and is obtainable with {{i|Pandora's Box}} and {{i|Sacrificial Altar}}."]]]

name: Taurus
description: -0.3 [[Speed]]. Isaac builds speed while in a room with enemies. At max speed, he gains the {{i|My Little Unicorn}} effect for 5 seconds.
effects: [['-0.3 [[speed]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.3 maximum speed.']], ['When in a room with enemies, Isaac gradually gains speed at a rate of +0.065 per tick.', ['{{dlc|nr}} This speed boost will be able to go past the lowered maximum.']], ["Once Isaac's speed reaches 2.0, he gains the {{i|My Little Unicorn}} effect for 5 seconds, becoming [[invulnerability|invulnerable]], and loses the speed bonus from Taurus afterward."]]
notes: [['Isaac slowly gains a red tint that becomes more intense as he gains speed.'], ['The speed boost and invulnerability effect activate only once per room.'], ["The higher Isaac's base speed, the quicker the effect activates. It can activate immediately upon entering a room if his base speed is already 2.0 ."], ["The item doesn't trigger in rooms that don't have enemies when first entered.
