This includes {{R|Challenge Room}}s, {{R|Sacrifice Room}}s when spawning {{E|Uriel}} or {{E|Gabriel}}, and the {{R|Boss Rush}} room."], ["The item doesn't trigger in trap rooms which only contain {{E|Poky}} enemies."], ["If Isaac gets teleported out of the room by any source, the {{i|My Little Unicorn}} effect won't trigger if the room is re-entered."], ['Bombs can be placed during the charge.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When playing as {{c|Jacob and Esau}}, the speed changes apply for both, but only the character that is holding Taurus gains invincibility.']]

name: Number One
description: Grants +1.5 [[tears]], but severely reduces [[range]].
effects: [['+1.5 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -17.62 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} -1.5 [[range]] and -20% [[range]] multiplier.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.76 [[tear falling speed]].'], ["Tears turn yellow and are fired from Isaac's lower body rather than his head."]]
notes: [["Number One doesn't increase the tear rate cap, meaning picking it up with tears capped (normally 5.0) this item will just decrease range with no benefit."]]

name: Proptosis
description: Tears start out massive with high [[damage]], and then shrink down and become weaker over a short range.
effects: [["{{dlc|nr}} Doubles Isaac's [[damage]] stat."], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 damage.'], ['Tear size multiplier: 2x.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The tears shrink and lose damage the farther they travel.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The tears shrink and lose damage the more time they stay airborne, starting at 3x damage at point blank range. After 0.8 seconds, they deal no damage at all.']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Effective range of Isaac's tears now also depends on the damage, as they can shrink out of existence before their air time runs out."], ["{{dlc|r}} Since tears run out of damage after 0.8 seconds (48 frames), shot speed is the only stat that determines the effective range of Isaac's tears. Damage and range don't affect the travel distance at all."], ["{{dlc|r}} Approximately 2.08% damage is lost per frame. This means at approximately 0.53 seconds (32 frames) Isaac's tears will deal the normal amount of damage."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Tear size increasing items also increase the maximum distance before its disappearance, but the damage dealt can go below original at the extreme.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Does not affect {{C|Azazel}} short-ranged {{i|Brimstone}} unless the range stat is ''extremely'' high."]]

name: D10
description: Re-rolls all [[monsters]] in the [[room]]. {{dlc|r}} Will attempt to re-roll monsters into ones with a similar amount of HP.
effects: [['Upon use, re-rolls all [[monsters]] in the [[room]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Will attempt to re-roll monsters into ones with a similar amount of HP.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Re-rolling a monster will replace it with an entirely new one from any floor, making it dangerous to use early on in the game (as Isaac could get monsters from {{s|Depths}} or later).'], ['{{dlc|r}} D10 attempts to reroll monsters into those with similar max HP, making it somewhat safer to use.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The D10 generally will not reroll [[Boss]]es but can reroll monsters spawned by bosses.'], ['Using this item can cause some rooms to become impossible to clear. Jumping or flying monsters may become trapped behind rocks after being rerolled, and therefore become unbeatable.', ['Sealed doors open after 2 minutes, though there are situations that can prevent this failsafe from triggering.']], ['{{dlc|a}} Flying monsters will only be rerolled into other flying monsters, {{dlc|nr}} and ground monsters can only be rerolled into ground monsters. ({{e|Horf}}s are classified as ground monsters by the D10).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Some invincible enemies will be rerolled, while others (including most Grimace variants) are completely unaffected.'], ["Using this item in a room with {{e|Mom's Hand}} can be very dangerous, as unless they have already landed, they will be directly on top of Isaac, resulting in the new monsters spawning directly on top of Isaac, instantly dealing contact damage."], ["Using this item, then exiting the room, such as by teleporting or a bombed door, will cause the enemies to be in their original forms upon Isaac's return."]]

name: Tammy's Head
description: Shoots 10 tears in a circle around Isaac, which retain the [[Damage]], [[Shot Speed]], and special [[effects]] (such as [[poison]]) of Isaac's tears.
effects: [['Shoots 10 tears in a circle around Isaac.'], ["The tears retain the [[Shot Speed]] and special [[effects]] (such as [[Effects#Poison|poison]]) of Isaac's tears."], ["Each tear will do Isaac's current damage and a flat +25 damage bonus on top."]]

name: Anti-Gravity
description: Tears float in position until firing ceases, after which they will fly off in the direction they were shot in. {{dlc|nr}} -2 Tear Delay. {{dlc|r}} +1 Fire Rate.
effects: [['Holding the fire buttons causes tears to hover in midair. When released, the tears will all shoot in the direction they were originally fired.', ['If the fire buttons are not released, the tears will fire on their own after 3 seconds.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|2|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.0 [[fire rate]].']]
notes: [["Gravitational effects, such as {{E|Mega Fatty}}'s inhalation or a {{E|Gaping Maw}} will pull floating tears toward them."], ['The [[range]] attribute only affects the lifespan of the tears after they have been released.'], ["Hovering tears can damage monsters like {{E|Knight}}s or {{E|Mask of Infamy}} from the front, even if they don't have the [[piercing tears|piercing effect]]."]]

name: Latch Key
description: Grants 1 {{E|Soul Heart}} and +1 [[luck]]. Spawns 2 {{E|Key}}s.
effects: [['Grants 1 {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['+1 [[luck]].'], ['Spawns 2 {{E|Key}}s.']]
notes: [['There is a chance a {{E|Golden Key}} gets spawned instead of regular Keys.']]

name: Fire Mind
description: Grants flaming tears that deal [[burn]]ing damage over time. Tears have a chance to explode on impact with an enemy, which creates a fire at the location of the explosion.
effects: [['Tears inflict [[burn]] to enemies.'], ['Tears have a chance to explode on impact with an enemy, leaving behind a fire.', ["Explosions do Isaac's current tear damage, in addition to the tear's hit.", '{{dlc|nr}} The fires deal 22 damage per tick.', '{{dlc|r}} Each fire deals up to 4 ticks of damage: 1st tick deals 23 damage, 2nd tick 17.3 damage, and 3rd and 4th tick 11.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires can block projectiles, up to 4 times, each time getting smaller.', ['Isaac cannot take damage from the flame, but can still take damage from the explosion.']]]], ["{{dlc|a}} Isaac gives a wide glow lighting up dark areas, such as those under the effects of the {{cu|Darkness}} or the {{E|Dark One}}'s attacks.\n== Notes =="], ['The explosion effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 13 luck.'], ['An exploding tear does not set either the hit enemy or anything in the blast range on fire.'], ["Explosive and burning damage is equal to Isaac's current damage stat."], ['The flame will transform {{E|Hopper}}s into {{E|Flaming Hopper}}s.']]
notes: [['The explosion effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 13 luck.'], ['An exploding tear does not set either the hit enemy or anything in the blast range on fire.'], ["Explosive and burning damage is equal to Isaac's current damage stat."], ['The flame will transform {{E|Hopper}}s into {{E|Flaming Hopper}}s.']]

name: Iron Bar
description: Increases [[damage]] by 0.3 and adds a chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Confusion|concussive tears]], causing enemies to walk around randomly.
effects: [['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['Adds a chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Confusion|concussive tears]], causing enemies to walk around randomly.']]
notes: [['Concussive tear effect depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.']]

name: A Snack
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Lost Contact
description: Isaac's tears can hit and destroy enemy projectiles. -0.16 [[shot speed]].
effects: [["Gives Isaac's tears a shield surrounding them, allowing the player to block enemy shots.", ["Isaac's shots are destroyed upon contact with an enemy's shot.", "{{dlc|ana+}} Affects familiar's tears."]], ['-0.16 [[shot speed]].']]

name: Dead Onion
description: Grants [[piercing tears|piercing]] and [[spectral tears|spectral]] tears. Increases tear size (without increasing [[damage]]) while greatly reducing [[range]] and [[shot speed]].
effects: [['Grants [[piercing tears|piercing]] and [[spectral tears|spectral]] tears.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} -1.5 [[range]].'], ['-0.4 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 1.5x.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.22 tear size.']]

name: Holy Mantle
description: Grants a shield that negates the first instance of damage taken, once per room. Does not apply to or negate self-damage ({{m|Blood Donation Machine}}s, etc).
effects: [['Grants a shield that negates the first instance of damage taken, once per room.'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} When the shield is broken, Isaac gets invincibility frames like he does when he would normally take damage, based on the damage it negated; 1 second for half a heart of damage, 2 seconds for a full heart, and 4 seconds for 2 full hearts.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Holy Mantle breaking only grants one second of invincibility frames, regardless of the damage source.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Holy Mantle won't be active when initially appearing in the starting room of a floor if it was lost in the room where Isaac left the previous floor."], ['As the shield gets restored whenever another room is entered, Holy Mantle allows {{r|Curse Room}}s to be entered and left without taking damage.'], ['Unlike every other protective effect, Holy Mantle (and similar effects) does not prevent damage from {{m|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{m|Devil Beggar}}s, and {{i|Blood Rights}}.', ['{{dlc|nr}} However, Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars can be played practically for free during the invincibility frames granted when losing the shield, by taking damage from touching a {{e|Fire Place}}, etc.']], ['Damage from {{r|Sacrifice Room}} spikes can be blocked by Holy Mantle, but no payout is rewarded.'], ['The blocked hit does not count as damage taken for related achievements and will not trigger items that activate upon taking damage, like {{i|Dead Bird}}.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{c|The Lost}} starts with this item after donating 879 coins to the {{m|Greed Donation Machine|d}}.'], ["{{dlc|r}} When Holy Mantle's shield is broken, a white cross symbol will briefly appear overlaid on top of Isaac and a smashing sound will play."], ["{{dlc|r}} While Holy Mantle is in effect, a blue cross [[File:lost hp.png|10px]] icon appears in the HUD, next to Isaac's life."]]

name: Headless Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac, leaving [[Creep#Red Creep|blood]] [[creep]] on the ground.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around, leaving a trail of [[red creep]] that damages enemies.', ['The creep deals 2 damage per tick or 6 damage per second to non-flying enemies.', '{{Dlc|r}} The creep deals damage much more rapidly at 20 damage per second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]

name: Contract From Below
description: Doubles the number of most room clear awards, but reduces the overall chance of getting one by 1/3.
effects: [['Doubles any [[pickup]]s and {{E|chest}}s earned for clearing a room, but has a 1/3 chance of removing the reward completely.', ['Neither effect applies to [[trinkets]].', '{{dlc|a}} Neither effect applies to {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} dropped in [[Greed Mode]].']]]

name: The Pact
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants two {{E|Soul Heart}}s, +0.5 [[damage]], and +0.7 [[tears]].
{{dlc+|r}} Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s, +0.5 [[damage]], and +0.7 [[tears]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Grants two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s.'], ['+0.5 [[damage]].'], ['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]

name: Breath of Life
description: Grants a brief moment of invincibility when the charge bar hits zero. If the spacebar is held for an additional second after hitting zero, Isaac will take damage.
effects: [['Holding the active item button will gradually deplete the charge bar. As the charge gets closer to zero, Isaac turns bluer over time.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Once the invincibility takes effect, Isaac starts flashing rapidly.']], ['Gives a brief moment of invincibility when the charge bar hits zero. If the spacebar is held for an additional second after hitting zero, Isaac will take damage.', ['{{Dlc|r}} While Isaac is invincible, he deals 3.5 contact damage to enemies and beams of light will strike down enemies touching Isaac, similar to {{I|Holy Light}}, dealing 15 damage.', ['While not time based, invincibility from Breath of Life is otherwise identical to damage immunity granted by the [[Temporary Buffs|shield]] effect.']]], ["The item will recharge on its own but cannot be used again until it is fully charged (even if you didn't fully deplete the charge bar)."]]

name: Virgo
description: Adds a chance to give a [[shield]] that nullifies all incoming damage for 10 seconds upon taking damage. Also converts bad [[pills]] into good pills.
effects: [['Grants a chance to trigger the {{i|Book of Shadows}} effect upon taking damage, creating a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 10 seconds.', ['The activation chance depends on the [[luck]] stat and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.']], ['Converts all negative [[pill]]s into positive ones, but does not identify them.']]
notes: [['The shield negates health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.'], ['Does not prevent [[Red Heart container]] loss from {{R|Devil Room}} deals.'], ['Bad pills already obtained/dropped will be converted to their "good" counterpart.'], ['As bad pills will turn into good pills, it is possible for two different colored pills to have the same effect.']]

name: Mom's Knife
description: Isaac's tears are replaced by a knife that pierces enemies, can travel through obstacles, and can hurt enemies while Isaac is holding it. Holding down the fire button before firing increases its range and power.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced by a knife that pierces enemies and can travel through obstacles. Holding down the fire button increases its range and power."], ['The knife deals damage 20 times per second upon contact with enemies while Isaac is holding it.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} The knife deals 2x Isaac's damage while held and 6x damage at the furthest possible point of its throw distance, regardless of the actual maximum range stat."], ["{{dlc|r}} Damage dealt by the knife depends on its charge state. The knife deals 2x Isaac's damage when held and 6x damage at about 1/3 of full charge. The knife damage quickly drops to 2x Isaac's damage when returning regardless of charge state. Further charging only increases its maximum range."], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Mom's Knife is a [[special item]]."], ["{{dlc|nr}} The knife can be held and fired diagonally with frame perfect input. This can be done easily with a controller's analog stick or with {{i|Analog Stick}}."], ['{{dlc+|r}} The knife can be held and fired diagonally as if Isaac was holding {{i|Analog Stick}}.{{dlc-}}', ['The knife can be fired in any direction if using mouse controls (enabled in options.ini).']], ['The knife will not work in challenges with the [[blindfolded]] effect.']]

name: Thunder Thighs
quote: HP up + speed down + you feel stompy
description: Destroys [[rocks]] upon contact with Isaac. Adds one [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]] and lowers [[Speed]].
effects: [['+1 [[Red Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}'], ['-0.4 [[speed]] down.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed.']], ['Isaac gains the ability to destroy [[obstacle]]s by walking into them.']]
notes: [['Holes in the ground can be filled if Isaac walks into adjacent [[rocks]] from the right direction, similar to bombs.'], ['Avoid walking over [[Mushroom (Obstacle)|Mushrooms]] and [[Bomb Rock]]s, as they can damage Isaac upon destruction.'], ['With this item, Isaac can walk over and destroy {{E|Red Poop}} without taking damage.'], ['Walking over an [[Angel]] Statue in the {{R|Angel Room}} will trigger the boss fight, and Isaac will take damage as the Angel spawns on top of him.']]

name: Sacred Heart
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Adds a Red [[Heart Container]]. Grants [[homing tears]], a x2.3 [[Damage]] multiplier, +1 flat Damage, -0.4 [[Tears]], -0.25 [[Shot Speed]], and +4.125 [[Range]].
{{dlc+|r}} Adds a Red [[Heart Container]]. Grants [[homing tears]], a x2.3 [[Damage]] multiplier, +1 flat Damage, -0.4 [[Tears]], and -0.25 [[Shot Speed]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['Grants one [[Red Heart Container]] and replenishes all health.'], ['x2.3 damage multiplier.'], ['+1 flat [[Damage]].'], ['-0.4 [[tears]].'], ['-0.25 [[Shot Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.75 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +4.125 [[range]].'], ['Grants [[homing tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Grants homing bombs (the effect of {{i|Bobby-Bomb}}).'], ['{{dlc|+r}}{{transf|Seraphim|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Sacred Heart is a [[special item]].'], ['Sacred Heart has the highest damage multiplier of all passive items.'], ['The flat damage gained by Sacred Heart is not affected by its damage multiplier. However, other flat damage upgrades (such as those gained by {{t|Curved Horn}} or {{i|Void}}) will be affected normally.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Although Sacred Heart increases range, the reduction of shot speed results in a slight decrease in effective range, not accounting for homing.']]

name: Safety Pin
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}, +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}, +1.5 [[range]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].
effects: [['Grants 1 {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['+0.16 [[shot speed]].']]

name: My Little Unicorn
description: Gives [[invulnerability]] and +0.28 [[speed]] for six seconds, removing the ability to shoot tears and replacing it with the ability to deal 40 contact damage to enemies.
effects: [['Gives [[invulnerability]] and +0.28 [[speed]] for six seconds, removing the ability to shoot tears and replacing it with the ability to deal contact damage to enemies.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Isaac deals 40 contact damage to enemies, once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Isaac deals 20 contact damage to enemies, twice per second.', ['If an enemy is at 40 HP or less, the contact damage is increased to 40 for that enemy.']]]]
notes: [['The invulnerability effect negates all forms of damage, including health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.'], ['Does not prevent [[Heart Container]] loss from [[Health Down]] [[pills]] or [[Devil Room|Devil Deals]].'], ['Ending the current run via opening the end chest while My Little Unicorn is active will cause the credits and main menu music to be sped up. The effect ends upon restarting the game or starting a new run.'], ['{{P|VII - The Chariot}} card provides the same effect of this item when used.']]

name: Mom's Perfume
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[Fear|fear tears]]. {{dlc|nr}} Decreases [[tear delay]] by 1. {{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].
effects: [['Adds a chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Effects|fear tears]], causing enemies to run away from the player.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|1|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The fear effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, starting at 15% at 0 luck, reaching 100% with 85 luck.', ["{{i|Dark Matter}} is significantly better at inflicting fear than Mom's Perfume."]]]

name: The Nail
description:
{{dlc+|nr}} Gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}. For the current room; +0.7 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]], Isaac breaks [[rock]]s and deals contact damage.{{dlc-}}
{{dlc+|r}} Gives half a {{e|Black Heart}}. For the current room; +2 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]], Isaac breaks [[rock]]s and deals contact damage.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}, +0.7 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]], and the ability to destroy most [[obstacle]]s by walking into them. Cannot be stacked in one room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Gives half a {{e|Black Heart}}, +2 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]] and the ability to destroy obstacles for the current room.', ['If used multiple times in one room, the speed penalty only applies once, but the damage buff can stack. Each subsequent damage buff becomes less effective for each use']], ['Allows Isaac to deal 40 contact damage to enemies for the current room. Does not prevent Isaac from taking contact damage. It can be applied only once per second per enemy.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Isaac's tears become red for the current room."], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [["Isaac makes a demon sound when taking damage while this item is in use. This is quieter than Isaac's standard damage sound and is easy to miss."]]

name: There's Options
description: Two items appear after defeating a [[Boss]]. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.
effects: [['Two items appear after defeating a [[Boss]]. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.']]
notes: [['If the boss has a fixed item drop such as [[The Harbingers]], the other item will be selected from the normal [[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss item pool]].'], ['Two items appear after clearing {{r|Boss Rush}}.'], ['Both items that appear after defeating a Boss in {{s|The Void}} are from random item pools. Likewise, both items that appear after defeating {{E|The Fallen}} are [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room items]].'], ['There is no effect on items dropped by [[All Mini-Bosses (Bosses)|Mini-Bosses]].'], ['There is no effect on what appears after defeating {{E|Mom}}, even if {{i|The Polaroid}} / {{i|The Negative}} have not unlocked (in which case only 1 [[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss item]] will appear).'], ['Does not retroactively effect {{r|Boss Room}}s that had already been cleared prior to picking it up.']]

name: Butt Bombs
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Bombs now cloud up the screen, briefly damaging and [[confusion|confusing]] all enemies.
effects: [['Gives the player 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ['Bombs now cloud up the screen on detonation, briefly [[confusion|confusing]] and dealing 10 damage to all enemies in the room.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Oh Crap|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|a}} Butt Bombs heal {{E|Turdlings}}, {{E|Dingle}}, {{E|Dangle}}, {{E|Brownie}} and {{E|Clog}} by 25% of their maximum HP.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The Butt Bomb effect on {{i|Dr. Fetus}} or {{i|Epic Fetus}} does not cause healing, but normal bombs still do.']]]

name: Tiny Planet
description: Massively increases [[Range]] and grants [[spectral tears]]. Tears orbit around Isaac at a fixed distance until they hit the ground.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +7 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +6.5 [[range]].'], ['Grants [[spectral tears]].'], ['Tears now revolve around Isaac at a fixed distance until they hit the ground.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The tears orbit close to Isaac, offset slightly in the direction fired. Changing the firing direction will redirect all previously fired tears.']]
notes: [['Tears will not hit directly in front of Isaac; aiming directly away from enemies is often effective.'], ['{{dlc|r}} It is possible to control the direction of Tiny Planet with the mouse. On Windows, go to {{code|C:/Users/[username]/Documents/My Games/The Binding Of Isaac [Rebirth/Afterbirth/Afterbirth+]/}} and in the options.ini file, change the line that says {{code|MouseControl{{=}}0}} to {{code|MouseControl{{=}}1}}. Unlike normal controls, the mouse allows diagonal direction.']]

name: Yum Heart
description: Restores one full {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Restores one full {{e|Red Heart}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When playing in co-op, all other players will be healed for a {{e|Half Red Heart}}.']]
notes: [['{{c|Magdalene}} / {{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Magdalene}} starts with this item by default.'], ['This item can drop from {{E|Super Lust}}.']]

name: Lemon Mishap
description: Creates a tiny pool of [[Creep#Yellow Creep|yellow creep]], damaging enemies that cross it.
effects: [['Creates a tiny pool of [[Creep#Yellow Creep|yellow creep]], damaging enemies that cross it.', ['The puddle deals 8 damage per tick or 24 damage per second.']]]

name: Pisces
description:
{{dlc|nr}} -1 Tear Delay, adds [[knock-back]] shots and increases tear size.
{{dlc|r}} +0.5 Fire Rate, adds [[knock-back]] shots and increases tear size.
effects: [['Increases [[Knock-back|tear knockback]].', ['If the player has [[piercing tears]], the knockback effect is reduced.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 1.25x.', ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.12 tear size.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|1|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].']]

name: My Reflection
description: Gives Isaac's tears a boomerang effect. {{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[range]], +1 [[tear falling speed]], x1.6 [[shot speed]] multiplier. {{dlc|r}} 1.6x+1.5 [[range]] and a 1.6x [[shot speed]] multiplier.
effects: [["Isaac's tears travel a short distance, then reverse direction and return to Isaac.", ['The tears are constantly pulled towards Isaac; if Isaac moves after shooting, the tears will always return to him.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} 1.6x+1.5 [[range]].'], ['1.6x [[shot speed]] multiplier.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[tear falling speed]].']]

name: Technology
description: Replaces tears with a [[Piercing tears|piercing]] laser with unlimited range.
effects: [["Replaces tears with a laser beam with unlimited range and [[Piercing tears|piercing]]. The laser is fired from Isaac's left eye."]]
notes: [['Laser rate of fire is determined by the [[tears]] stat. This differentiates the item from {{i|Technology 2}} which fires a continuous beam, and {{i|Tech.5}} which has a random fire rate.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Laser size scales with tear size.', ['{{dlc|r}} The sound emitted by the laser will also change depending on its size. This is purely aesthetic.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Lasers are affected by momentum, allowing them to be shot diagonally if fired while Isaac is moving.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When directly adjacent to a wall or [[Obstacles|obstacle]] and firing in the wrong direction the obstacle may block the laser, preventing it from damaging enemies. This can happen on all sides of a given [[Rooms|room]] with the exception of the bottom wall.']]

name: Technology 2
description: Replaces the tears fired from Isaac's right eye with a rapid-firing low damage [[piercing tears|piercing]] laser. {{dlc|nr}} [[Damage]] down.
effects: [["Replaces Isaac's right eye tears with an unlimited range [[piercing tears|piercing]] laser which fires continuously, dealing damage 15 times per second."], ['{{dlc|nr}} x0.65 Damage multiplier.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} The laser deals 20% of Isaac's damage per tick.", ["This compounds with the damage down for a total of 13% of Isaac's damage per tick."]], ["{{dlc|r}} Only the laser deals 13% of Isaac's damage per tick."], ['{{dlc|r}} Tears fired per second'], ['(2/3).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Laser is able to knock back enemies.']]
notes: [['Tear delay is effectively doubled, as Isaac will do a bit of the animation to fire a right eye tear, but no tear will come out.', ["{{dlc|r}} This applies to items that replace Isaac's tears, such as {{I|Mom's Knife}} and {{I|Brimstone}}."]], ["Charged shots are not affected by the effective tear delay down, as they don't use the alternative left eye/right eye fire scheme."], ['{{Dlc|nr}} As {{C|Cain}} can only fire tears from his right eye, Technology 2 will replace his tears altogether unless he has {{i|Technology}} or a charged attack.', ['{{dlc+|r}} When used by Cain, or a character that is forced to fire from one eye due to the effects of {{I|Stapler}} or {{I|Lead Pencil}}, they will fire {{i|Technology}} lasers out of their right eye instead of their normal tears, as long as they have no other items that replace their tears ({{I|neptunus}} lets them fire tears normally). These lasers cannot be angled with momentum.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Because {{C|Lilith}} is blindfolded and relies on her {{i|Incubus}}, the only effect gained from Technology 2 is the damage down.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Incubus can fire laser as normal; stat effects apply.', 'Unlike regular Lilith, {{c|Tainted Lilith}} gains the standard laser from her baby as well as the tears from the demonic baby.']], ['The laser can apply [[status effect]]s very efficiently due to its high tick rate.']]

name: Spoon Bender
description: Grants Isaac [[homing tears]].
effects: [['Grants [[homing tears]].']]

name: Transcendence
description: Grants [[flight]].
effects: [['Grants [[flight]].']]

name: Guppy's Head
description: Spawns 2-4 friendly [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] that damage enemies.
effects: [['Spawns 2-4 friendly [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]].'], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["Each Blue Fly deals 2x Isaac's damage."]]

name: Magic Fingers
description: Uses 1 {{E|Penny}} to deal a large amount of [[damage]] to all enemies in the [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Uses 1 {{E|Penny}} to deal damage to all enemies in the [[Rooms|room]].', ["{{dlc|nr}} Damage dealt is equal to twice Isaac's [[damage]].", ["{{dlc|r}} Damage dealt is twice Isaac's [[damage]] +10."]]]]
notes: [['This item becomes more valuable once {{R|Shop}}s stop appearing.']]

name: Pyro
description: Grants 99 {{E|Bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants Isaac 99 {{E|Bomb}}s.']]
notes: [['Rerolling this item with the {{i|D4}}, etc., will not remove 99 Bombs.'], ['This item can appear when using the {{P|0 - The Fool?}} with 99 bombs in inventory.']]

name: Ball of Bandages
description: Creates an [[orbital familiar]]. Collecting additional copies gives it the ability to shoot [[Charm]] tears, then chase enemies to deal contact damage, then deal even more contact damage.
effects: [['Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that deals contact damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} It deals 105 damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 53 damage per second.']], ['{{dlc|na}} Unlike the {{i|Cube of Meat}}, it does not block enemy shots.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Ball of Bandages blocks enemy shots.'], ["Each subsequent Ball of Bandages obtained are combined with the first one (increasing its 'level'), changing its characteristics:", ['Level 2: Gives the orbital the ability to shoot [[Charm]] tears that deal 3.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} It shoots once every second.', '{{dlc|r}} It shoots once every 0.73 seconds.'], 'Level 3: Changes it from an orbital to a Bandage Girl that that chases nearby enemies dealing contact damage and fires Charm tears in the direction Isaac shoots. The tears it fires are the same as the ones fired by the Level 2 form.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} It deals 7 contact damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 12.5 contact damage per second.'], "Level 4: Increases the size of the Bandage Girl and increases its contact damage. Enemies killed by a level 4 Bandage Girl's tears have a chance to drop full {{e|Red Heart}}s.", ['{{Dlc|nr}} It deals 11 contact damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 25 contact damage per second.'], 'The fifth Ball of Bandages will create a new Level 1 ball, and start the cycle again.']]]
notes: [['Multiple Balls of Bandages can be collected in a single run.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The orbital orbits Isaac significantly faster, making it more effective at blocking shots but less effective for dealing damage.'], ['{{e|Famine}}, {{e|Pestilence}}, {{e|War}}, and {{e|Death}} will always drop either a Ball of Bandages or {{i|Cube of Meat}}. After the first one drops, further Harbingers will only drop that same one and never the other for the duration of the run.'], ["The ticking rate for Bandage Girls' contact damage causes them to often deal damage twice once they touch an enemy, making their first second of DPS up to 1.5x higher than normal."], ["Level 3 and 4 Bandage Girls' tears inherit Isaac's momentum."]]

name: The Wafer
description: All sources of damage that would cause more than one-half heart of damage are reduced to one-half heart instead.
effects: [['All damage taken is reduced to half a heart.']]
notes: [['The damage reduction includes most sources in the game that would cause more than half a heart of damage:', ['{{E|Bomb}}s.', '[[Champion]]s.', ['Except for the skull champions, they will deal a full heart damage even with The Wafer as opposed to only one half.'], '{{R|Sacrifice Room}}s.', 'Environmental hazards such as [[Spikes]].', 'Most self-inflicting damage items (exceptions are noted).', 'Every source of damage in {{Stage|Womb}}/{{Stage|Utero}}/{{Stage|Scarred Womb}} and beyond, including all enemies, {{R|Curse Room}}s, {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.', 'The "HARD HARD" special [[Seeds|seed]].']], ['The Wafer does not prevent instant death effects such as {{P|Suicide King}} or using {{I|The Bible}} on the {{E|Satan}} boss fight.'], ['Does not prevent health loss from {{R|Devil Room}} deals or Health Down [[pills]].'], ['Despite The Wafer reducing damage to 1/2 a heart, this does not change the amount of invincibility frames granted from full/two heart damage sources.'], ['{{dlc|a}} No effect with {{c|Keeper}} or {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, as Coin Hearts cannot be half hearts.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Does not reduce the damage taken when opening the door to {{Stage|Mausoleum}}/{{Stage|Gehenna}}.']]

name: Anemic
description: After Isaac is damaged, a trail of [[red creep]] will be left behind him until he leaves the current room. {{dlc+|nr}} +5 [[range]].{{dlc-}} {{dlc+|r}} +1.5 [[range]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['Upon taking damage, Isaac leaves a trail of [[red creep]] that damages enemies until he leaves the room.', ['The creep deals 2 damage per tick (6 damage per second) to enemies that walk over it.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].']]
notes: [['The effects of this item do not stack if multiple copies of the item or its effects are acquired; Isaac only gets the range bonus once.'], ["{{C|Lazarus}}, or anyone holding {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}, is resurrected with this item upon his first death.", ['After {{chal|Backasswards}} is beaten, Lazarus will start with Anemic, and Lazarus Risen will have its increased range and creep trail effect permanently active, regardless of whether he possesses the item.']]]

name: Bob's Brain
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that charges forward when shooting tears and explodes upon contact with an enemy, damaging and [[poison]]ing them. The familiar respawns after a few seconds.
effects: [['Spawns a floating brain [[familiar]] that can be fired towards enemies as a projectile.', ["{{dlc|na}}Bob's Brain is fired directly from where Isaac is standing.", "{{dlc|a}}Bob's Brain is fired directly from where it is located in the chain of familiars behind Isaac, making aiming it slightly more difficult."]], ['If it hits an enemy, it deals 3.5 damage and explodes, further damaging and [[Poison|poisoning]] monsters.', ["{{dlc|nr}} The explosion deals 60 damage. The poison deals double Isaac's [[Damage]] over time.", "{{dlc|r}} The explosion deals 100 damage. The poison damage is dealt 4 times, inflicting Isaac's Damage per tick.", '{{dlc|r}} The explosion ignores armor.']], ['The explosion can hurt Isaac, dealing a full heart of damage.', ["This can make picking up the item a risky choice, as Bob's Brain will always fire, regardless of whether or not Isaac will be caught in the explosion."]], ['Once it explodes, it takes a few seconds to re-appear.'], ['{{transf|Bob|item}}']]
notes: [["Bob's Brain is affected by most bomb modifiers."], ["Bob's Brain only explodes when hitting an enemy, and does not explode upon hitting a fire, poop, or wall. It can destroy poops and fires like normal shots, however."], ["Bob's Brain never launches immediately upon entering a room unless a tear-firing key is released and pressed again, or until several seconds have passed."], ["It is possible to get multiple Bob's Brains to spawn on the same floor by finding one in a {{E|Locked Chest}} and not taking it", ['Only one copy of the brains will be active at a given time, with another one firing immediately after the first has exploded or starts to return from a miss.', "{{dlc|na}} Multiple copies of Bob's Brain will float in the same spot in the familiar line.", '{{dlc|a}} Each copy takes up their spot on the familiar line, but only the first one launches out. Respawning brains may end up stacking on top of each other.']]]

name: Spirit of the Night
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [["The changed texture of the player's body is the same as {{c|The Lost}}'s, but recolored."]]

name: Aries
description: +0.25 [[Speed]]. Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal damage. {{dlc|r}} Prevents Isaac from taking contact damage while moving at high speed.
effects: [['+0.25 [[Speed]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal 18 damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal 25 damage.', ['At least 0.85 Speed is required to be able to move quickly enough.', '{{dlc|r}} Moving at this speed also prevents contact damage.']]]

name: Blue Cap
quote: HP + tears up + shot speed down
description: Gives one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.7 [[tears]], and -0.16 [[shot speed]]. {{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].', ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals Isaac for 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.']], ['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['-0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]

name: Black Candle
description: Prevents [[curse]]s. Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}. Increases the chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} or {{R|Angel Room}} to appear.
effects: [['Grants immunity to floor [[curse]]s.', ['Will immediately remove any curses on the current floor except {{curse|labyrinth}}.']], ['Grants a {{E|Black Heart}} upon pickup.'], ['Increases chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} door to open when a floor boss is killed by 15%.']]
notes: [['Picking up this item during {{chal|Cursed!}} will not remove the {{curse|cursed}}.'], ['Picking up this item during {{chal|Pitch Black}} will not remove the {{curse|darkness}} or {{curse|unknown}}.'], ["Picking up this item during {{chal|Ultra Hard}} will not remove '''any''' of the curses."], ['Picking up this item while under the effect of an Amnesia [[Pills|pill]] or ??? pill will remove the effect of the pill. However, the item does not negate the effects of Amnesia or ??? pills used after picking up this item.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Picking up this item does not make the second item in alt floor treasure rooms visible.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Doesn't remove {{curse|darkness}} afflicted by {{p|XIX - The Sun?|n}}, no matter if Black Candle was picked up before or after using the card."]]

name: Missing Page 2
quote: Evil up. Your enemies will pay!
description:
Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}. Upon taking damage that reduces Isaac's [[health]] to one heart or less, deals damage to all enemies in the room.
{{dlc|r}} Increases the damage of {{E|Black Heart}}s and {{i|The Necronomicon}}-like effects by 40.
effects: [['Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Activates {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect upon taking damage if Isaac's total [[health]] ({{E|Red Heart}}s, {{E|Soul Heart}}s, and Black Hearts) is at one heart afterward."], ["{{dlc|r}} Deals 80 damage to everything in the room upon taking damage if Isaac's total [[health]] (Red Hearts, Soul Hearts, and Black Hearts) is at one heart afterward."], ['{{dlc|r}} Adds +40 damage to {{i|The Necronomicon}} and similar effects, such as {{E|Black Heart}}s.']]
notes: [['Works the same for {{C|Keeper}} and {{c|Tainted Keeper}} and his [[Hearts|Coin Hearts]].']]

name: Capricorn
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Adds 1 Red [[Heart Container]], gives +0.5 [[Damage]], +0.1 [[Speed]], +1.5 [[Range]], and -1.0 [[Tear Delay]], and gives 1 {{E|Bomb}}, {{E|Penny}}, and {{E|Key}}.
{{dlc|r}} Adds 1 Red [[Heart Container]], gives +0.5 [[Damage]], +0.1 [[Speed]], +0.75 [[Range]], and +0.5 [[Fire Rate]], and gives 1 {{E|Bomb}}, {{E|Penny}}, and {{E|Key}}.
effects: [['Adds 1 Red [[Heart Container]].'], ['+0.5 [[Damage]].'], ['+0.1 [[Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[Range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.75 [[Range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -1 [[Tear Delay]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[Fire Rate]].'], ['+1 {{E|Bomb}}, {{E|Penny}}, and {{E|Key}}.']]

name: Scorpio
description: Grants [[Poison|poison tears]], which deal damage over time when inflicted.
effects: [['Grants [[poison]] tears, dealing damage over time when inflicted.'], ['{{dlc|na}} The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.'], ["{{dlc|a}} The poison hits twice, dealing a total of double Isaac's damage."]]
notes: [['This item has the same effect as {{i|The Common Cold}} on every shot. As such, all synergies with that item also apply to Scorpio at a 100% chance.', ['This includes the same effect when absorbed by {{i|Abyss}}.']]]

name: Head of Krampus
description: {{dlc|naa+}} Fires a powerful {{i|Brimstone}} beam in four cardinal directions, much like {{e|Krampus}} shoots.
effects: [['Fires a powerful {{i|Brimstone}} beam in the four cardinal directions, much like {{e|The Fallen}} and {{e|Krampus}} shoot.', ["{{dlc|ana+}} Has a 50% chance to rotate all beams around the player 90 degrees, similar to Krampus' second Brimstone attack."]]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Each beam deals 22 damage per tick, and they tick a total of 20 times, dealing a total of 440 damage per use.', ['{{dlc|r}} Each beam deals 10 damage over 20 ticks, dealing a total of 200 damage per use.']], ['Damaging enemies with the effect of this item as {{transf|Guppy}} will spawn multiple [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]].'], ["By standing really close to large enemies such as bosses, it's possible to hit them with multiple beams at once, dealing significantly more damage than a single beam."]]

name: IV Bag
description: Upon use, Isaac loses half a heart of [[health]] (or a full heart in [[Chapter 4]] onward) for a random amount of [[coins]], similar to a {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}.
effects: [['Upon use, causes Isaac to lose half a heart of [[health]] (or a full heart in [[Chapter 4]] onward) while spawning [[coin]]s.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Each use pays out with 1-3 coins.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Each use pays out with 1-2 coins on Normal mode or 1 coin on [[Hard mode]].'], '{{dlc|a}} Spawns 0-1 coins instead when used by {{C|Keeper}}.']]]
notes: [['This item can be found when causing a {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}} to explode by donating Hearts to it.'], ["If Isaac doesn't have the required {{E|Red Heart}}s or filled {{E|Bone Heart}}s, then {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, and empty Bone Hearts are taken instead."], ['This effect is counted as inflicted damage for items that spawn [[pickup]]s upon said inflicted damage, such as {{i|Gimpy}} or {{i|Fanny Pack}}, but does not decrease the chance of encountering the {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}}.'], ['[[Invulnerability]] will not prevent Isaac from losing hearts.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Can be used before taking damage (getting hit, walking over spikes, donating to a {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}}, donating to a {{machine|Devil Beggar}}, going through a {{r|Curse Room}}, etc.) to grant coins without inflicting extra damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Does not allow Isaac to avoid damage taken by using a {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}} or {{machine|Devil Beggar}}.'], ['Using this item as {{C|The Lost}} will kill him.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Using this item in [[Mirrored World]] kills Isaac.']]

name: Guppy's Paw
description: Upon use, converts one Red [[Heart Container]] into three {{e|Soul Heart}}s.
effects: [['Upon use, converts one Red [[Heart Container]] into three {{e|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [['{{e|Bone Heart}}s cannot be converted.']]

name: Flush!
description: Turns all non-boss [[monsters]] in the [[room]] into {{E|poop}}. Instantly kills poop-themed bosses.
effects: [['Turns all non-boss [[monsters]] in the [[room]] into {{E|poop}}.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Floods the whole room with water (same effect as seen in {{s|Flooded Caves}}).', ['Floods the room with blood if used in {{Stage|Womb}} and its alts.']], ['{{dlc|a}} Instantly kills most poop-themed bosses ({{E|Dingle}}, {{E|Dangle|n}}, {{E|Brownie|n}}, {{E|Clog}}).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Extinguishes all Normal and Red {{E|fire place}}s in the room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Turns lava-filled pits in the {{Stage|Mines}} into solid rock, allowing them to be walked over.'], ['{{transf|Oh Crap|item}}']]
notes: [['Poops produced by this item act similarly to regular enemies, which causes them to flash red when hit. Certain items will also behave like the poop was a normal enemy, such as {{i|BBF}}.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Enemies that are turned into poop act more similarly to regular poop by crumbling upon being attacked.']], ['If the Fear effect is applied, the poop will stay a dark red.'], ["Does not work against {{E|Lil' Haunt}}s when fighting {{E|The Haunt}}.", ['{{dlc|na}} The first little haunt when fighting the Haunt can be flushed, but this softlocks the game.']], ["Does not work against {{E|Mom's Hand}} or {{E|Wizoob}} enemies."], ['Does not work against {{E|Turdlings}}, {{E|Colostomia}} or {{E|Turdlet}} despite them being poop-based enemies.'], ['Does not work against mini-bosses.'], ['May not work against enemies currently jumping.'], ["The drops from the poops that come from enemies aren't affected by {{T|petrified poop}}."], ["Using it against the [[Champion]] version of a monster will forfeit the chance to get the champion's drop."], ['{{dlc|a}} Poop created by use of this item does not heal Isaac when he has the {{transf|Oh Crap|n}} transformation.'], ['{{dlc|a}} When used inside a crawl space the ladders will be covered in water but the walls will not.']]

name: Magic Scab
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +1 [[luck]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['+1 [[luck]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}']]

name: Mitre
description: Grants a chance of converting any {{E|Red Heart}} pickups into {{E|Soul Heart}}s instead.
effects: [['Grants a chance of converting any {{E|Red Heart}} pickups into {{E|Soul Heart}}s instead.', ['{{dlc|nr}} 50% chance to convert Red Hearts into Soul Hearts.', '{{dlc|r}} 33% chance to convert Red Hearts into Soul Hearts.']], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]

name: Magneto
description: Pulls [[pickup]]s towards Isaac.
effects: [['Pickups (e.g. hearts, coins, keys, bombs, etc.) are attracted to Isaac.', ['The attraction enables the item to pass/fly over pits or rocks, but not through Key Blocks.', '{{E|red heart|display=Hearts}} are only attracted if Isaac could pick them up with his existing Red Heart containers.', "{{E|Lil' Battery|display=Batteries}} act similarly to hearts in that they will only be attracted to Isaac if his active item isn't fully charged.", '{{E|Chest|r}}s roughly 2 or fewer tiles away from Isaac open automatically. {{E|Spiked chest|n}}s are opened without damaging Isaac. {{E|Locked chest}}s and {{E|bomb chest}}s are not opened and still require a key/bomb.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} A few enemies (like the [[Horf]]) are drawn toward Isaac as well.']]
notes: [['Magneto can attract {{E|Scared Heart}}s, but they still run away from Isaac.'], ['{{E|Grab Bag|r}}s are not attracted nor opened by Magneto.'], ["{{dlc|r}} If Magneto opens the chests in {{r|Challenge Room}}s, the waves won't start spawning, nor the way out will be closed."]]

name: BFFS!
description: Increases the size and effectiveness of most [[familiar]]s.
effects: [['Visually increases the size of all [[familiar]]s by 25%, and improves the effectiveness of most of them.', ['Doubles the damage of Familiars that deal damage through tears and contact damage.', ['Has no effect on [[Creep]] generated by familiars.'], 'For pickup-generating familiars, increases the frequency that they drop pickups.', ['Familiars that require clearing a certain number of rooms will require one less room.', 'Familiars that have a random chance to drop items have a higher chance.', 'Familiars that pick up consumables require less, except {{i|Dark Bum}} which is unaffected.'], 'Some familiars have unique synergies.']]]
notes: [["The size change is only cosmetic: familiars' hitbox for blocking damage or attacking is not affected."], ['Familiars summoned by a [[trinket]] or by {{i|Monster Manual}} are also affected by BFFS!.'], ['The Blue Flies and Blue Spiders benefit from {{i|Hive Mind}} instead.'], ['Does not increase the frequency or effectiveness of [[Status Effects]] applied by familiars.']]

name: Prayer Card
description: Gives an {{E|Eternal Heart}} per use.
effects: [['Gives an {{E|Eternal Heart}} upon activation.']]
notes: [['If used after clearing a [[floor]], before proceeding to the next one, it guarantees a new [[Heart Container]] every floor.'], ['Since it adds the eternal heart directly to the health bar instead of spawning it on the floor, the item is useless for {{C|Keeper}}.']]

name: Broken Watch
description: Every 4th newly discovered room entered will [[Status Effects#Slow|slow down]] or speed up every enemy and their attacks. The chance to slow enemies is quite higher than the chance to speed them up.
effects: [['Every 4th newly discovered room, the Broken Watch [[slow]]s all enemies and their attacks down, but has a ~13% chance of speeding them up by 40% instead.', ['The effect is lost upon leaving the room, and not gained again if re-entering it.', 'The effect is also lost upon exiting and continuing the run.\n== Notes ==']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Because of the slow effect, champion versions of enemies will be tinted the same color as all other enemies. This makes it much harder to distinguish certain champion types, such as those that explode upon death.'], ["The player can abuse the Broken Watch to have the Boss Rush be slowed every time by making sure that it's the 4th room since the last time the effect activated. This necessitates skipping the {{R|Devil Room}}s or {{R|Angel Room}}s , however."], ['If the slow effect triggers when entering {{E|The Beast}} boss area, it will be active for all four horsemen and the Beast. This is also true of the speed effect.', ['To trigger the effects of Broken Watch during the fight and do not have either the {{I|Red Key}} or a {{P|Cracked Key}}, you have to clear 1 room after the effect has activated, then explore every room in {{Stage|Home}}. Otherwise, after the effect has activated in a room, immediately go to {{Stage|Home}} and explore every room.']]]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Because of the slow effect, champion versions of enemies will be tinted the same color as all other enemies. This makes it much harder to distinguish certain champion types, such as those that explode upon death.'], ["The player can abuse the Broken Watch to have the Boss Rush be slowed every time by making sure that it's the 4th room since the last time the effect activated. This necessitates skipping the {{R|Devil Room}}s or {{R|Angel Room}}s , however."], ['If the slow effect triggers when entering {{E|The Beast}} boss area, it will be active for all four horsemen and the Beast. This is also true of the speed effect.', ['To trigger the effects of Broken Watch during the fight and do not have either the {{I|Red Key}} or a {{P|Cracked Key}}, you have to clear 1 room after the effect has activated, then explore every room in {{Stage|Home}}. Otherwise, after the effect has activated in a room, immediately go to {{Stage|Home}} and explore every room.']]]

name: Converter
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Converts two {{e|Soul Heart}}s or {{e|Black Heart}}s into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.
{{dlc|r}} Converts one {{e|Soul Heart}} or {{e|Black Heart}} into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Converts two {{e|Soul Heart}}s or {{e|Black Heart}}s into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Converts one {{e|Soul Heart}} or {{e|Black Heart}} into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.']]
notes: [["Using this item on Black Hearts will activate the Black Heart's damaging effect."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Must use with two full Soul Hearts to work. One and a half will not work.']]

name: Blank Card
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] or [[rune]] currently held by Isaac.
{{dlc|r}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] currently held by Isaac. The charge time is based on the power of the card.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] or [[rune]] currently held by Isaac.', ['{{dlc+|anr}} Also mimics {{p|Dice Shard}} and {{p|Emergency Contact}}.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{dlc|r}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] currently held by Isaac.']]
notes: [['Using the Blank Card does not expend the consumable.'], ['[[Pill]]s can be mimicked only by {{i|Placebo}}.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Runes and soul stones can be mimicked only by {{i|Clear Rune}}.{{dlc-}}'], ['Using the Blank Card with a consumable that is not compatible, or no consumable at all, will spend the charge with no effect.'], ["If the player is holding more than one consumable (e.g. {{I|Starter Deck}}, Tainted Characters...) and one of them isn't a card, they must ensure the card is the one selected when activating Blank Card, otherwise the effect won't be triggered."]]

name: Sharp Plug
description: Damages Isaac in exchange for fully recharging Isaac's current activated item.
effects: [["Damages Isaac in exchange for fully recharging Isaac's current activated item.", ['{{dlc|nr}} Sharp Plug costs two hearts of health to use.', ["{{dlc|r}} Sharp Plug's heart cost is one half-heart per charge slot filled. The health cost is not increased in later stages where half-heart damage is upgraded to full heart."], '{{dlc|nr}} If the item has any charges, the Sharp Plug will not work.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac has less than two Black or Soul Hearts, it will remove them but will not remove any Red Hearts.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Sharp Plug attempts to draw from Red Hearts first.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Sharp Plug cannot deal fatal damage. If used at half a heart, it will not work.']]

name: Black Lotus
description: Grants one Red [[Heart Container]], one {{E|Soul Heart}}, and one {{E|Black Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants a full Red [[Heart Container]], one {{E|Soul Heart}}, and one {{E|Black Heart}}.']]

name: The D6
description: Re-rolls all items in the current [[Rooms|room]] into other items, depending on the current room's [[Item Pool]].
effects: [["Upon use, replaces every item in the current [[Rooms|room]] (not [[pickups]] or [[trinkets]]) with other random items corresponding to the current room's [[Item Pool|item pool]]."]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} The D6 is a [[special item]].'], ['{{c|Isaac}} starts with this item once it is unlocked.'], ['Since it re-rolls every item in the room, it can be more efficient to use it in rooms where multiple items are in the same room. For instance:', ['In the {{r|Shop}}, when multiple items are available for purchase.', 'In the {{r|Devil Room}}, when there are multiple deals offered.', 'In the {{r|Boss Room}} after the {{E|Mom}} fight, where both {{i|The Polaroid}} and {{i|The Negative}} can be rerolled, at the cost of the opportunity to go to the {{s|Chest}}/{{s|Dark Room}}. Once one item is picked up the other will disappear.', 'In the {{r|Boss Rush}} Room, where all 4 items can be rerolled at once.', "When {{i|There's Options}} or {{i|More Options}} spawn two items."]], ['Items from {{E|chest}}s can be rerolled.'], ['When an item pool is exhausted, every item will be rerolled to {{i|Breakfast}}.'], ['If Isaac runs out of red hearts in the {{r|Devil Room}}, then rerolls, the prices of the items switch over to soul hearts.'], ['Using the D6 on an active item yields different rerolls depending on whether you picked up the active item first.'], ['Using the D6 to reroll items duplicated with {{i|Diplopia}} will reroll all the items into different items. The copied item will not be rerolled into the same one as the original item.'], ['With {{i|Sharp Plug}} and any combination of items that can infinitely regenerate health, the D6 can be used to reroll items indefinitely.'], ["Be careful when rerolling, as it will replace the item with another item from the '''current''' room's item pool. This can be used as an advantage in various ways; for example, after defeating {{E|The Fallen}}, the item will be drawn from the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool]], so Isaac can safely roll the item into another from that pool. This behavior can also be an advantage in {{r|Angel Room}}s since {{I|Key Piece 1}} and {{I|Key Piece 2}} can be rerolled to get a free Angel Room item."]]

name: Box of Spiders
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns 1-4 [[Blue Spider]]s that deal 2.5x damage to enemies.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns 4-8 [[Blue Spider]]s that deal 2x damage to enemies.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns 1-4 [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns 4-8 [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Blue Spiders deal 2.5x Isaac's damage."], ["{{dlc|r}} Blue Spiders deal 2x Isaac's damage."]]

name: How to Jump
description: Upon use, Isaac jumps in the direction he is currently moving, allowing travel over [[obstacles]] and [[Monsters|enemies]].
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac jumps in the direction he is currently moving. The distance of the jump depends on how fast Isaac was moving and for how long he was holding the button when the item was activated. Jumping allows Isaac to travel over [[obstacles]] such as rocks and pits.'], ['While mid-jump, [[Monsters|enemies]], projectiles, {{E|bomb}}s, and [[spikes]] cannot damage Isaac. Isaac cannot interact with [[pickups]] or {{E|chest}}s mid-jump.', ["If Isaac has a Stompy trait (from items such as {{I|Leo}} and {{I|Thunder Thighs}}), rocks won't be destroyed mid-jump"]], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['How to Jump can be used to easily dodge fast moving projectiles, as jumping in any direction should mean that the projectile is gone before you land.', ['Standing still while jumping only grants invincibility for the first jump. Isaac has to move to regain invincibility while jumping']], ['If Isaac has [[flight]], Isaac dashes instead of jumping. This is functionally the same as jumping, but without the animation playing. Isaac will have invincibility during the dash, and the dash will only stop on terrain that can be walked on.', ['While flying above a pit, the dash distance will be very short.']], ['This item can also be used to pass through otherwise impassible {{r|Crawl Space}} walls.'], ["Isaac can't jump through doors, which means damage from {{r|Curse Room}} doors cannot be avoided."], ['If this item is activated by {{i|Void}}, it is possible to get stuck in an impassable area with no ability to escape. Exiting and resuming the run will place Isaac at whichever door he entered the room through.'], ['{{dlc|r}} How to Jump can be used to jump over pillars and spiked rocks safely.']]

name: Book of Revelations
description: Increases the chance of a {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}} appearing while held. On use, gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}, and replaces the boss of the current floor with a [[Harbinger]] if possible.
effects: [['On use, gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}.'], ['Increases chance for a {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} door to open by 17.5% ({{dlc|na}}35%) if held while killing the final [[boss]] of the [[floor]].'], ["If the Book of Revelations is used at least once on a floor, a [[Harbinger]] will {{dlc|anr}} sometimes/{{dlc|r}} always replace the current floor's boss if possible."], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['Set bosses ({{e|Mom}}, {{e|Isaac}}, {{e|The Lamb}}, etc.) are unaffected by Book of Revelations.'], ['Only the first boss of a floor affected by {{cu|Labyrinth}} is affected.'], ["Book of Revelations won't replace the boss on double-sized {{r|Boss Room}}s, like [[Double Trouble]] rooms or if the boss is {{e|Mr. Fred}}.", ['Furthermore, if the Book of Revelations is used on the first floor of a Chapter with a Double Trouble room no Harbinger will spawn on the second floor, even if Book of Revelations is used again. If finding a Harbinger is desired, Isaac should wait until seeing the shape of the Boss Room before using it.']], ['Keeping Book of Revelations until [[Chapter 4]] is one of the methods to unlock achievements related to Super Meat Boy and Super Bandage Girl, [[Super Meat Boy#Book of Revelations|explained in detail here]].'], ['This item can replace the Boss even after Isaac initiates a battle with a normal boss and then teleports out before the fight is completed.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} This item can ({{dlc|r}} will) replace {{e|The Bloat}} with a Harbinger in {{chal|Aprils Fool|n}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Bosses in {{s|Downpour}} / {{s|Mines}} / {{s|Mausoleum}} and their variants cannot be replaced with Harbingers.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} This item will replace {{e|Mother}} with Death or Conquest during {{chal|Red Redemption}}.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Sagittarius
description: Increases [[speed]] by +0.2 and grants [[piercing tears]].
effects: [['+0.2 [[speed]]', ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.2 maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).']], ['Grants [[piercing tears]].']]

name: Scapular
description: Once per room, when Isaac is reduced to his last half heart, he is granted one {{E|Soul Heart}}.
effects: [['Once per room, when Isaac is reduced to his last half [[heart]] (either red, soul, or black), the aura around his head temporarily vanishes and he is granted one {{E|Soul Heart}}.', ['After re-entering a room, the ability can be triggered again.', 'With {{E|Bone Heart}}s, the effect triggers on both half-filled and empty ones.']]]
notes: [["If the Scapular is active and Isaac is already at his last half heart, the effect won't trigger even on fatal damage.", ["{{C|Tainted Samson}} / {{I|Berserk!}}: If fatal damage activates Tainted Samson's Berserk, or if it occurs during it or during Berserk!'s effect, it will trigger and grant the soul heart."]], ['{{dlc|a}} Scapular does not charge between waves in [[Greed mode]], though it can still be recharged by moving between rooms.'], ['Does not work with {{C|The Lost}} or {{C|Keeper}}, as they cannot reach the required heart value.'], ['Reaching only half a heart remaining may be more difficult in [[Chapter 4]] onwards, since all half-heart hits are upgraded to a full heart.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Damage sources that count as "health donation" no longer activate Scapular. This includes {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}, {{M|Devil Beggar}},  {{M|Hell Game}}, {{M|Confessional}}, {{i|IV Bag}}, {{i|Razor Blade}}, {{i|Blood Rights}}, {{i|Dull Razor}}, {{i|Sharp Plug}}, {{i|Shard of Glass}}, {{i|Blood Bombs}}, and {{i|Blood Oath}}. Sacrifice Rooms and Curse Rooms spikes still activate Scapular.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Bob's Rotten Head
description: Upon use, Isaac holds a [[Status Effects#Poison|poison]] {{E|bomb}} which can be thrown in the cardinal directions and explodes on impact.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac holds a [[Status Effects#Poison|poison]] {{E|bomb}} which can be thrown in the cardinal directions and explodes on impact.', ["The bomb can fly across the room for a range before falling to the ground and explode, a distance equal to that of Isaac's tears' if the player's current [[range]] is 9.50.", "{{dlc|nr}} The explosion deals a flat 50 + Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] and poisons affected enemies.", "{{dlc|r}} The explosion deals a flat 185 + Isaac's tear damage and leaves behind a gas cloud that poisons affected enemies. The poison cloud deals 5 damage.", '{{dlc|na}} The poison deals 6 or 8 points of damage over time.', "{{dlc|a}} The poison deals 3 times Isaac's tear damage over time.", '{{Dlc|r}} It will bounce off walls slightly before exploding on the floor.']], ['This item belongs to the {{Transformation|Bob}} set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Bob.']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Sloth}}.'], ["Bob's Rotten Head is affected by many tear modifiers and some bomb modifiers. Notable exceptions and precautions are listed below."], ["Bob's Rotten Head cannot directly impact {{Machine|Beggar}}s, {{Machine|Slot Machine}}s, or {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s, just passing through, but can destroy them with the blast damage if it impacts anything nearby and open {{R|Secret Room}}s, {{R|Super Secret Room}}s, or destroy [[rocks]] like any other bomb."], ['Certain interactions require Flat Stone to be effective or work.']]

name: Trinity Shield
description: Isaac gains a shield that protects him from enemy shots. It aims in the direction Isaac fires from.
effects: [['Isaac uses a shield to block shots.'], ['The shield stays in the same direction until Isaac fires in another direction.']]
notes: [['The shield can block diagonally by holding down 2 arrow keys at once.', ['Tears will be fired vertically while the shield is at an angle.']], ["The shield can't block beams or explosions."], ["The shield can be held in any direction if you're using a joystick."], ["Many items that change the color of Isaac's tears will also change the color of the shield; this effect is purely cosmetic."], ['When using Tainted Forgotten, the shield goes on the bone pile and not the soul.']]

name: Magic Mushroom
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Makes Isaac bigger. Adds one Red [[Heart Container]], +0.3 [[Damage]], x1.5 damage multiplier, +5.25 [[Range]], and +0.3 [[Speed]], and restores all Health.
{{dlc|r}} Makes Isaac bigger. Adds one Red [[Heart Container]], +0.3 [[Damage]], x1.5 damage multiplier, +1.5 [[Range]], and +0.3 [[Speed]], and restores all Health.
effects: [['Grants Isaac one Red [[Heart Container]].'], ['+0.3 [[Damage]].'], ['x1.5 damage multiplier.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[Range]]'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[Range]].'], ['+0.3 [[Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['Restores all [[Health]].'], ['Isaac grows in size.'], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}'], ['{{transf|Stompy|item}}']]

name: The Virus
description: Isaac [[poison]]s enemies on contact. {{dlc|nr}} -0.1 [[speed]]. {{dlc|r}} +0.2 [[speed]]. {{dlc|anr}} Poisoned enemies have a chance to drop a black heart when killed.
effects: [['Inflicts [[poison]] on enemies who make contact with Isaac.', ['{{dlc|na}} The poison deals 2 damage per tick (3 damage per second) and lasts for 2-3 ticks.', "{{dlc|ana+}} The poison deals Isaac's damage per tick (1.5x Isaac's damage per second) and lasts for 2-3 ticks.", "{{dlc|a+nr}} The poison deals Isaac's damage per tick (1.5x Isaac's damage per second) and lasts for 6 ticks for [[Monsters|normal enemies]] and 3 ticks for [[bosses]].", '{{dlc|r}} The poison lasts for 6-7 ticks and deals damage equal to (0.2']], ['HeartContainers^2) + 2, where HeartContainers is the total number of [[Health#Red_Heart_Containers|heart containers]] and {{E|bone heart}}s Isaac has.', ['The poison can be continuously applied to bosses, which normally are immune to status effects for a brief time after being inflicted with one.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Lets Isaac deal 24 contact damage per tick on top of applying poison (48 damage per second).'], ['{{dlc|anr}} Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop [[Black Heart]]s.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.1 [[speed]] down.', ["{{dlc|na}} This is not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated."]], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.2 [[speed]] up.'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|anr}} The black heart is only dropped if the poison was caused by The Virus. The item's effect doesn't extend to poison tears."], ["{{dlc|anr}} If an enemy doesn't do contact damage, The Virus can safely be applied to it for more chances at black hearts. {{E|Fly|display=Flies}}, {{E|Mulligan}}s, and {{E|Host}}s are the most common enemies this can be applied to.", ['{{dlc|anr}} With {{i|Skatole}}, {{E|Hive}}s and {{E|Swarmer}}s will constantly spawn normal Flies, meaning they can be endless sources of Black Hearts.', "{{dlc|na+}} Although {{E|Stoney|display=Stonies}} and {{E|Shopkeeper}}s can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched."]], ["Enemies won't start taking poison damage if they are pushing up against Isaac; The Virus will be constantly trying to apply poison and refreshing the ticks where poison damage would occur.", ['{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Gnawed Leaf}} and The Virus can still work if Isaac has a short-range orbital such as {{i|Cube of Meat}} or {{i|Ball of Bandages}}, as it will kill enemies pushing against Isaac that are not taking poison damage while still dropping Black Hearts.']]]

name: Roid Rage
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +0.6 [[speed]], +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc+|r}} +0.3 [[speed]], +1.50 [[range]]{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +0.6 [[speed]]'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]]'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.3 [[speed]]'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.50 [[range]]'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]]'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]

name: Raw Liver
description: Grants 2 [[Red Heart container]]s and completely restores [[health]].
effects: [["Gives Isaac 2 Red [[Health|Heart containers]] and fully restores Isaac's [[health]]."]]

name: Wooden Spoon
description: Increases [[speed]] by 0.3.

name: Mom's Heels
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]], enemies that touch Isaac take 12 damage.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Makes Isaac deal 12 contact damage per tick (24 damage per second).'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: The Bean
description: Isaac farts, [[poison]]ing any enemy in close range.
effects: [['Isaac farts, dealing 5 damage and [[poison|poisoning]] any enemies within close range for 6 ticks.', ["The poison deals {{dlc|na}} 3.5 damage per tick, or {{dlc|a}} Isaac's tear damage.", 'The area of effect is 1 tile in all directions.', '{{dlc|r}} The fart also has knockback.']]]

name: Teleport!
description: Teleports Isaac to a random [[Rooms|room]] on the current [[Chapters|floor]].
effects: [['Teleports Isaac to a random [[Rooms|room]] on the current [[Chapters|floor]].']]
notes: [['It is possible to teleport to the {{R|Secret Room}} or {{R|Super Secret Room}}.'], ['It is not possible to teleport to the {{R|I AM ERROR}} room.'], ['It is not possible to teleport to the {{R|Crawl Space}} for the floor or the {{R|Black Market}}.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{mode|greed}} It is possible to teleport to a {{R|Super Secret Room}} with no doors, resulting in the player being stuck.']]

name: Lucky Foot
description:
+1 [[luck]]. Increases chance of winning {{M|Shell Game}}s and {{M|Fortune Telling Machine}}s (independent from the luck stat).
{{dlc|r}} Converts all bad [[pill]]s into good pills, without identifying them.
effects: [['+1 [[luck]].'], ['Increases chances of winning at {{M|Shell Game}}, {{Machine|Hell Game}},  {{M|Slot Machine}}, {{M|Fortune Telling Machine}}, and {{M|Confessional}}.'], ['Increases chances of getting a room-clearing drop (independent from the luck stat).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Converts all "bad" [[pill]]s into their "good" counterparts but doesn\'t affect neutral ones, like {{i|PHD}}. Pills remain unidentified.']]
notes: [['{{C|Cain}} starts with this item by default.']]

name: Pentagram
description: +1 [[damage]], increases {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} chance by 10%.
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ['Increases chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} door to open by 10%.', ['Chance is increased by 15% with two Pentagrams.']], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [['If the Devil Room item pool is depleted, {{i|Sacrificial Altar}} will spawn one or two Pentagrams.']]

name: Lord of the Pit
description: Grants [[flight]] and +0.3 [[speed]].
effects: [['Grants [[Flight]].'], ["+0.3 [[speed]] ({{dlc|na}} not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated).\n== Notes =="], ['{{i|Spirit of the Night}} costs the same amount of Red Hearts as Lord of the Pit, while granting [[spectral tears]] instead of increased speed. ItÂ´s strongly recommended to take Spirit of the Night if the player has the choice.']]
notes: [['{{i|Spirit of the Night}} costs the same amount of Red Hearts as Lord of the Pit, while granting [[spectral tears]] instead of increased speed. ItÂ´s strongly recommended to take Spirit of the Night if the player has the choice.']]

name: The Mark
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one {{e|Soul Heart}}, +1 [[damage]], and +0.2 [[speed]].
{{dlc+|r}} Grants one {{e|Black Heart}}, +1 [[damage]], and +0.2 [[speed]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Grants one {{e|soul heart}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Grants one {{e|black heart}}.'], ['+1 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[speed]].'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]

name: We Need to Go Deeper!
description: Creates a trapdoor to go to the next [[Chapters|floor]]. {{dlc|r}} Once per floor, using it on tiles with special graphics will instead create a {{r|Crawl Space}}.
effects: [['Spawns a trapdoor that leads to the next [[Chapters|floor]] upon activation.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} There is a 10% chance the trapdoor will instead lead into a {{R|Crawl Space}}.', '{{Dlc|r}} Some tiles will appear with a special graphic (for example grass or a piece of garbage in {{s|Basement}}). Using this item on these tiles will guarantee a {{R|Crawl Space}}. Only one trapdoor to the Crawl Space can be made per floor, as all subsequent uses will guarantee a trapdoor to the next floor.', 'If used in {{s|Womb}} II/{{s|Utero}} II/{{s|Scarred Womb}} II, the trapdoor will always lead to {{s|Sheol}}.']]]
notes: [['If more than one {{R|Crawl Space}} trapdoor exists, they will all lead to the same {{R|Crawl Space}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Has no effect in the {{S|Cathedral}}, {{S|Chest}}, {{Stage|Sheol}}, {{Stage|Dark Room}}, {{dlc|a}}{{S|???}} and {{Dlc|a+}}{{Stage|The Void}} (no trapdoors of any type will be generated).', ['{{Dlc|r}} Can only create crawl space trapdoors in the aforementioned stages and in {{S|Corpse}} II, {{S|Home}} and during the [[Ascent]].']], ['A trapdoor cannot be placed in front of a {{R|Secret Room}} entrance position, making this item an indirect aid to locating Secret Rooms.'], ['This item can be used to destroy [[rocks]] if used while Isaac is [[flight|flying]] over a rock.'], ['This item can be used to create a trapdoor to {{s|Sheol}} on {{Stage|Womb}}, even before Sheol has been unlocked.'], ['When used on the last floor of a [[Challenges|challenge]], a trapdoor to the next floor can spawn. If it is entered, Isaac must beat the boss of that floor to spawn the ending trophy.', ['{{Dlc|r}} While trapdoors will no longer spawn on challenges on floors at the final destination, certain challenges like [[Red Redemption]] may still spawn a trapdoor leading to the next floor.']], ['{{dlc|a+}} The item may be used on the [[dirt patch]]es in the {{s|Dark Room}} to dig up a random type of [[Chests|chest]].']]

name: Spider Bite
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[slow|slowing tears]], reducing speed of enemy movement and any projectile fired by them.
effects: [['Adds a 25% chance to shoot [[slow|slowing tears]], reducing the speed of enemy movement and any projectile fired by them.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [['The slow duration is 2.5 seconds.'], ['The slow effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(4 - (Luck / 5)). At base luck (0), the chance is 25%, maxing out at 100% at 15 luck.', ["Due to how this formula works, increases in activation rate are only seen with every 5 points of luck, as this formula rounds down after dividing Isaac's luck by 5."]]]

name: Spelunker Hat
description: Reveals type of adjacent rooms, including location for {{R|Secret Room}}s and {{R|Super Secret Room}}s.
effects: [['Reveals on the map what type of [[room]] all rooms adjacent to your current room are (Shop, Sacrifice Room, etc.).', ['Can also reveal {{r|Secret Room}}, {{r|Super Secret Room}}, and even {{r|Mini-Boss Room}}.', '{{Dlc|r}} Reveals rooms up to 2 rooms away.']], ['{{Dlc|r}} Blocks projectiles falling from above.'], ["Cannot block Mom's Foot."]]

name: Remote Detonator
description: {{E|Bomb}}s placed by Isaac only explode when Remote Detonator is used. Gives 5 bombs.
effects: [['Activating the Remote Detonator will cause all {{E|bomb}}s placed by Isaac to explode.'], ['Bombs will no longer explode without the usage of the detonator.'], ['Gives 5 bombs when picked up. If the item is picked up a second time in the same run, this effect will not be applied.']]
notes: [['Remote Detonator gives Isaac five bombs for the price of three (using the bombs on the {{M|Donation Machine}} to trade for coins) when bought at a {{R|Shop}}, making its purchase a good value if the player is low on bombs.', ['{{dlc|r}} The Donation Machine explodes once bombed and while it drops many coins, it is destroyed for the rest of the run']], ['Remote Detonator does not control the explosions of {{E|Troll Bomb}}s and {{E|Mega troll bomb}}s.'], ['It does control throwable bombs spat out by {{E|Bomb Grimace}}s, once picked up. The bombs can be carried throughout rooms without ever exploding until Remote Detonator is used, making a Bomb Grimace essentially equivalent to a Golden Bomb with this item.'], ['If {{E|Chub}} or {{E|Carrion Queen}} swallow a remote bomb, the bomb will be released from them after the animation unless it is detonated manually.']]

name: Portable Slot
description: Upon use, consumes 1 {{E|penny}} and has a chance to drop a random [[pickup]], like a {{M|Slot Machine}}.
effects: [['Upon use, consumes 1 {{E|Penny}} and has a chance to drop a random [[pickup]], like a {{M|Slot Machine}}.', ['Unlike a {{M|Slot Machine}}, the default reaction to using a bad [[Pill]] will occur if the Portable Slot grants nothing.']]]
notes: [["Unlike normal Slot Machines, the Portable Slot can't explode, nor can it drop {{i|A Dollar}}, although it can still grant [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]]."]]

name: Crystal Ball
description: Upon use, reveals the map (except the {{R|Super Secret Room}}) and drops a {{e|Soul Heart}} or random [[tarot card|card/rune]].
effects: [['Reveals the [[Chapters|floor]] layout and all special rooms except the {{R|Super Secret Room}}.'], ['Drops either a {{e|Soul Heart}} or a random [[Cards and Runes|card or rune]]. (50% chance of either)'], ['{{dlc|r}} While held, increases the chance of finding a {{R|Planetarium}} by 15%, or 100% if a treasure room has been skipped.']]
notes: [['The map revealing effect will not work if the {{cu|Lost}} is active.'], ["It's possible to get more than one Crystal Ball from {{M|Fortune Telling Machine}}s on a single run."], ["{{dlc|r}} The Planetarium bonus guarantees the level generation to ''attempt'' placing one, but the level layout may not have enough room. Read the article on {{r|Planetarium}}s for further details."]]

name: The Pinking Shears
description: Separates Isaac's head from his body for the current [[Rooms|room]], granting [[flight]] and turning the body into a [[familiar]] that chases enemies.
effects: [["Separates Isaac's head and body for the current [[Rooms|room]].
