Isaac's head, which now has [[flight]], will be under the player's control, while his body will seek out enemies to attack by contact damage.", ["The body's movement speed is dependent on Isaac's [[speed]].", '{{dlc|nr}} The body deals 5.5 damage per tick, or up to 82.5 damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} The body deals 5.5 damage per tick. <!--Tick rate was lowered. The current DPS needs to be added.-->']]]
notes: [["The damage of the body [[familiar]] is independent of Isaac's stats. Its damage per second is the highest of all chasing familiars."], ["{{dlc|r}} If Isaac's body is not visible (for example, through the effects of {{i|Transcendence}} or previous uses of the Pinking Shears), the familiar will take upon a ghost-like body, similar to the Lost's body type."], ['If used multiple times in the same room (via battery pickups, for example), more instances of the body familiar can be spawned.'], ['Compared to the original game, where the {{e|Gusher}} sometimes walked aimlessly around the room, this version actively chases enemies.'], ['If Isaac switches active items while The Pinking Shears is in effect, the body will immediately despawn for the rest of the room.'], ['The body familiar will avoid [[creep]], and will consequently rarely damage enemies like {{e|Brain}}s and {{e|Blighted Ovum}} that leave creep trails as they walk, instead opting to stand right next to them.'], ['Using The Pinking Shears just above an obstacle results in the body becoming stuck in the terrain, making it useless until the obstacle is destroyed.']]

name: Anarchist Cookbook
description: Spawns six {{e|Troll Bomb}}s around the [[room]].
effects: [['Spawns six {{e|Troll Bomb}}s, usually near the center of the [[room]].'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{e|Pride}}.'], ['Although visually unchanged, all passive {{E|bomb}} effect items affect the spawned Troll Bombs unless otherwise noted.'], ['The Troll Bombs created by Anarchist Cookbook spawn in one at a time; if Isaac leaves the [[room]] soon after using it, not all 6 Troll Bombs will spawn.'], ['Using this item without any blast protection is not always recommended as it is very easy to be caught in the blast.']]

name: Best Friend
description: Spawns a decoy Isaac that explodes after 5 seconds. Enemies will always target the decoy and ignore Isaac.
effects: [['Spawns a decoy vaguely resembling Isaac in his crying animation, which explodes after 5 seconds with the blast radius of a {{E|Mega troll Bomb}}.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The explosion deals 110 [[damage]].', '{{dlc|r}} The explosion deals 185 [[damage]].']], ['The decoy bomb distracts enemies, as they will target the decoy instead of Isaac regardless of distance.']]
notes: [['All {{E|bomb}} modifier items will affect Best Friend, with the exception of {{i|Bobby-Bomb}}, {{i|Bomber Boy|force=nr}}, {{i|Fast Bombs}}, {{i|Mr. Mega}}, and {{i|Rocket in a Jar}}.', ['{{i|Scatter Bombs}} will create mini decoys.']], ['Bosses such as {{E|Chub}} or {{E|Carrion Queen}} can swallow the decoy bomb just like a regular bomb.'], ['Isaac can push the decoy bomb by walking into it or shooting it with his tears just like regular bombs.']]

name: A Lump of Coal
description: The more distance tears travel, the more damage they will do.
effects: [['Tears gain a flat damage bonus of about +0.5-0.6 per tile of distance traveled, unaffected by all multipliers. There is no upper limit to the bonus.']]
notes: [["A Lump of Coal can be found as a drop from {{E|Krampus}}, a possible payout of {{I|Mystery Gift}}, or using {{I|Spindown Dice}} on {{I|Guppy's Paw}}."], ['The item has somewhat of an opposite effect of the item {{i|Proptosis}}, which makes Isaac deal more damage at close range. Proptosis is based on a shrinking multiplier instead of an increasing flat bonus, however.']]

name: Mom's Coin Purse
description: Spawns 4 random [[pill]]s near Isaac.
effects: [['Spawns 4 random [[pill]]s near Isaac.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Book of Shadows
description: Creates a protective [[shield]], nullifying all types of damage in the current room for 10 seconds.
effects: [['Creates a protective [[shield]], nullifying all types of damage in the current room for 10 seconds.'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['The Book of Shadows effect negates [[health]] loss from {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{Machine|Devil Beggar}}s, {{Machine|Hell Game}} and {{Machine|Confessional}}.', ['Does not prevent damage from {{i|IV Bag}}.']]]

name: Dry Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and blocks enemy projectiles. Upon blocking a shot, it has a chance of triggering {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and blocks enemy projectiles. Upon blocking a shot, it has a 10% chance of triggering {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect, dealing 40 damage to all enemies in the room.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{i|The Necronomicon}} effect can occur multiple times in the same room.'], ['It can be used to block multiple shots if positioned correctly.'], ["It sometimes layers itself above {{i|Isaac's Heart}}, protecting it from nearly all projectile damage."], ['This item can rarely drop from [[Rocks|skulls]].']]

name: Rotten Meat
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Stigmata
description: +0.3 [[damage]], grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Odd Mushroom (Thin)
description: +1.7 [[tears]], +0.3 [[speed]], slightly reduces [[damage]].
effects: [['+1.7 [[tears]].'], ['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ["Makes Isaac's head smaller, which on its own is only a visual effect.", ['If combined with other size downs, the Mushroom also affects his hitbox.']], ['Reduces [[damage]] using the following formula: (Damage Ups from other items'], ['0.9) - 0.4.'], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [['There are two collectible items in the game named [[Odd Mushroom]]; you can tell them apart from the sprites.'], ["This item affects damage differently than other items in the game. Instead of multiplying your damage stat, it directly alters the total added damage from other items. In practice, this means this item reduces your damage significantly if you have no items that grant extra damage (x0.72), but won't have as strong of an impact as you collect more 'damage up' items."]]

name: Tough Love
description: Adds a chance to shoot a tooth instead of a tear, which deals x3.2 Isaac's [[damage]].
effects: [["Adds a chance to shoot a tooth instead of a tear, which deals x3.2 Isaac's [[damage]]."]]
notes: [['The chance for this to occur increases with [[Luck]]. The activation rate is equal to 1/(10 - Luck). At base Luck (0), the chance is 10%, maxing out at 100% at 9 Luck<ref>[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing|The Binding of Isaac Item Trigger Testing]</ref>.']]

name: Mutant Spider
description: Grants quadruple shot but decreases [[Tears]].
effects: [['Isaac fires 4 tears at the same time.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears down: (Delay'], ['2.1) + 3.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears fired per second'], ['0.42.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Mutant Spider is a [[special item]].'], ['The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating {{i|20/20}}, {{i|The Inner Eye}}, Mutant Spider and {{i|The Wiz}} is 16, or 20 with the {{C|Keeper}}.']]

name: Toothpicks
description: +0.7 [[tears]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].
effects: [['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['+0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['Tear color becomes red.']]

name: Squeezy
description: Increases [[tears]] by 0.4, spawns 2 {{E|Soul Heart}}s.
effects: [['+0.4 [[tears]].'], ['Spawns two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.']]

name: Speed Ball
description: +0.3 [[speed]], +0.2 [[shot speed]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ['+0.2 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]

name: Sister Maggy
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around shooting tears that deal 3.5 damage.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around shooting tears that deal 6 damage.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and shoots normal tears.', ['These tears appear red, but have no special effects.', '{{dlc|nr}} Tears deal 3.5 damage, and are fired once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Tears deal 6 damage, and are fired once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Sister Maggy is functionally identical to {{i|Brother Bobby}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Sister Maggy deals more damage than {{i|Brother Bobby}}, while Brother Bobby has a higher tear rate.']]

name: Blood Rights
quote: Mass enemy damage at a cost
description: Upon use, takes a full heart of [[health]] and deals 40 damage to all enemies in the [[room]].
effects: [["Upon use, takes a full heart of [[health]] and activates {{i|The Necronomicon}}'s effect, dealing 40 damage to all enemies in the [[room]].", ['{{dlc|r}} This bypasses [[Damage Scaling]].']]]
notes: [["If Isaac doesn't have the required {{E|Red Heart}}s or filled {{E|Bone Heart}}s, then {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, and empty Bone Hearts are taken instead."], ['Using this item does not affect {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} chances.'], ['Using this item as {{C|The Lost}} will kill The Lost, even if the protective effect from {{i|Holy Mantle}} is still active.']]

name: The Book of Belial
description:
{{dlc+|na}} +2 [[damage]] for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Passively guarantees a {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} will appear while held.{{dlc-}}
{{dlc+|a}} +2 [[damage]] for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Passively increases the chance of finding a {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} while held.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['Gives +2 [[damage]] for the current [[Rooms|room]].'], ['{{dlc|na}} Guarantees the {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} to spawn after killing a [[boss]] while holding it.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Increases the chance to open the {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} after killing a [[boss]] by 12.5% while holding it.'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['{{C|Judas}} starts with this item by default.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The damage bonus does not stack with multiple uses in the same room or with {{p|XV - The Devil}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Additional uses in the same room or combined with {{p|XV - The Devil}} give +1 damage per use.']], ['While activated, switching items will end the bonus damage effect.'], ['If the {{I|Schoolbag}} and a second activated item are held, the book must be equipped in the primary slot to receive the {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}} bonus.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Only guarantees Devil/Angel Rooms on floors that they can normally appear on, and, unlike {{i|Goat Head}}, picking up The Book of Belial after killing the boss will not open the Devil/Angel Room door.']]

name: The Book of Sin
description: Generates a random [[pickup]], [[pill]], [[card]], or [[rune]].
effects: [['Generates a random [[pickup]], [[pill]], [[card]], or [[rune]].', ['This includes {{p|Cracked Key}}, {{p|Dice Shard}}, and {{p|Emergency Contact}}.', '{{E|Red Heart|display=Hearts}} can be of any type other than {{E|Blended Heart}}s.', '{{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} can be of any type, with higher value coins and {{E|Lucky Penny|display=Lucky Pennies}} being rarer.', '{{E|Bomb}}s and {{E|Key}}s will always be singular (unless Isaac has {{i|Bogo Bombs}} and/or {{i|Humbling Bundle}}).', "{{dlc|r}} Batteries spawned can only be {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}} and, more rarely, a {{E|Mega Battery|n}} or {{E|Golden Battery|n}}. The Book of Sin cannot generate a {{E|Micro Battery|n}}."]], ['Each pickup seems to be equally likely, which means that there is around a 1/7 chance to get a particular type of pickup.'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]

name: The Candle
description: Throws out a flame that damages everything in its path, diminishing in size as it travels.
effects: [['On use, Isaac raises the candle above his head. On pressing a fire button, a blue flame, similar to a {{E|blue fire place}}, will fire in the chosen direction, extinguishing itself after a fixed time of approximately two seconds.'], ['The flame deals 23 damage per damage tick.', ['The maximum damage dealt by a single flame is around 276, dealing damage roughly 6 times per second.']], ['The flame also destroys enemy shots it comes into contact with.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} While Isaac holds the candle above his head, his movement speed is reduced.'], ["Will block Isaac's tears, unlike {{I|Red Candle}} and won't burn him."], ['Flames do not drop any collectibles when doused.'], ['The flame can destroy {{E|shopkeeper}}s.'], ['The flame projectile can pass over Pits, but can not travel through Rocks or Poop.'], ['The flames from this item can put out {{E|fire place}}s.']]

name: D20
description: Rerolls all [[pickup]]s in the current [[room]].
effects: [['Randomizes all [[pickup]]s, [[chest]]s, and [[trinket]]s within a [[Rooms|room]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} The empty chest object that is left behind after opening any kind of chest can be re-rolled.'], ["Cannot re-roll pickups into {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}, but can re-roll pickups into {{E|Grab Bag}}s which can contain Lil' Batteries.", ["{{dlc|r}} Can re-roll pickups into Lil' Batteries and other battery pickups."]], ['It can re-roll pickups into chests or trinkets and vice versa.', ['On {{s|Chest}} and {{s|Dark Room}}, the re-rolled chests will always contain items unless they are a {{E|Red Chest}}.', 'Re-rolls create trinkets far less often than pickups and chests.']], ['It can re-roll pickups in the {{r|Shop}}.'], ['Re-rolling pickups duplicated by {{p|Rune of Jera}}, {{i|Diplopia}} and {{i|Crooked Penny}} will result on both the original item and the duplicate being the exact same pickup.', ['{{Dlc+|r}} Can re-roll both items created by {{I|Options?}}, but only one can still be taken.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{A|Golden Trinket}}s rerolled by D20 will cause the resulting pickup to have the golden effect applied to it. If this is a trinket, the affected trinket will act as a normal golden trinket would, otherwise the gold effect will do nothing and will disappear upon leaving and reentering the room.', ['Additionally, items spawned by chests with the gold effect applied will be golden as well, however other pickups dropped by chests will not be.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Can reroll coins dropped by {{c|Tainted Keeper}} into other pickups, but they will still disappear if not picked up quickly.']]

name: Dad's Key
description: Upon activation, opens all doors in the current [[room]] in almost all circumstances, including doors which require a {{e|Key}} to open, entrances to {{r|Secret Room}}s, and the door to {{e|Mega Satan}}.
effects: [['Upon activation, opens all doors in the current [[room]] in almost all circumstances.']]

name: Dead Sea Scrolls
description: Triggers the effect of a random [[activated item]] from a list of possible options (not every activated item is included).
effects: [['{{i|Anarchist Cookbook}}'], ['{{i|Best Friend|r}}'], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}"], ['{{i|The Book of Belial}}'], ['{{i|Book of Revelations}}'], ['{{i|Book of Shadows}}'], ['{{i|The Book of Sin}}'], ['{{i|Crack the Sky}}'], ['{{i|Crystal Ball|r}}'], ['{{i|Deck of Cards}}'], ["{{i|Doctor's Remote|r}}"], ['{{i|The Gamekid}}'], ['{{i|The Hourglass}}'], ['{{i|Kamikaze!|nr}}'], ['{{i|Lemon Mishap}}'], ["{{i|Mom's Bottle of Pills}}"], ["{{i|Mom's Bra}}"], ["{{i|Mom's Pad|r}}"], ['{{i|Monster Manual|r}}'], ["{{i|Monstro's Tooth}}"], ['{{i|Mr. Boom}}'], ['{{i|My Little Unicorn}}'], ['{{i|The Nail}}'], ['{{i|The Necronomicon|r}}'], ['{{i|The Pinking Shears}}'], ['{{i|Prayer Card|r}}'], ['{{i|Satanic Bible|nr}}'], ['{{i|Shoop Da Whoop!}}'], ['{{i|Spider Butt|r}}'], ["{{i|Tammy's Head}}"], ['{{i|Telepathy for Dummies|r}}'], ['{{i|Teleport!}}'], ['{{i|We Need to Go Deeper!}}'], ['{{i|Wooden Nickel|anr}}'], ['{{i|Yum Heart}}\n']]
notes: [["When Bob's Rotten Head or Shoop Da Whoop! is chosen, Dead Sea Scrolls will not lose its charge until said item is thrown or released.", ['This allows Isaac to press Spacebar again if need be to skip over said items in the rotation while keeping full charge, allowing it to be used again for a different effect.', ["This doesn't work if Bethany has Soul Charges and Book of Virtues."]]], ["It may be helpful to use Dead Sea Scrolls upon entering an enemy room, as many of its effects such as The Gamekid and Tammy's Head are helpful in combat."], ['As many of Dead Sea Scrolls effects involve explosions, using it near [[Rocks|Tinted Rocks]] or potential {{R|Secret Room}} entrances can potentially be helpful when low on bombs.', ['While {{I|Anarchist Cookbook}} and {{I|Kamikaze!|nr}} can hurt the player, effects such as {{I|Book of Revelations}}, {{I|Satanic Bible|nr}}, {{I|The Nail}}, {{I|Crystal Ball|r}} and {{I|Prayer Card|r}} will pay out with more health than is lost long-term.']]]

name: Deck of Cards
description: Gives Isaac a random [[card]].
effects: [['Gives Isaac a random [[tarot card|card]].']]
notes: [['{{p|Dice Shard|anr}} is technically a card, but cannot be generated by the Deck of Cards.', ['{{p|Dice Shard|r}} and {{p|Cracked Key}} can be found in the Deck, albeit extremely rarely.']]]

name: Doctor's Remote
description: Creates a crosshair on the ground that can be aimed with tear controls. A missile strikes the spot after 2 seconds, creating a heavy damage explosion.
effects: [['Upon activation, a large red crosshair will appear on the ground. The player can control where the target is using the arrow keys.'], ['After approximately 2 seconds, a large missile will land on the red marker. The missile acts like a large bomb explosion dealing 20 times the Isaacâ€™s damage (the same as {{i|Epic Fetus}}).']]
notes: [['This item shares many of the synergies and interactions with Epic Fetus.']]

name: Forget Me Now
description: On use, [[Level Generation|re-generates]] the current [[floor]] with a new layout. Isaac loses Forget Me Now, but keeps other [[items]] and [[Pickups|consumables]] picked up on the original floor.
effects: [["On use, the current [[floor]] will be [[Level Generation|completely re-generated]] and Forget Me Now will be removed from Isaac's inventory.", ['Isaac will restart the level as if he had entered a new floor.']]]
notes: [['The re-generated floor will count as the same floor number as the one Isaac used Forget Me Now in.', ['If a {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} is not encountered after defeating the boss of the re-generated floor, the multiplier tied to the number of floors since the last Devil/Angel Room affecting the spawn chance will not change.', ['{{dlc|r}} If the first possible {{R|Devil Room}} is encountered, the 100% chance for the next deal to be an angel chance is preserved upon regenerating the floor.'], 'If a Devil/Angel Room is encountered before regenerating the floor, the multiplier will become x0.25 upon regenerating the floor.']], ["Any [[items]] earned before using the re-generation effect will remain in Isaac's inventory."], ['If used on the {{s|Depths}} / {{s|Necropolis}} / {{s|Dank Depths}} II after beating {{E|Mom}}, both {{i|The Negative}} and {{i|The Polaroid}} can be obtained in one run. Additionally, two {{R|Boss Rush}}es can be entered as long as the total playtime of the run stays under 20 minutes.', ['{{dlc|r}} This also allows opening the door to {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} II in the starting room.']], ["{{Dlc+|r}} If used on {{Stage|Downpour}} / {{Stage|Dross}} II after collecting {{I|Knife Piece 1}}, a second {{I|Knife Piece 1}} will spawn in the mirrored world's {{R|Treasure Room}}, which can be rerolled into a random item from the [[Treasure Room (Item Pool)]].{{dlc-}}"], ['If used on {{Stage|Chest}} or {{Stage|Dark Room}} when the door to {{E|Mega Satan}} has been opened, the golden key will not re-open the door and you will be unable to fight him.'], ['If used on an XL floor, the merged chapter can be re-generated as two separate floors instead.'], ["If used on [[Womb]] II/[[Utero]] II/[[Scarred Womb]] II after defeating [[Mom's Heart]], and Mom's Heart is again defeated on the regenerated floor, it will count as having defeated Mom's Heart 2 separate times, therefore unlocking 2 consequent [[endings]]."], ['{{R|Challenge Room}}s and {{R|Boss Challenge Room}}s will have the same rewards and enemy waves as the Challenge Room in the previous iteration of the floor.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If left in a Treasure or Boss Room and then returned to during the [[Ascent]], the Forget Me Now item will return to the room it was left each time it is used, allowing the floor to be repeated indefinitely.', ['This can be useful in conjunction with {{I|The Stairway}}, as it allows for unlimited Angel Shops to be visited.', 'Upon reentry, items, pickups, and trinkets left in treasure and boss room after using Forget Me Now will be removed and not converted into cracked keys.']], ['If used in Floor 1, the chance of Devil/Angel room is still 0%.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} If used on Mausoleum or Gehenna II after the special version of {{E|Mom's Heart}} is defeated, the newly generated floor will be dimly lit as though Mom's Heart was already defeated. Additionally, no items will naturally generate in rooms where they would have. After the player defeats {{E|Mom}} again, there will be no flesh door, and the trapdoor to {{Stage|Corpse}} will appear."]]

name: The Gamekid
description: Turns Isaac into a into a [[wikipedia:Pac-Man (character)|Pac-Man]]-like creature for 6.5 seconds, granting [[invulnerability]], inflicting [[Status Effects#Fear|fear]] on all enemies, and has a chance of replenishing a {{e|Half Red Heart}} every time an enemy is killed.
effects: [['Gives [[Effects#Invulnerability|invulnerability]].'], ['Inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies.'], ['Removes the ability to shoot tears.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Allows Isaac to deal 40 contact damage to enemies, at the rate of 1 hit per second per enemy.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Allows Isaac to deal 20 contact damage to enemies, at the rate of 2 hits per second per enemy.', ['If an enemy is at 40 HP or less, the contact damage is increased to 40 for that enemy.']], ['Has a chance to replenish a {{e|Half Red Heart}} every time an enemy is killed.']]
notes: [['The invulnerability effect negates all forms of damage, including health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.', ['This also negates damage from entering or exiting a {{r|Curse Room}}, but the effect is immediately removed upon walking through the door.']], ['Does not prevent [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]] loss from [[Health Down]] pills or [[Devil deal]]s.'], ['This item is very similar to {{i|My Little Unicorn}}, trading the extra speed for the ability to gain health from killing enemies.'], ['[[Pills|Power Pill!]] has the same effect as The Gamekid, same goes with {{T|Cartridge}} on getting hit.']]

name: The Hourglass
description: All enemies in the [[room]] are [[Status Effects#Slow|slowed]] for 8 seconds.
effects: [['All enemies in the [[room]] are [[Status Effects#Slow|slowed]] for approximately 8 seconds.']]

name: The Jar
description: When at full [[health]], up to 4 extra {{E|Red Heart}}s can be stored in The Jar. Activating drops the stored hearts on the ground.
effects: [['Isaac can store up to 4 extra {{E|Red Heart}}s in The Jar if there are no remaining empty [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Heart Containers]].'], ['When used, all Red Hearts in the jar are dropped on the floor, rather than directly consuming them.']]
notes: [['Red hearts are the only type of heart that can be stored. Blended Hearts do not count.'], ["If used in the two {{R|Super Secret Room}}s that contain nothing but a {{E|Black Heart}} or {{E|Eternal Heart}} (Room ID's 1 and 6), it will spawn those types of hearts instead."], ['If a whole red heart is picked up and Isaac only heals half a heart container, the other half is placed in the jar, indicated by the jar number increasing by one. Despite the jar indicating that it picked up a whole red heart in this fashion, it will only drop half a red heart on use. When picking up a double red heart, the jar will also store the remainder not healed in the same way.'], ['[[Co-op]] babies, except Magnet Baby, cannot add hearts to the jar, as they are unable to interact with pickups.'], ['The short-lived half red hearts dropped by {{C|Tainted Magdalene}} can be picked up and stored.']]

name: Kamikaze!
description: Creates an explosion around Isaac, damaging him and nearby enemies as well as destroying [[obstacles]].
effects: [["Upon use, creates an explosion on Isaac's position.", ['{{dlc|nr}} The explosion deals 40 damage.', '{{dlc|r}} The size and damage of the Kamikaze! explosion is identical to that of a {{I|Mr. Mega}} bomb, dealing 185 damage in a wide radius.']]]
notes: [["Despite the explosion usually damaging Isaac, Kamikaze! is not ''stricto sensu'' considered a self-damaging item because it is not the item's use which causes the damage, but rather the resulting explosion. This has a few consequences:", ['Kamikaze! does not bypass invincibility, which means items such as {{i|Holy Mantle}} or {{i|Tooth and Nail}} work normally.', 'Using Kamikaze! will cause the sword summoned by {{I|Damocles}} to start having a chance to fall at any point.']], ["Kamikaze!'s cooldown length is as long as the invincibility frames Isaac normally gets from being hit. This means that Isaac cannot activate Kamikaze!, and then activate Kamikaze! again before the invincibility frames end."], ["Synergizes with many bomb-enhancing items such as {{i|Bob's Curse}}, with exceptions listed in Interactions."]]

name: Mom's Bottle of Pills
description: On use, gives Isaac a random [[pill]].
effects: [['On use, gives Isaac a random [[pill]].'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Mom's Bra
description: [[Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies in the current [[room]] for around 4 seconds.
effects: [['[[Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies in the current [[room]] for around 4 seconds.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['Isaac keeps wearing the bra until he leaves the room, even after the petrifying effect has worn off.']]

name: Mom's Pad
description: Inflicts [[fear]] to all enemies in the [[room]] for 5 seconds.
effects: [['Inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies in the [[room]] for 5 seconds.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Monster Manual
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] from a specific selection for the current [[room]].
{{dlc|r}} Spawns a [[familiar]] from a specific selection for the current [[floor]].
effects: [["{{i|???'s Only Friend}}"], ['{{i|Angry Fly}}'], ['{{i|Ball of Bandages}}'], ['{{i|BBF|r}}'], ['{{i|Big Chubby|r}}'], ['{{i|Big Fan}}'], ['{{i|Bloodshot Eye|r}}'], ["{{i|Bob's Brain}}"], ['{{i|Boiled Baby}}'], ['{{i|Bot Fly}}'], ['{{i|Brother Bobby}}'], ['{{i|Cube of Meat}}'], ['{{i|Demon Baby}}'], ['{{i|Distant Admiration}}'], ['{{i|Dry Baby}}'], ['{{i|Farting Baby|r}}'], ["{{i|Fate's Reward|r}}"], ['{{i|Forever Alone}}'], ['{{i|Freezer Baby}}'], ['{{i|Friend Zone|r}}'], ['{{i|Fruity Plum}}'], ['{{i|Gemini}}'], ['{{i|Guardian Angel}}'], ['{{i|Halo of Flies}}'], ['{{i|Headless Baby}}'], ['{{i|Hushy|r}}'], ['{{I|Incubus|r}}'], ['{{i|Juicy Sack}}'], ['{{i|Leech}}'], ['{{I|Lil Abaddon}}'], ['{{i|Lil Brimstone}}'], ['{{i|Lil Delirium|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Gurdy|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Haunt}}'], ['{{i|Lil Loki|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Monstro|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Spewer|r}}'], ['{{i|Little Chubby}}'], ['{{i|Little Gish}}'], ['{{i|Little Steven}}'], ['{{i|Lost Fly|r}}'], ['{{i|The Peeper|r}}'], ['{{i|Psy Fly}}'], ['{{i|Robo-Baby}}'], ['{{i|Robo-Baby 2.0}}'], ['{{i|Rotten Baby}}'], ['{{i|Seraphim|r}}'], ['{{i|Shade|r}}'], ['{{i|Sissy Longlegs}}'], ['{{i|Sister Maggy}}'], ['{{i|Smart Fly}}'], ['{{i|Succubus|r}}'], ['{{i|Sworn Protector|r}}'], ['{{i|Tinytoma|r}}'], ['{{i|Twisted Pair}}\n'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Familiars spawned by Monster Manual last for the current room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Familiars spawned by Monster Manual last for the rest of the [[floor]].'], ['Familiars generated by Monster Manual do not contribute toward transformations.'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['It can spawn familiars not yet unlocked.'], ['If {{i|Cube of Meat}} or {{i|Ball of Bandages}} are spawned and Isaac already has either of those items, the level of these items will increase while the effect is active.'], ['Using Monster Manual is a good method to unlock achievements related to Super Meat Boy and Super Bandage Girl.', ["Using Monster Manual and enough {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}, Super Meat Boy and Super Bandage Girl can both be achieved in the same run.", 'If Isaac does not already have the Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages, Monster Manual can spawn a level 2 Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages in one use.']], ['{{i|Mongo Baby}} will not copy familiars spawned by Monster Manual.'], ['Familiars spawned by Monster Manual cannot be rerolled into other items by {{I|d4}} or {{I|d100}}.'], ['{{I|Box of Friends}} will not duplicate familiars spawned by Monster Manual.'], ['{{i|Tinytoma}} orbitals will persist between floors until they are all destroyed. They will not respawn outside of the floor they were generated in.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The familiars summoned by Monster Manual are items with a [[Item Tags monstermanual|monstermanual]] [[Item Tags|item tag]].'], ['{{C|Tainted Lazarus|r}}: If dead Tainted Lazarus has used Monster Manual, but living Tainted Lazarus progresses to the next floor (or vice versa), familiars from the previous floor are not removed. Upon exiting the game, or moving to the next floor as either character, any familiars retained this way are lost, meaning familiars cant be kept at most 1 extra floor.']]

name: Monstro's Tooth
description: A friendly {{E|Monstro}} jumps on a random enemy, dealing 120 area damage. Lands on Isaac if used in a [[room]] without enemies.
effects: [['A friendly {{E|Monstro}} jumps on a random enemy, dealing 120 damage while destroying nearby [[obstacles]] like rocks.']]
notes: [['This item will target Isaac if it is used in a [[room]] without monsters and will cause damage.'], ['Monstro will target {{E|shopkeeper}}s.'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} Like {{E|Mom}} and {{E|Satan}}'s stomp attacks, this attack is treated as an explosion, so {{i|Pyromaniac}} and {{i|Host Hat}} will be activated if Monstro falls on Isaac.", ['Due to this, if Monstro falls near the entrance to a {{R|Secret Room}}, it will be opened. This can be used to open {{R|Secret Room}}s for free.']], ['{{dlc|na}} This item does not affect the boss, {{E|Monstro}}.']]

name: Mr. Boom
description: Places a {{I|Mr. Mega}} {{E|bomb}} that deals 110 damage.
effects: [['Places a large {{E|bomb}} similar to ones produced by {{i|Mr. Mega}}.', ['Despite slightly different appearance, the bomb is functionally identical to a Mr. Mega bomb, being compatible with all [[:Category:Bomb_items|bomb modifiers]].']]]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{e|Wrath}}.']]

name: The Necronomicon
description: Deals 40 damage to every enemy in the [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Deals 40 damage to every enemy in the [[Rooms|room]].'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['Many collectibles will produce effects similar to the Necronomicon, such as depleting a {{E|Black Heart}} or blocking projectiles with {{i|Dry Baby}}.'], ['The Necronomicon deals a considerable amount of damage to bosses that have multiple damageable parts, e.g. {{E|Larry Jr.}} and {{E|The Hollow}}.'], ['This item also does high enough damage to instantly kill most non-boss enemies.']]

name: Notched Axe
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Isaac destroys [[obstacles]] and opens {{R|Secret Room}}s by walking into them, but cannot shoot or pick up items until it's cancelled.
{{dlc+|r}} Toggles between tears and the pickaxe, which can be swung to attack and break [[obstacles]]. Using it depletes the charge, and it can't be used until next [[floor]] once the charge runs out.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Isaac holds the Notched Axe above his head as long as he is in that [[room]], and can break any [[obstacles]] he touches, as well as being able to break through walls that lead into {{R|Secret Room}}s.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Isaac stops shooting tears and holds the Notched Axe like {{C|The Forgotten}}'s club, and can break [[obstacles]], blow open doors, and hit enemies for 3x damage by swinging it. The Notched Axe has 64 charges. Hitting rocks or opening doors depletes 1 charge for each obstacle destroyed. Hitting enemies depletes 2 charges. Isaac can toggle back and forth between tears and using the Notched Axe by pressing the Active Item button. Once the Notched Axe runs out of charges, it cannot be used for the rest of the [[floor]]."], ["{{dlc+|r}} The charges on Notched Axe cannot be refilled by means other than going to a new floor or picking up {{i|Iron Bar}}. This includes {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Batteries}}, {{M|Battery Bum}}s, {{i|4.5 Volt}}, {{i|Jumper Cables}}, etc.{{dlc-}}"]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac takes damage while using the Notched Axe, his current use of the Axe will end.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Isaac cannot attack or pick up other items while using the Notched Axe.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Activating the item while it is already being used will end the effect. This does not require any charge.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The Notched Axe may be used to get access to the {{s|Mines}}. The door will break open with one swing.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe shares its synergies with {{c|The Forgotten}}'s bone club. See that page for details."], ["{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe, like {{c|The Forgotten}}'s bone club, may be used to pick up items that are just out of reach over a pit or spikes. This does not require any charge."], ['{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe can open secret rooms, and so it can be used on walls to test for secret rooms without using charge.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe cannot free {{E|Sticky Nickel|n}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe can provoke an Angel Statue in {{R|Angel Room}}s, triggering the boss fight.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Obstacles destroyed by the Notched Axe will never fill pits.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Notched Axe can be used to destroy the {{E|Tuff Twins}} and {{E|The Shell}} bosses instead of using bombs.{{Dlc-}}']]

name: A Pony
description: Passively grants [[flight]] and increases [[speed]] to 1.5. Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving [[invulnerability]] during the charge and dealing damage to enemies hit.
effects: [['Passively gives [[flight]] whether it has charges or not.'], ["If Isaac's [[speed]] is less than 1.5, passively increases his speed to 1.5."], ['Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving invincibility during the charge and dealing contact damage to enemies.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The dash deals 40 flat contact damage to enemies.', "{{dlc|r}} The dash deals 4 times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 28 damage.", '{{dlc|r}} Isaac can dash through doors, which means damage from {{r|Curse Room}} doors can be avoided.', 'Invincibility granted by dashing will not prevent Isaac from being damaged by {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{M|Devil Beggar}}s, and similar self-damage active items (when holding {{I|Schoolbag}}).']]]
notes: [['This item is normally only obtainable by defeating {{E|The Headless Horseman}}.'], ['The [[flight]] and potential [[speed]] added by A Pony will be removed if a new activated [[item]] is collected.'], ['{{dlc+|a+}} If {{i|Void}} is used, Isaac will not be granted permanent flight.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} If Isaac dashes into an open door, he will continue to dash in that direction for a distance of 2 normal [[rooms]] unless he collides with a closed door/wall.', ['This allows Isaac to enter and exit curse rooms for free, provided A Pony is activated to give invincibility before charging through the exit.', 'Caution should be taken when dashing into rooms that has not been explored, as some of room layouts has {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} or {{M|Devil Beggar}}, which Isaac may dash into and get damaged.', ['This is more important to {{C|The Lost}} and {{C|Tainted Lost}} , as {{i|Holy mantle}} or {{P|Holy Card}} can not prevent damage from them.']]]]

name: The Poop
description: Spawns a pile of {{E|poop}} where Isaac is standing and [[Knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies. May yield [[pickups]] like regular poop.
effects: [['Spawns a pile of {{E|poop}} where Isaac is standing and [[Knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies. This pile of poop may yield [[pickups]] like regular poop.', ['{{dlc|a}} Also knocks back pickups and enemy shots upon use.']], ['{{transf|Oh Crap|item}}']]
notes: [['{{C|???}} starts with this item by default.'], ['Can bridge gaps when bombed from the opposite side (as if it was a [[Rocks|rock]]).'], ['Poops spawned by The Poop may give {{t|Petrified Poop}}, which gives better odds at future poop drops.'], ['If used on top of an obstacle while flying, it will only produce its sound effect, but no poop will be spawned.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The also applies to destroyed obstacles.']], ['If you have {{i|Thunder Thighs}} or {{i|Leo}}, the poop will be destroyed beneath you as soon as it is placed.'], ['After defeating {{E|Ultra Greedier}}, all remaining piles of poop in the room will be converted into golden poops.', ['{{dlc|r}} This effect is purely visual, the "golden" poop acts as regular poop despite the recolor.']], ["{{dlc|r}} The Poop can be used to destroy retractable spikes when they're retracted."], ['If used on top of a destroyed red poop, this will effectively remove it from the room permanently.']]

name: Razor Blade
description: On use, takes one {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}} of [[health]] and grants +1.2 [[damage]] for the current [[room]].
effects: [['On use, takes a full {{E|red heart}} of [[health]] and grants +1.2 [[damage]] for the current [[room]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc+|a}}{{C|Eve}} starts with this item after unlocking it and donating 439 [[coins]] to the {{m|Greed Donation Machine}}.{{dlc-}}', ["{{dlc|nr}} Both conditions must be met for Eve to hold it; donating 439 coins before defeating {{E|Satan}} with Eve will wrongly state on Eve's profile on the Character Selection Screen that she has it equipped.", ['{{dlc|r}} Eve now starts with the Razor Blade if unlocked from the Greed Machine, even if Satan has not been defeated with Eve.']]], ["If Isaac doesn't have a full {{E|Red Heart}} or a filled {{E|Bone Heart}}, then {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, and empty Bone Hearts are taken instead."], ['The effect stacks with itself and {{t|Red Patch}}, which provides a similar benefit.'], ['Using this item does not affect {{R|Devil Room}}/{{R|Angel Room}} chances.'], ['Using this item as {{C|The Lost}} will result in death.'], ["When picked up, Isaac's tears turn red, though this change is purely cosmetic."], ['The Razor Blade prioritizes Red Hearts first.', ['Using the Razor blade grants Isaac the regular immunity frames upon usage; this allows Isaac to enter cursed rooms without using soul hearts should he have them.']], ['Using this item in the {{E|Ultra Greed}} boss room will result in Isaac losing 2-4 coins and dropping 1-3 pennies on the floor similar to being hit by any of the greed enemies.']]

name: Shoop Da Whoop!
description: Fires a laser from Isaac's mouth.
effects: [["When used, the next shot will fire a large, {{i|Brimstone}}-like laser in the direction Isaac shoots that deals double Isaac's tear damage. If Isaac is already shooting, the item immediately activates in that direction.", ['The laser hits up to 13 times.', '{{dlc|a+}} [[Status effect]]s can be applied by the laser.']]]
notes: [["Despite the laser looking very similar to Brimstone, it doesn't share most of the Brimstone-specific interactions."], ['This item can drop from {{E|Envy}}.'], ['Can still be used while [[blindfolded]].'], ['This item synergizes extremely well with items that significantly increase damage such as {{i|Polyphemus}} and {{i|Ipecac}}.']]

name: Spider Butt
description: Deals 10 damage to all enemies in the room and [[Status Effects#Slow|slows]] them for 4 seconds. {{dlc|r}} Enemies killed by Spider Butt spawn [[Blue Spider]]s.
effects: [['Deals 10 damage to all enemies in the room and [[Status Effects#Slow|slows]] them for 4 seconds.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Enemies killed by Spider Butt spawn 1-3 [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]

name: White Pony
description: Passively grants [[flight]] and increases [[speed]] to 1.5. Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving [[invulnerability]] during the charge while also creating damaging beams of light.
effects: [['Passively grants [[flight]].'], ["If Isaac's [[speed]] is less than 1.5, passively increases his speed to 1.5."], ['Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving [[invulnerability|invincibility]] during the charge and damaging enemies while also creating beams of light.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The beams of light are spaced randomly around the room and deal the same damage as those created by {{i|Crack the Sky}}.', "{{dlc|r}} The beams of light deal 4 times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 10 damage and trail behind Isaac as he charges.", '{{dlc|nr}} The dash deals 40 flat contact damage to enemies.', "{{dlc|r}} The dash deals 4 times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 28 damage.", '{{dlc|r}} Isaac can dash through doors, which means damage from {{r|Curse Room}} doors can be avoided.', ['Although the dash can persist between rooms, the beams of light only occur in the room it is used in.']]], ['While not time-based, invincibility from White Pony is otherwise identical to damage immunity granted by the [[invulnerability]] effect.']]
notes: [['White Pony is only obtainable as a boss drop from {{E|Conquest}}, or from using {{I|Spindown Dice}} on {{I|Sacred Heart}}.', ['White Pony cannot be crafted with the {{I|Bag of crafting}}.']], ['If White Pony is replaced by another activated [[item]], Isaac will lose any passive benefits that it had granted.']]

name: Big Fan
description: Spawns a large [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 30 damage per second to enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a large [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 2 damage per tick (~8.57 damage per second) on contact.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [["The Big Fan is the largest of the orbital familiars, but also deals the least damage. {{dlc|a+}} Its contact damage is tied with {{i|Bloodshot Eye}} and its position of the lowest contact damage has been usurped by {{i|Mom's Razor}} while Isaac's damage stat is low."], ['The Big Fan has lower rotational speed than other familiars (similar to [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]]).'], ['The Big Fan orbits independently rather than occupying one of the three defense orbital slots.'], ['Affects the speed of all other orbitals, slowing them down a lot (NOTE: This effect does not happen until you get a new orbital after Big Fan).'], ["Horse pill versions of the Pretty Fly [[Pills|pill]] spawn a Big Fan without granting it as an item. Big Fans acquired this way spin at normal pace and don't affect rotation speed of other orbitals."]]

name: Bogo Bombs
description: All normal {{e|Bomb}}s become {{e|Double Bomb}}s.
effects: [['All normal {{e|Bomb}}s become {{e|Double Bomb}}s.']]

name: Cursed Eye
description: Grants charged tears that can be fired in a tight burst. Getting hit while charging will teleport Isaac to another room.
effects: [['Grants charged tears which fires a tight burst of shots, {{dlc|r}} shooting up to five shots when fully charged. Firing mid-charge will shoot fewer tears depending on the charge time.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The full burst size is four shots.', '{{dlc|nr}} Quickly tapping the fire key will result in no tears being fired.', 'Charging while a burst is currently firing will prevent the rest of the shots from being fired.']], ['Taking damage while charging (not fully charged) will teleport Isaac into another room.']]
notes: [['This item can be counterproductive, especially while fighting bosses, as getting hit while charging a shot will reset the fight.'], ['The teleport effect only occurs when taking damage while in the middle of charging, before the shot is fully charged. Having a high tears stat for faster charging will decrease the window where Isaac is vulnerable to teleporting.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} The teleporting and charge-up effects do not apply to {{C|Lilith}}. Her Incubus will fire three projectiles with each shot without needing to charge, tripling her damage output with no downside.'], ['Isaac is unable to fire tears if he hits 30+ TPS with this item.'], ["The color of Isaac's cursed eye will indicate what state it currently is in:", ['White: Inactive', 'Black: Charging up', 'Flashing black and white: Fully charged']]]

name: Fanny Pack
description: Has a chance to drop a random [[pickup]] when Isaac takes damage.
effects: [['Grants a 50% chance to drop a random {{E|Penny|display=Coin}}, {{E|bomb}}, {{E|key}}, or {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}} whenever Isaac takes damage.', ['The chances of the drops between each category are roughly equal.']], ['Having multiples of Fanny Pack neither increases the amount of drops, nor the drop chance.']]

name: Hive Mind
description: Increases the size of [[Blue Spider]]s and [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] and doubles the amount of damage they deal. {{dlc|r}} Also increases the effectiveness of fly and spider [[familiar]]s.
effects: [['Increases the size and doubles the damage of [[Blue Spider]]s, [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] and {{dlc|a+}} [[Locust]]s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Fly and spider familiars become stronger, exactly like {{i|BFFS!}}.', ['Having both Hive Mind and BFFS! gives no further benefit.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This item does not affect Fly familiars or orbitals.'], ['No effect on flies made passive by {{I|Skatole}}.']]

name: Holy Water
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a bottle [[familiar]] that breaks when Isaac takes damage, leaving a puddle of [[blue creep]].
{{dlc|r}} A bottle [[familiar]] that flies forward when Isaac shoots. It breaks upon hitting an enemy, leaving a puddle of [[blue creep]] that [[petrification|petrifies]] enemies.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac. If Isaac takes damage, it will shatter and create a pool of damaging [[blue creep]], similar to {{i|Lemon Mishap}}.', ['The pool lasts for ~9 seconds and deals 8 damage per tick to non-flying enemies (24 damage per second).', 'After breaking, Holy Water will reappear in the next room.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and launches itself in the direction Isaac shoots. Upon hitting an enemy, it will deal 7 damage and shatter, creating a pool of damaging [[blue creep]] that also [[petrification|petrifies]] enemies that touch it.', ['Once the pool disappears completely, Holy Water will respawn and can be fired again. Holy Water does not immediately respawn upon entering a new room.']]]

name: Juicy Sack
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and drips a trail of [[Status Effects#Effects|slow]] [[creep]], spawning 1-2 [[Blue Spider]]s after each [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac, leaving a trail of white [[creep]] that [[Status Effects#Effects|slows]] enemies.'], ['Spawns 1-2 [[Blue Spider]]s after every [[Rooms|room]].'], ['{{Dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]

name: Lil Brimstone
description: Grants a [[familiar]] that charges a thin {{i|Brimstone}} laser while Isaac is shooting.
effects: [['Grants a [[familiar]] that fires a thin {{i|Brimstone}} beam. It needs to be charged up; it will not fire if Isaac is shooting a steady stream of tears.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The beam deals 3.5 damage per tick and can strike an enemy up to 9 times, for a total of 31.5 damage.', '{{dlc|r}} The beam deals 2.5 damage per tick and can strike an enemy up to 8 times, for a total of 20 damage.', '{{dlc|nr}} Unlike Brimstone, Lil Brimstone can start charging up a beam while still firing the previous one.']], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|na}} Lil Brimstone is a [[Special Item]].'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Lil Brimstone takes priority over all other following familiars aside from {{i|Incubus}}, and will always appear first in line directly behind Isaac or second behind Incubus.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Little C.H.A.D.
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] who drops a {{E|Half Red Heart}} every 3 rooms.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar who drops a {{E|Half red heart}} every three rooms.', ['The first drop happens after two rooms.']]]

name: Little Chubby
description: Spawns a {{E|charger}} [[familiar]] that charges forward and deals contact damage to any enemies in its path.
effects: [['Spawns a {{E|charger}} [[familiar]] that charges across the [[room]] when Isaac shoots, dealing [[damage]] to any enemies in its path until it hits an [[obstacle]] or wall.', ['{{dlc|na}} Little Chubby is fired directly from where Isaac is standing.', '{{dlc|a}} Little Chubby is fired directly from where it is located in the chain of familiars behind Isaac.', 'The familiar deals 3.5 damage per tick (~52.5 damage per second).', "The familiar's attack is affected by momentum, just as tears are. Thus, it can be shot diagonally."]]]
notes: [['For Little Chubby to recharge, it must first get back to Isaac. Therefore, running away from Little Chubby after firing it will extend the time required to recharge it.'], ['The enemy {{E|Chubber}} can attack like this item, but they have limited range.']]

name: Little Gish
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires [[Slow|slowing tears]], impeding enemies' speed.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires [[slow|slowing tears]] that deal 3.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Little Gish shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Little Gish shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.']]]

name: Loki's Horns
description: Gives a random chance for projectiles to fire in all 4 cardinal directions.
effects: [['Adds a chance to shoot tears in four cardinal directions, similar to {{E|Loki}}.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} The chance is 25% at 0 [[Luck]], increasing by 12% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 7 luck and minimizes at 0% at -3 luck.', '{{Dlc|r}} The chance is 25% at 0 [[Luck]], increasing by 5% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 15 luck and minimizes at 0% at -5 luck.']]]

name: Magic 8 Ball
description: +0.16 [[shot speed]], spawns a random [[tarot card]]. {{dlc|r}} Increases the chance of finding a {{R|Planetarium}}.
effects: [['+0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['Upon pickup, drops a random [[tarot card]] near Isaac.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Adds an additional 15% chance for the first {{R|Planetarium}} to appear.']]

name: Match Book
description: Grants Isaac one {{E|Black Heart}}, spawns two or three {{E|Bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants Isaac one {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ['Spawns two or three {{E|Bomb}}s near Isaac.', ["{{dlc|r}} Drops the {{t|Match Stick}} if it hasn't yet been encountered."]]]
notes: [["It's advised to pay attention when picking up this item. The bombs that it spawns, like every other bomb pickup, has a chance to be replaced by a {{E|Troll Bomb}}."]]

name: MEAT!
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}
effects: [['Grants Isaac one full Red [[Red Heart container|Heart container]].'], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Mini Mush
description: Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit. {{dlc|nr}}+0.3 [[speed]], +1.5 [[tear falling speed]], -4.25 [[range]] (effective range is increased). {{dlc|r}} +0.3 [[speed]], +1.50 [[range]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -4.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.50 [[range]].'], ["Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit."], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Even though the range stat is decreased, the ''effective'' range is slightly increased due to the changes to the hidden tear falling speed attribute."]]

name: Mom's Contacts
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[Petrification|petrifying tears]], which stop enemies in place and prevent them from moving or attacking. {{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]]. {{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].
effects: [['Adds a 20% chance to shoot [[Petrification|petrifying tears]], which stop enemies in place and prevent them from moving or attacking.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]]. ({{dlc|na}} not applied until the next time Isaac's range stat is updated)."], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]]. ({{dlc|na}} not applied until the next time Isaac's tear falling speed is updated)."], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The activation chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to around 50% with approximately 20 luck.'], ['Petrifying the Heart of a {{E|Mask + Heart}} also freezes the Mask bound to it.'], ['Petrifying an enemy with a weak zone ({{E|Scolex}} or {{E|Carrion Queen}}) will make the enemy take damage anywhere while it is petrified, making combat significantly easier.']]

name: Mom's Eye
quote: Eye in the back of your head
description: Gives Isaac a chance to fire tears from the back of his head.
effects: [['Gives Isaac a chance to shoot a tear out of an eye on the back of his head.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} The chance is 50% at 0 [[Luck]], increasing by 25% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 2 luck and minimizes at 0% at -2 luck.', '{{Dlc|r}} The chance is 50% at 0 [[Luck]], increasing by 10% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 5 luck and minimizes at 0% at -5 luck.']], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Mom's Eyeshadow
description: Tears have a chance to [[charm]] enemies.
effects: [["Gives a chance to shoot [[charm|charming tears]], causing enemies to temporarily fight on Isaac's side."], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The chance for a tear to be charming depends on the [[Luck]] stat. The activation rate is equal to <math>1/(10 - (Luck / 3))</math>. With 0 Luck, the chance is 10%, maxing out at 100% at {{dlc|nr}} 27/{{dlc|r}} 26.95 Luck.', ["{{dlc|nr}} Due to how this formula works, increases in activation rate are only seen with every 3 points of Luck, as this formula rounds down after dividing Isaac's Luck by 3."]]]

name: Mom's Key
description: Adds 2 keys. {{E|Chest}}s will drop additional [[pickup]]s.
effects: [['Gives Isaac two {{e|Key}}s.'], ['If a non-{{e|Red Chest}} spawns [[hearts]], [[coins]], {{E|bomb}}s and/or {{E|key}}s, causes the chest to spawn a second group of said pickups, effectively doubling the average pickup yield.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [["Mom's Key cannot change the contents of a chest; it will only cause it to spawn extra pickups."], ['All other chest rewards (such as [[pill]]s, [[card]]s, [[item]]s, etc.) will not cause the chest to spawn additional pickups.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Does not affect {{e|Old Chest|n}}s.']]

name: Mom's Lipstick
description:
{{dlc|nr}}+5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +2.25 [[range]]. Spawns a {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}} on pickup.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +2.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns one random {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Mom's Purse
description: Allows Isaac to hold one additional [[trinket]]. {{dlc|r}} Drops a random trinket.
effects: [['Allows two different [[trinket]]s to be carried at once.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns one random trinket. Two copies of the same trinket can be held.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Money = Power
description: Increases [[damage]] by 0.04 for every {{e|penny|display=coin}} Isaac has, up to +3.96 damage at 99 coins.
effects: [['Adds 0.04 [[damage]] for every {{e|penny|display=coin}} Isaac has.', ['The more coins Isaac has, the less effective damage this item gives for picking up new coins.', 'The damage caps at +3.96 Damage at 99 coins.', 'Though Isaac can still collect coins if he already has 99, he will not gain any damage bonus from them.', 'Picking up multiple copies of this item will not increase the damage bonus.']]]

name: Monstro's Lung
description: Replaces normal tears with a charged shot that fires 14 tears in the same fashion as {{E|Monstro}}.
effects: [['Grants a charged shot that fires 14 tears in the same fashion as {{E|Monstro}}.', ['The attack can be released only when fully charged.', "Each tear deals 100% Isaac's [[Damage]].", 'Each tear has a random size multiplier between 0.9x to 1.33x, but there is no effect on damage.']], ['[[Tears]] down: {{Dlc|nr}}Tear Delay Ã— 4.3 / {{Dlc|r}} Fire Rate Ã· 4.3 (roughly 0.23x).']]
notes: [['Charge time can be found with the following equation:'], ['<math>\\text{(time)} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay)}) \\approx \\frac{1}{\\text{Fire Rate}}</math>'], ['Each tear has independant chance to have [[Tear Effects]].'], ["[[Tear falling speed]] ups will slightly reduce the effective range of Monstro's Lung.", ['{{dlc|r}} Since range ups always add to tear falling speed, every range up reduces effective range.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Multi-shot effects such as {{I|20/20}} or {{C|Keeper}} adds 2.4 tears to the barrage per tear they normally grant. The resulting amount is rounded, and is capped at 50.']]

name: Mr. Mega
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Increases the size, blast radius, and damage of Isaac's bombs.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["Gives all of Isaac's bombs increased damage and blast radius.", ['{{dlc|nr}} Mr. Mega bombs deal 110 damage instead of 60.', '{{dlc|r}} Mr. Mega bombs deal 185 damage instead of 100.']], ['When bombs explode, the screen will shake.']]
notes: [["It is possible to acquire this item more than once by killing multiple {{E|Super Wrath}}s on later floors; however, the bomb damage increase doesn't stack."]]

name: The Mulligan
description: Tears have a 1/6 chance of spawning allied [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] when they hit an enemy.
effects: [['Tears have a 1/6 chance of spawning allied [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] when they hit an enemy.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Because the {{transf|Guppy}} transformation includes the guaranteed ability to spawn flies on hit, the Mulligan's effect is nullified. This means individual tears cannot spawn more than one fly per hit.", ['{{dlc|r}} Guppy has been lowered to have a 50% chance of spawning a fly, allowing the 2 items to work together.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} This item does not work for {{C|Lilith}} since the {{i|Incubus}} tears do not count for her tears.'], ['Items and trinkets that increase tear firing rate synergize well with the Mulligan.'], ['This item is not affected by [[luck]].']]

name: Odd Mushroom (Large)
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one empty [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], and -0.1 [[speed]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants one full [[Heart container]], +1 [[damage]], +0.375 [[range]], and -0.2 [[speed]]
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Gives Isaac one empty [[Heart container]].', ['{{dlc|r}} Gives Isaac one full [[Heart container]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.3 [[damage]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1 [[damage]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.1 [[speed]].', ['{{dlc|r}} -0.2 [[speed]].']], ["Makes Isaac's head larger, which on its own is only a visual effect.", ['If taken when Isaac is smaller than the default, this Mushroom also increases his hitbox slightly.']], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [['There are two collectible items in the game named [[Odd Mushroom]]; you can tell them apart from the sprites.']]

name: Old Bandage
description: Grants an empty Red [[Heart container]]. Adds a chance of dropping a {{E|Red Heart}} after taking damage.
effects: [['Grants an empty Red [[Heart container]].', ['If the character cannot hold red heart containers they will simply be given a normal HP up.']], ['Adds a chance of dropping a {{E|Red Heart}} after taking damage.']]
notes: [["Old Bandage's Red Heart drop chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 50% at 29 luck."]]

name: Ouija Board
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] that travel through obstacles (but not enemies) instead of breaking on impact with them.
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]] that travel through obstacles (but not enemies) instead of breaking on impact with them.']]

name: The Parasite
description: Isaac's tears split in two when they hit something.
effects: [['Tears that deal more than 1.0 damage split into two tears with half damage and half remaining range on impact with obstacles or enemies.', ['Damage less than 1.0 causes the tears to simply disappear.', 'The splitting can keep up as long as the tears have range remaining and the damage of the split tears stays above 0.5.', 'Split tears are scaled down by 0.5x from the parent one, ignoring damage based size reduction.']]]

name: The Peeper
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that slowly floats around the room in a zig-zag pattern, damaging enemies it passes through.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that slowly floats diagonally around the room and bounces off walls. The eye blocks enemy shots and deals 8 damage per tick or about 17.1 damage per second to enemies it passes through.'], ['Gives tears shot from Isaacâ€™s left eye a red appearance. {{dlc|r}} All tears shot from the left eye will deal 35% more damage.']]
notes: [["The empty eye leaves behind a small blood trail. This doesn't affect anything and is a purely cosmetic effect."], ['The Peeper is distinguishable from the eyes emitted from {{E|Peep}} by the size of the pupil, it being noticeably bigger on The Peeper.'], ['A slightly better Peeper familiar can be spawned by {{I|The Scooper}}.']]

name: Punching Bag
description: Spawns a {{E|Mulligan}} [[familiar]] that wanders randomly. Enemies will attack the Mulligan if it's closer.
effects: [['Spawns a {{E|Mulligan}} [[familiar]] that walks around the [[room]] and acts as a decoy for [[monsters]].'], ['If the monsters are closer to the decoy than Isaac, they will attack the decoy.'], ['Punching Bag will also block enemy shots.'], ['{{dlc|ana+}} Punching Bag will die after taking too much damage and eventually respawn after a long time. Exiting and continuing the run will cause it to reappear right away.', ['{{dlc|ana+}} Punching Bag will reappear instantly each time a familiar or orbital item is picked up.']]]
notes: [['The Punching Bag will be targeted by enemies if it is closer to them than Isaac, for up to 6 seconds. Then they will target Isaac for 6 seconds regardless of distance, before acknowledging the Punching Bag again.'], ["{{dlc|ana+}} The Punching Bag will die instantly by enemies' beam-type attacks, such as {{i|Brimstone}} or by {{E|Uriel}}'s and {{E|Gabriel}}'s beam. This also includes enemies' {{i|Technology}} lasers such as {{E|Eye}} and {{E|Camillo Jr.}}"]]

name: A Quarter
description: Gives Isaac 25 {{E|Penny|display=coin}}s.
effects: [['Gives Isaac 25 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}.']]
notes: [['It has a chance to spawn when [[Urn]]s are destroyed or by killing {{E|Super Greed}}.', ['Multiple Quarters can be dropped in the same run by Super Greed, but will not spawn from Urns once picked up.']], ['Rerolling this item with the \xa0{{I|D4}}, \xa0{{I|D100}} ,\xa0{{I|Missing No.}}, or a 1 or 6 pip {{R|Dice Room}} will not remove 25 coins.']]

name: Rainbow Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires tears with random effects.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires tears with random effects similar to other familiars.'], ['The shot types and their damage are:', ['Short-range blood tear for 3 damage.', 'Plain red tear for 3.5 / {{dlc|r}} 6 damage.', 'V-pattern double shot for 3.5 damage each.', '[[Charm]]ing purple tear for 3.5 damage.', '[[Slow]]ing black tear for 3.5 damage.', '[[Spectral tears|Spectral]] tear for 3.5 damage.', 'Long-range [[Homing tears|homing]] violet tear for 3.5 damage.', 'Long-range [[Spectral tears|spectral]] and [[Homing tears|homing]] tear for 3.5 damage.', 'Blood tear for 4 damage.', 'Large blood tear for 5 damage.']], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['The type of tear is randomized with each familiar shot.']]

name: The Relic
description: Spawns a cross [[familiar]] that drops a {{e|Soul Heart}} after clearing enough [[room]]s.
effects: [['Spawns a small blue cross [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and drops a {{E|Soul Heart}} alternatingly:', ['{{Dlc|nr}} Every 5 or 6 [[room]]s.', '{{Dlc|r}} Every 7 or 8 [[room]]s.']]]

name: Robo-Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that shoots {{i|Technology}} lasers.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that shoots [[spectral tears|spectral]] {{i|Technology}} lasers that deal 3.5 damage each.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Robo-Baby shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Robo-Baby shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]

name: Rosary
description: Grants 3 {{E|Soul Heart}}s. Causes {{i|The Bible}} to appear in any [[item pool]]. {{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[tears]].
effects: [['Grants 3 {{e|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{i|The Bible}} is added to all [[item pool]]s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[tears]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['If The Bible has been picked up before collecting the Rosary, it will not be re-added to item pools.'], ['The Bible can be encountered multiple times even in the same pool if it is not picked up; however, once picked up, it cannot appear again anywhere.'], ['This item stacks with {{t|Rosary Bead}}, further increasing the chance to find The Bible in the {{R|Library}} and {{R|Shop}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The approximate chances of finding {{i|The Bible}} in each item pool are:', ['[[Treasure Room (Item Pool)|Treasure Room]]: 2.26%', '[[Shop (Item Pool)|Shop]]: 12.82%', '[[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss]]: 11.36%', '[[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room]]: 12.82%', '[[Angel Room (Item Pool)|Angel Room]]: 20.83%', '[[Secret Room (Item Pool)|Secret Room]]: 20.83%', '[[Library (Item Pool)|Library]]: 45.45%', '[[Golden Chest (Item Pool)|Golden Chest]]: 55.56%', '[[Red Chest (Item Pool)|Red Chest]]: 71.43%', '[[Beggar (Item Pool)|Beggar]]: 27.78%', '[[Devil Beggar (Item Pool)|Devil Beggar]]: 45.45%', '[[Curse Room (Item Pool)|Curse Room]]: 38.46%', '[[Key Master (Item Pool)|Key Master]]: 71.43%']]]

name: Rotten Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that spawns a [[Blue Fly]] when Isaac shoots. It can only have one Fly at a time.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] which spawns friendly [[Familiar#Blue Flies|Blue Flies]] when Isaac holds down a fire key.'], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['Spawns one Fly at a time.'], ["Blue Flies deal 2x Isaac's damage."], ["Flies will be generated regardless Isaac's ability to fire tears normally."]]

name: Rubber Cement
description: Tears bounce off walls, [[enemy|enemies]], and [[obstacle|environmental objects]].
effects: [['Makes tears bounce off walls, [[enemy|enemies]] and [[obstacle|environmental objects]].', ['Tears that bounce off of enemies bounce in random directions, whereas tears that bounce off of walls and other objects bounce directly back.', 'When tears bounce from enemies, they become able to hit the same enemy again should they bounce off of another enemy or obstacle.', '{{dlc|a+}} Tears bounce off bombs.']]]

name: Sack of Pennies
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{e|penny|display=coin}} every 2 [[rooms]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{e|penny|display=coin}} every 2 [[rooms]].', ['The first drop happens after 1 room.']]]

name: The Sad Onion
description: Increases tears by 0.7.

name: Skatole
description: [[Fly|Flies]] become harmless or less dangerous depending on the type.
effects: [['This item causes many [[Fly]] enemies to alter their behavior toward Isaac.', ['The following flies transform into a neutral normal {{e|Fly}}: {{e|Attack Fly}}, {{e|Dart Fly}}, {{e|Eternal Fly}}, {{e|Ring Fly}}, {{e|Army Fly}} and {{e|Swarm}}.', '{{dlc|nr}} The following flies move slower but will still deal contact damage: {{e|Boom Fly}}, {{e|Red Boom Fly}}, and {{e|Drowned Boom Fly|n}}.', 'The following flies move slower and deal no contact damage: {{e|Moter}}, {{e|Level 2 Fly}}, {{e|Pooter}}, {{e|Super Pooter}}, {{e|Bulb}}, {{e|Mama Fly}}, {{e|Bloodfly}}, {{e|Ultra Famine Fly}} and {{e|Ultra Pestilence Fly}}.', ['Pooters will not fire at Isaac, Moters will not split into Attack Flies, and Bulbs will not drain active item charges if touched.'], 'The following flies move slower and deal no contact damage, but can still damage Isaac through other means: {{e|Full Fly}}, {{e|Boom Fly}}, {{e|Red Boom Fly}}, {{e|Drowned Boom Fly}}, {{e|Sucker}}, {{e|Soul Sucker}}, {{e|Spit}}, {{e|Ink}}, {{e|Willo}}, {{e|Level 2 Willo}}, {{e|Dragon Fly}}, {{e|Dragon Fly X}}, {{e|Bone Fly}}, {{e|Sick Boom Fly}}, {{e|Tainted Boom Fly}} and {{e|Tainted Sucker}}.', ['Bone Flies will still throw bones at Isaac, and Willos and Level 2 Willos will still shoot.'], '{{dlc|nr}} The following flies are completely unaffected, retaining their normal attacks and speed: {{e|Swarm}}, {{e|Hush Fly}}, {{e|Sucker}}, {{e|Soul Sucker}}, and {{e|Spit}}.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Oh Crap|item}} {{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['This item can only be naturally obtained from the {{m|Shell Game}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Skatole exists in an otherwise unused shellGame item pool. This means it can also be acquired with {{i|Chaos|n}} and bosses in {{s|The Void}} can drop it.']], ["{{transf|Beelzebub}}'s effect overrides Skatole."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Flies spawned by {{e|The Husk}} will not become passive.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Due to being quality 0, Skatole cannot be obtained from {{m|Shell Game}}s after {{i|Sacred Orb|n}} has been picked up.'], ['This item makes {{e|The Duke of Flies}} a lot easier, as most of his attacks, which spawn flies, will instantly be converted. Staying out of his way while having Skatole can even make it so he ends up killing himself.']]

name: Skeleton Key
description: Gives Isaac 99 {{E|Key}}s.
effects: [['Gives Isaac 99 {{E|Key}}s.']]
notes: [['Rerolling this item with the {{i|D4}}, etc., will not remove the 99 keys.'], ['This item can appear when using the {{P|0 - The Fool?}} with 99 keys in inventory.']]

name: The Small Rock
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ["-0.2 [[speed]] ({{dlc|na+}} not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated).", ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.2 maximum speed.']], ["+0.2 [[tears]] ({{dlc|na+}} not applied until the next time Isaac's tears stat is updated)."]]
notes: [['Has a small chance to be dropped from a destroyed [[tinted rock]].', ["{{dlc|r}} The first encountered Super Special Rock is guaranteed to spawn The Small Rock if it wasn't seen before."]], ["Normally only appears once per run, but can appear again if Isaac's items are re-rolled with {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, or a {{R|Dice Room}}."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Always has a chance to spawn as long as Isaac does not currently have it. This includes the possibility of spawning and obtaining multiple copies of The Small Rock on the same floor if not picked up the first time.'], ['Taking the rock in the {{R|Boss Rush}} from a tinted rock in the room will count as taking an item and consequently trigger Boss Rush. The other items do not disappear and will stay until one is picked up.']]

name: Spiderbaby
description:
{{dlc|nr}} When hit, spawns 1-2 [[Blue Spider]]s.
{{dlc|r}} When hit, spawns 3-5 [[Blue Spider]]s.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns 1-2 friendly [[Blue Spider|Blue Spider(s)]] upon taking damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns 3-5 friendly [[Blue Spider]]s upon taking damage.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [["Essentially {{i|Infestation}}'s spider equivalent."]]

name: Starter Deck
description: Isaac can hold 2 [[Cards and Runes#Cards|cards]] at once and all [[pills]] are replaced by cards.
effects: [['Allows Isaac to carry two [[Cards and Runes|cards or runes]] at once. Cycle through cards by pressing the Control key (PC), R2 (PlayStation), RT (Xbox), or ZR (Switch, 3DS).'], ['Replaces all [[pills]] with cards. Pills already on the ground will be converted to cards or runes upon picking up Starter Deck.'], ['Spawns a random [[card]].', ['{{dlc|r}} [[Rune]]s, [[soul stone]]s, and other card-like consumables are also possible.']]]
notes: [['When picking up Starter Deck in a shop that has a pill for purchase, the pill can still be purchased and used. If the pill is dropped, it will be turned into a card.'], ["Picking up 2 Starter Decks won't allow you to carry 3 cards at once."]]

name: Steam Sale
description: Reduces all Shop prices by 50%, rounded down to 7 coins for an item, rounded up to 2-3 coins for a pickup.
effects: [['Halves shop prices.']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Greed}}, as well as a rare drop from {{E|shopkeeper}}s.'], ['[[Item]]s sold for 15 pennies will have their price reduced to 7.'], ['[[Pickup]]s sold for 5 pennies will have their price reduced to 3. Red hearts, normally sold for 3 pennies, will have their price reduced to 2.'], ['Multiple Steam Sales can be obtained via each of the normal drop methods.', ['{{dlc|na}} Multiple Steam Sales have no effect.', '{{dlc+|anr}} After obtaining 2 Steam Sales, all shop prices are set to 0 coins.', ['If Isaac has {{i|Restock}}, it is possible to collect an infinite supply of pickups/items. Extremely powerful when combined with {{i|Chaos}}.{{dlc-}}'], '{{dlc|r}} Multiple Steam Sales only further reduce prices, with each additional copy lowering prices less.', ["The price is lowered to <math>\\frac{price}{n+1}</math>, where ''n'' is the number of Steam Sales. For example, an item with 3 Steam Sales would cost <math>15 \\over 4</math> pennies, which is rounded up to 4."]]], ['{{dlc|ana+}} Steam Sale will cause the [[Deal with the Devil|Deals with the Devil]] not to convert the type of required heart automatically.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Prevents shops from having natural discounts on top of the Steam Sale discount.']]

name: Stem Cells
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] and +0.16 [[shot speed]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['+0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional heart of [[health]].']]

name: Steven
notes: [['{{Dlc|r}} Steven is much less common than his counterpart, spawning only 1/4th as often.'], ["Steven's arena will always look the same as {{e|Gemini}}'s."]]

name: Super Bandage
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] and 2 {{E|Soul Heart}}s.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] as well as two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['Heals 1 additional heart of [[health]].']]

name: Treasure Map
description: Reveals the map of each [[floor]]. It does not identify special rooms and does not reveal the locations of {{r|Secret Room}}s / {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.
effects: [['Reveals the map of each [[floor]]. It does not identify special rooms and does not reveal the locations of {{r|Secret Room}}s / {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.']]
notes: [['When combined with {{i|Blue Map}} and {{i|The Compass}}, the entire floor is revealed, identical to the effect of {{i|The Mind}}.'], ["Although not explicitly revealing it, the {{R|Boss Room}} can ''usually'' be found by locating the room farthest away from the starting room."]]

name: Whore of Babylon
description: Grants +1.5 [[Damage]] and +0.3 [[Speed]] whenever Isaac has a {{E|Half Red Heart}} or less.
effects: [['Grants +1.5 [[Damage]] and +0.3 [[Speed]] whenever Isaac has a {{E|Half Red Heart}} or less.']]
notes: [['{{c|Eve}} starts with this item by default, and has the following extra effects:', ['The item is activated at one full {{E|Red Heart}} or less.', 'Her damage multiplier increases from 0.75 to 1.0 when active.']], ['The effect is removed after leaving a room with more than half a heart (more than one full heart for {{c|Eve}}).'], ['The effect may not be immediately applied if Isaac has lost red hearts without taking damage; the effect will activate upon entering a new room.'], ["The effect is always active for characters without {{E|Red Heart}} containers, such as {{c|???}} and {{c|The Lost}}, though other characters can also lose their heart containers through Devil deals or items like {{i|Guppy's Paw}} or {{i|Abaddon}}.", ['{{dlc|r}} This also includes {{C|Tainted Jacob}} after being hit by {{E|Dark Esau|n}}.']], ['{{p|III - The Empress}} grants a similar effect to Whore of Babylon for the current room which does stack with Whore of Babylon.', ["Stacking ''The Empress'' on Whore of Babylon either via multiple cards or multiple activations of {{i|Blank Card}} increases damage by the number of uses ''squared'', e.g. +1.5"]], ['2'], ['2 total damage bonus for using the card on top of activated Whore of Babylon.']]

name: Wire Coat Hanger
description: Increases [[tears]] by 0.7.

name: X-Ray Vision
description: Reveals and opens all {{R|Secret Room}} and {{R|Super Secret Room}} entrances.
effects: [['Opens {{R|Secret Room}}s and {{R|Super Secret Room}}s automatically.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} When in {{s|The Void}}, the entrances are not automatically opened or even identified if the room is not yet cleared. Re-entering the room once enemies are killed and/or {{E|Silver Button}}s pressed will open the doors normally.']]

name: Telepathy for Dummies
description: Gives [[homing tears]] for the current room. {{dlc|r}} Also gives +3 [[range]].
effects: [['Grants the following effects for the current room:', ['[[Homing tears]].', '{{dlc|r}} +3 [[range]].']], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [["For any item interactions, check the corresponding sections on {{i|Spoon Bender}}'s page."]]

name: Death's Touch
description: +1.5 [[damage]], -0.3 [[tears]]. Tears are replaced with large [[piercing tears|piercing]] scythes.
effects: [['+1.5 [[damage]]'], ['-0.3 [[tears]]'], ['Grants [[piercing tears]].'], ['Tear size multiplier: 2x.'], ["Tears are replaced by {{E|Death}}'s scythes."]]

name: Humbling Bundle
description: Transforms {{e|Bomb}}s, {{e|Key}}s, {{e|Penny|display=Pennies}}, and {{e|Red Heart}}s into their respective Double versions. {{dlc|r}} This will occur only 50% of the time.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Transforms all {{e|Bomb}}s, {{e|Key}}s, {{e|Penny|display=Pennies}}, and {{e|Red Heart}}s into their respective Double versions.', ['{{dlc|r}} Provides a 50% chance to transform the aforementioned pickups into their respective Double versions.']]]
notes: [['Only works specifically on {{e|Bomb}}s, {{e|Key}}s, {{e|Penny|display=Pennies}}, and {{e|Red Heart}}s; other variants, like {{e|Nickel}}s or {{e|Soul Heart}}s, etc., are not doubled.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} By bombing {{m|Donation Machine}}s, Isaac can earn more money than is taken from the machine, giving an endless supply of coins until the machine breaks or he runs out of bombs.'], ['When used while fighting {{e|Greed}}, {{e|Hanger}}s, or {{e|Keeper}}s, every coin knocked out of Isaac will be worth two coins, allowing Isaac to net a profit.']]

name: Strange Attractor
description: [[Pickup]]s, [[trinket]]s, and [[monster]]s are magnetically attracted to Isaac's tears.
