notes: [['The ring is similar in appearance to the combination of {{i|The Ludovico Technique}} and {{i|Brimstone}}.'], ['It is identical to the ring created by {{i|Maw of the Void}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Especially effective against {{E|Envy}} and {{E|Super Envy}}. Each piece of Envy grants a 15% chance for a Black Heart. It is also effective against {{E|Brownie}} due to all the {{E|Brownie Corn}}s it spawns.']]

name: Kidney Bean
description: Isaac farts, [[charm]]ing all nearby enemies.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac farts, [[charm]]ing all nearby enemies.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The cloud deals 5 damage.']]]

name: Epiphora
description: Shooting in one direction increases Isaac's [[Tear delay|rate of fire]] until the cap is reached. As soon as Isaac changes direction or stops shooting, rate of fire is reset to its normal amount.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tear delay]] gradually decreases as the player shoots in one direction. Accuracy also decreases as the fire rate increases.', ['At max "charge", it will reduce tear delay by half, rounding down.']], ['{{dlc|r}} [[Fire rate]] gradually increases as the player shoots in one direction. Accuracy also decreases as the fire rate increases.', ['At max "charge", it will increase fire rate by double.']], ['Rate of fire returns to its original value if Isaac stops firing, changes firing directions, uses an active item, or is hit.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Being hit, changing rooms, and using items no longer reset the Epiphora bonus.', '{{dlc|r}} Entering an unexplored boss room will reset the Epiphora bonus.', ["During the delay when transitioning between rooms, picking up an item, or using an active item, it's possible to change the firing direction without resetting the bonus."]]]]
notes: [["Epiphora technically works with items that require a charge (such as {{i|Monstro's Lung}}), but requires releasing the key or button, causing players to lose the effect."]]

name: Glitter Bombs
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Bombs have a chance to drop random [[pickup]]s or [[charm]] enemies when they explode.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["Isaac's bombs have a 25% chance to spawn a [[pickup]] or [[trinket]] when they explode including other bombs.", ["{{dlc|r}} Isaac's bombs have a 63% chance to spawn a pickup or trinket when they explode, but the chance for either to generate decreases by 1% for each spawn until Isaac enters a new floor. This is to prevent items such as {{i|Dr. Fetus}} or a {{E|Golden Bomb}} from providing unlimited resources. This means that the maximum spawns per floor is 63, although the final generation of a pickup or trinket will have a 1% chance to occur."]], ["Isaac's bombs have a 15% chance to [[charm]] random enemies in the room when they explode."]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Picking up a {{E|Golden Bomb}}, {{i|Dr. Fetus}}, {{i|Epic Fetus}}, or {{i|Number Two}} with Glitter Bombs allows infinite pickup generation.', ['In [[Greed Mode]], infinite pickup generation is still possible, but excludes coins, presumably to prevent the player from filling the {{M|Greed Donation Machine}} in a single run. However, this can be worked around if Isaac has the {{t|Swallowed Penny}} or {{i|Piggy Bank}}, since it does still produce health.']]]

name: Mom's Pearls
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], +1 [[luck]].
{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]], +1 [[luck]]. Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +1.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['+1 [[luck]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Binky
description: Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}, +0.75 [[tears]] and decreases Isaac's size.
effects: [['Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['+0.75 [[tears]].'], ["Decreases Isaac's size."], ["Increases the pitch of Isaac's voice."]]

name: Mr. Dolly
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +0.7 [[tears]], +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], spawns 3 random types of {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}s on the floor when picked up.
{{dlc|r}} +0.7 [[tears]], +1.5 [[range]], spawns 3 random types of {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}s on the floor when picked up.
effects: [['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['Spawns 3 random types of {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}s on the floor when picked up.', ['These hearts are not subject to the Red/Soul/Black Heart chances; each type has an equal chance to spawn.']]]

name: Tech X
description: Tears are replaced with laser rings that pierce through enemies and deal damage to enemies within them. Can be charged to increase the effectiveness of the ring.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced with ring-shaped lasers.", ['Shots can be charged to increase the size of the rings.', 'The rings deal damage 15 times per second. Only the outer circumference of the rings will deal damage.', 'Rings pass through obstacles and enemies. Rings have infinite range and will travel until they hit a wall.', "{{Dlc|r}} Damage dealt is based on the amount charged, starting at around 25% Isaac's damage and approaches 100% at maximum charge.", ['<math>\\text{Charge Time} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay} \\times 3) + 1) \\approx \\frac{3}{\\text{Fire Rate}}</math>', '<math>\\text{Max Charge Damage per Tick} = \\text{Damage} \\times \\frac{5}{4}(\\text{Fire Rate} \\times (Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay} \\times 3) + 1) - 10)</math>', '<math>\\text{Min Charge Damage per Tick} = \\text{Damage} \\times \\frac{5}{4}(\\text{Fire Rate} \\times (Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay}) + 1) - 10)</math>', 'At 30.00 fire rate or above (0 tear delay or lower), charging is no longer needed and fires 30 rings per second. Higher fire rate results in higher laser damage.', ['<math>\\text{Damage per Tick} = \\text{Damage} \\times \\frac{5}{4}(\\text{Fire Rate} - 10)</math>', "Damage per Tick is capped at 100% Isaac's Damage, at 90.00 fire rate."]]]]]
notes: [['The rings are similar in appearance to the combination of {{I|The Ludovico Technique}} and {{I|Technology}}.'], ['The laser rings will linger for a brief moment upon touching a wall, allowing more damage to be dealt to enemies closer to walls.'], ['The "R U A WIZARD?" pill effect does not work with Tech X.'], ['Acquiring an extra copy of Tech X will shoot an extra laser ring.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Charging only increases size, not damage. It is useful for hard-to-hit enemies or hitting a wide area at once, but spamming small, uncharged shots will lead to much higher damage output.', ['{{Dlc|a+nr}} With the charge bars option enabled, the rings can be released immediately as the charge bar appears for easier gauging of maximum damage output.']], ["{{Dlc|r}} The maximum ring size is slightly smaller in ''Repentance''."]]

name: Tractor Beam
description: Isaac emits a beam from his face that his tears are bound to. {{dlc|nr}} Increases [[Tears]], [[Range]], and [[Shot Speed]]. {{dlc|r}} Increases [[Fire Rate]], [[Range]], and [[Shot Speed]].
effects: [["A beam appears directly in front of Isaac in the direction that his head is facing. Isaac's tears travel in the path of the beam.", ['When Isaac moves or turns his head, tears that are mid-flight will snap to the beam.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[Tears]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1.0 [[Fire Rate]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[Range]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[Range]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['+0.16 [[Shot Speed]].']]
notes: [['This item prevents Isaac from firing tears at angles using momentum.'], ['Having this item equipped prevents Isaac from automatically aiming downwards after he stops firing.'], ['This item grants Isaac immunity from the [[R U a Wizard?]] pill effect.']]

name: Multidimensional Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that will follow Isaac's movements on a 2.5-second delay. Tears that pass through the baby will be doubled and increase in speed.
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's path with a 2-second delay.", ['{{dlc|r}} The delay is 0.66 seconds instead.']], ['When a friendly tear passes through Multidimensional Baby, the tear splits into two parallel tears that gain a 1.33x shot speed boost, {{dlc|nr}} x1.5 range /{{dlc|r}} x1.5 [[tear height]] (which also increases effective range), and also a visual black and white flashing effect.']]
notes: [['It is possible to crash the game when combining this item with rapid-fire or multi-shot laser tears.'], ["Duplicated tears will deal the same damage as Isaac's tears."], ['If other familiars that move with a similar pattern such as {{i|Shade}} have been collected before the Baby, it will follow them instead with further delay.'], ['Standing perfectly still with the Multidimensional Baby inside of Isaac will activate its effect, as the tears will pass through it as they spawn.', ['This does not work with attacks such as Brimstone.']], ['{{dlc|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]

name: Night Light
description: A cone of light shines in the direction Isaac is moving that [[slow]]s enemies and enemy shots.
effects: [["A cone of light shines from Isaac's chest that slows all enemies and enemy shots.", ['The light will face the direction Isaac is moving.', "The light doesn't affect [[boss]]es, but it will slow their shots.", 'The slow effect will disappear from enemies when the light stops shining on them, but shots will remain slow.']], ['Removes {{curse|darkness}} for the current floor.', ["Doesn't provide immunity on later floors, but lessens the visual effect significantly, effectively removing the curse."]]]
notes: [['The light only needs to touch a shot once to slow it permanently.', ['Doing a quick circular motion is effective to slow surrounding enemy shots, especially while fighting {{E|Hush}}.', 'Overuse of this effect can cause unavoidable patterns, as the slowed shots will often still travel most of their original distance.']], ["{{dlc|r}} This item is '''not recommended''' against {{E|The Beast|n}}, as the fires spawned by her will be slowed down significantly and pile up quickly, leading to no room to dodge."], ["{{dlc|r}} Doesn't remove Curse of Darkness afflicted by {{p|XIX - The Sun?}}, no matter if Night Light was picked up before or after using the card. However, the visual effect is still lessened by the beam of light."]]

name: Box of Friends
description: Duplicates all of Isaac's [[familiar]]s for the current room. If Isaac has no familiars, spawns a {{i|Demon Baby}} for the room instead.
effects: [["Upon use, it adds one copy of each of Isaac's [[familiar]]s for the duration of the current room."], ['If Isaac has no familiars, a {{i|Demon Baby}} will spawn for the duration of the current room.']]
notes: [["{{C|Lilith}} starts with this item by default, even if it hasn't been unlocked yet."], ['If Isaac has more than one copy of the same familiar, it will still only add one copy.'], ['Blue Flies, Blue Spiders, and orbitals ({{i|Halo of Flies}}, {{i|Leprosy}}, etc) are not copied.', ['{{dlc|r}} It now copies some orbitals.']], ['Many familiars can be spawned in [[Greed mode]] and {{R|Boss Rush}}, as completing waves charges the item.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Familiars with the [[Item Tags uniquefamiliar|uniquefamiliar]] item tag are ignored by Box of Friends. If Isaac has only unique familiars, a Demon Baby is spawned.']]

name: D7
description: Restarts the current [[room]] and brings back all [[enemy|enemies]], allowing more rewards to be acquired by completing the room.
effects: [['Upon use, it restarts the room and respawns all enemies. [[Pickups]] or {{E|Chest}}s may be granted for clearing the room.']]
notes: [['Has no effect in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['Has no effect when used in a room that had no enemies, {{r|Challenge Room}}s, or {{r|Boss Challenge Room}}s.'], ['Will work in a {{r|Mini-Boss Room}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} When used in a {{r|Boss Room}}, {{r|Devil Room}}, or {{r|Angel Room}}, Isaac is teleported to another room on the floor, and the room he was in does not reset. The room Isaac teleports to will respawn enemies if it had them.', ['{{dlc|r}} D7 will not work when used in a {{r|Boss Room}}, {{r|Devil Room}} (it can be used to respawn [[Krampus]]), or {{r|Angel Room}}.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} When used in a {{r|Secret Room}} that previously contained {{E|Greed}} or {{E|Super Greed}}, the room becomes a regular Secret Room.', ['{{dlc|r}} No longer rerolls the room into a regular Secret Room; instead respawns Greed or Super Greed (depending on which one was present before).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} When used in a {{r|Shop}} that previously contained {{E|Greed}} or {{E|Super Greed}}, the Shop items will spawn. Rolling it again will cause new items to spawn on top of each other.', ['{{dlc|r}} No longer spawns a regular Shop; instead Greed or Super Greed respawns.']], ['When used in a room with a [[Champion]] enemy, the enemy will not respawn as a Champion.'], ['Can be used to generate infinite rewards with both {{i|9 Volt}} and {{t|AAA Battery}} and/or {{I|4.5 Volt}} depending on the enemies in the room.', ['If Isaac only has either {{i|9 Volt}} or {{t|AAA Battery}}, rewards can still be endlessly generated in a quadruple-sized room or an L-shaped room.']], ["Enemies respawn exactly where they first spawned, even if that's where Isaac is standing, in which case Isaac will take damage immediately upon use of the D7. Right next to doors is usually a safe place to use it."], ["{{Dlc|r}} If used in the [[Mirrored World]] of {{s|Downpour}} or {{s|Dross}} II, the rooms will not only have their enemies respawn, but all the normal non-mirrored contents such as pickups are restored. Using it in the Shop causes it to be stocked normally, and additional uses will restock the Shop's contents, unlike normal Shops."], ['{{Dlc|r}} As {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, enemies respawned by the D7 will drop the same type of coins as they had before using the D7. This can be used to quickly generate money from enemies that dropped high-value coins or greatly increase [[Luck]] if an enemy dropped a Lucky Penny.']]

name: Ventricle Razor
description: Can be used to place an orange portal and a blue portal. Upon entering a portal, Isaac is teleported to the other portal.
effects: [['When used for the first time, Isaac creates a blue portal under where he is standing. The next time he uses the item, he creates an orange portal under his feet. Isaac can then walk over either of the portals to teleport instantly to the location of the other one.'], ['Activating the item more than twice will replace the older of the two portals.'], ['The portals can be placed in any room. However, if a portal leads to a room with a negative grid index (i.e. {{R|Devil Room}}, {{R|Angel Room}}, {{R|I AM ERROR}} room, {{R|Crawl Space}}, {{R|Boss Rush}}, {{R|Black Market}}, {{E|Mega Satan}} room, or {{S|???}} portal room), Isaac will not be able to enter the portal.']]
notes: [['This item can be used to escape a {{R|Challenge Room}} or the {{R|Boss Rush}}.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Upon teleportation, Isaac is granted with a short invulnerability period which can be abused to trigger the {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} and {{M|Devil Beggar}} without losing health by placing a portal just next to it, teleporting, and touching the Donation Machine or Beggar in the same move. This trick is particularly useful for {{C|The Lost}}. The teleportation trick can also be used to escape a {{R|Curse Room}} without taking damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} This no longer works because the {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} and {{M|Devil Beggar}} take hearts without accounting for invincibility frames, however, a {{R|Curse Room}} can still be entered/exited for free.']], ['Portals will stay even if the item is dropped or changed.'], ['The item can prove useful in close quarters combat, allowing the player to attack one side, then dodge attacks and jump to the other side of the room to attack the enemies on that side.'], ['Upon entering a new floor, the previously placed portals will disappear.'], ['If {{cu|Maze}} is active, using portals placed between different rooms may result in a random destination. Two portals in the same room work reliably.', ["If room contents are randomized by the curse, it's possible for the portals to end up completely surrounded or even inside rocks or pits. If Isaac can't move to safety, the run can be quit and resumed to be placed at a door."]], ['{{Dlc|r}} On {{S|Downpour}} II, Ventricle Razor cannot be used to teleport between the normal and mirror world.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} This item can be useful to exit Mom's boss room to start the [[Ascent]], as long as you use it at least once before entering the boss room."], ['If this item is used while having the {{T|Broken Remote}} trinket Isaac will be teleported to a random room']]

name: Cambion Conception
description: After taking damage a certain amount of times, a permanent demonic [[familiar]] spawns.
effects: [['Upon taking damage a certain number of times, Isaac gains a permanent demonic [[familiar]]. Possible familiars include:', ['{{i|Dark Bum}}', '{{i|Demon Baby}}', '{{i|Incubus}}', '{{i|Leech}}', '{{i|Lil Brimstone}}', '{{i|Succubus}}', '{{i|Lil Abaddon}}', '{{i|Twisted Pair}}']], ['The first and second familiars will each spawn after taking damage 15 times. The third and fourth familiars will each spawn after taking damage 30 more times. No further familiars will spawn. As a result, after taking damage 90 times, four out of eight possible familiars will have spawned.'], ['Isaac will look progressively more pregnant as he takes damage.']]
notes: [["{{C|Lilith}} starts with this item by default, even if it hasn't been unlocked. Lilith can get a second {{I|incubus}} through this."], ['Only one of each type of familiar can be spawned.'], ['Familiars that have yet to be unlocked can spawn,  {{dlc+|r}} with the exception of {{i|Lil Abaddon}} and {{i|Twisted Pair}}, which must be unlocked before they can spawn through Cambion Conception.'], ['Only actually getting damage counts towards the payout. For example, negating damage with the {{i|Holy Mantle}} will not count.'], ['Familiars spawned this way do not count towards [[transformation]]s nor the [[collection page]].'], ['Familiars spawned by the item do not affect item pools, so multiple copies of one familiar can be obtained. For example, a second Incubus can be purchased after Cambion Conception spawns one.'], ['If a familiar obtained is a copy of another one already obtained, using {{i|Box of Friends}} will only clone one of that familiar.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} If this item is removed with {{P|XVII - The Stars?}}, it will also remove any familiars already obtained through Cambion Conception.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Chaos
description: Drops 1-6 random [[pickups]] on the floor. Causes [[items]] to be chosen from random [[item pool]]s.
effects: [['Drops 1-6 random [[pickups]] around Isaac.'], ['Causes items to be chosen from random [[item pool]]s.', ["Fixed item drops that ignore the current room's item pool will not be replaced. Examples include {{i|Cube of Meat}} after defeating one of [[The Harbingers]] as a floor boss, or {{i|the Small Rock}} after breaking a [[Tinted Rock]]."]]]
notes: [["When playing [[Greed mode]], items that are available only in the normal game will still not appear despite Chaos; the modes' different item pools stay separate."], ['As the item does not mix or combine item pools, it is possible to deplete smaller item pools and end up with {{i|Breakfast}} before all items in the game have been taken.', ['Thus, if Chaos tries to pull from an item pool that is already depleted, it will not pull from a different pool and instead give Isaac Breakfast.', ['As many Greed Mode item pools are small, Chaos tends to result in Breakfast more often during Greed mode.']]], ["{{dlc|nr}} Chaos will draw items even from item pools that are not used in the game, but defined in the game's files. The unused pools are bossrush containing nearly all bomb related items, challenge with a smaller selection of bomb items and dungeon containing several Mom related items and food items."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Since all item pools have the same probability of being selected, bomb-related items are much more common due to the [[Bomb Bum (Item Pool)|Bomb Bum]], bossrush and challenge item pools.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Each pool has a weight based on the number of items in the pool. Items from large pools such as [[Treasure Room (Item Pool)|Treasure Room]], [[Shop (Item Pool)|Shop]], and [[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss]] are very likely, while items from small pools like [[Bomb Bum (Item Pool)|Bomb Bum]] and [[Planetarium (Item Pool)|Planetarium]] are more rare.'], ['If an item outside of the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room pool]] appears as a [[Devil Deal]], it will always cost 1 Red Heart Container (or 3 Soul Hearts should Isaac have no Red Hearts).', ['{{dlc|r}} If an item from the [[Angel Room (Item Pool)|Angel Room pool]] appears as a [[Devil Deal]], it will cost 2 Red Hearts if it would cost 30 cents in the Angel Shop generated by {{i|The Stairway}}, and 1 Red Heart if it would cost 15 cents in the Angel Shop.', ['Similarly, if an item from the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room pool]] appears in an Angel Shop generated by {{i|The Stairway}}, it will cost 30 cents if it would cost 2 Red Hearts as a [[Devil Deal]], and 15 cents if it would cost 1 Red Heart as a [[Devil Deal]].']]], ["If an item that grants an {{E|Eternal Heart}} is taken in a devil deal, the eternal heart will ''not'' keep Isaac alive if he has no other hearts."], ['{{dlc|a+}} Bosses defeated in {{s|The Void}} drop items as if Chaos was active. Re-rolling the items uses the Boss Room pool as normal.']]

name: Scatter Bombs
quote: We put bombs in your bombs!
description: Adds 5 {{E|bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs explode into 2-4 tiny bombs.
effects: [['Gives Isaac +5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Isaac's bombs split into 2-4 tiny bombs after exploding.", ['{{dlc|r}} Bombs split into 4-5 tiny bombs.', 'Tiny bombs deal half damage and have decreased blast radius.', "Tiny bombs retain Isaac's bomb synergies (with the exception of {{i|Mr. Mega}} {{dlc|nr}} and {{i|Bomber Boy}}'s increased blast radius).", '{{Dlc|r}} Tiny bombs explode immediately upon landing.']]]

name: Jar of Flies
description: Killing an enemy adds a fly to the jar, up to a maximum of 20. On use, releases [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] equal to the number of flies in the jar.
effects: [['Killing an enemy adds a fly to the jar, up to a maximum of 20.'], ['Upon use, releases [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] equal to the number of flies in the jar.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [["Kills by blue flies and locusts (including flies from the jar) and shooting familiars (including {{i|Incubus}} and the launch attack from {{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Lilith}}'s fetus) do not add flies to the jar."], ['Blue spiders, orbital familiars, and chasing familiars do add flies to the jar.'], ['Friendly enemies such as from the {{i|Friendly Ball}} add flies to the jar, but not those spawned from other enemies.'], ['Batteries do not affect the number of flies in the jar.'], ["Enemies must be actually ''killed'' to add a fly; transformations (such as {{E|Gaper}}s turning into {{E|Pacer}}s) or knockouts (such as incapacitating a {{E|Globin}}) do not count as kills."], ['Destroying a {{E|shopkeeper}} will count as a kill.'], ['With items that kill normally unkillable enemies, killing things like {{E|Stone Grimace}}s will add flies to the jar.'], ['Killing minions in the Hush fight does not add flies to the jar.']]

name: PJs
description: Grants 4 {{E|Soul Heart}}s and fully restores Isaac's [[health]].
effects: [['Grants four {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['Heals 12 [[Hearts]].']]

name: Lil Gurdy
description: A {{E|Gurdy Jr.}} [[familiar]] that charges up while Isaac is firing, bouncing around the room when released and dealing contact damage based on its speed.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that can be launched in the direction the player is firing after a short charge-up period.', ['{{dlc|nr}} At full charge, it initially deals 6 damage per tick or 90 damage per second, but quickly drops towards 0 the slower the familiar moves.', '{{dlc|r}} No longer deals damage per tick, instead deals a fix amount of damage depending on charge level, at lowest being ~5 and at max being ~20.']], ['It bounces off walls multiple times, much like {{E|Gurdy Jr.}}', ['{{dlc|r}} It will also bounce off enemies.']]]

name: Marked
description: Isaac will automatically fire tears directed at a red target on the ground. The target can be moved with tear controls. +0.7 [[tears]], {{dlc|nr}}+3.15 [[range]]/{{dlc|r}}+3.0 [[range]].
effects: [['Creates a controllable crosshair. Isaac automatically and continuously fires towards the crosshair.', ['{{dlc|r}} The crosshair will not appear in each room until Isaac fires. Pressing the "drop" key or button (Keyboard default: left Control key; Controller default: right trigger) will make the crosshair disappear and stop Isaac from firing tears until a firing key is pressed again.<ref>https://www.reddit.com/r/bindingofisaac/comments/mi3z0l/important_protip_that_could_save_your_run_from/</ref>']], ['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +3.15 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +3.0 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.3 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} All familiars will fire towards the crosshair.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If taken with {{C|Lilith}}, Marked gives the stat upgrades but not the mark.'], ['On PC, it is possible to control Marked with the mouse. On Windows, go to {{code|C:/Users/[username]/Documents/My Games/The Binding Of Isaac [Rebirth/Afterbirth/Afterbirth+/Repentance]/}} and in the options.ini file, change the line that says {{code|MouseControl{{=}}0}} to {{code|MouseControl{{=}}1}}.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If taken with {{C|Tainted Lilith}}, when the baby is launched, it permanently fires at the crosshair. Pressing the "drop" key or button (Keyboard default: left Control key; Controller default: right trigger) will make the crosshair disappear and cause the baby to return to Tainted Lilith']]

name: Holy Light
description: Adds a chance to fire holy tears, which will create a damaging light beam in the area if they hit an enemy.
effects: [['Isaac has a chance to fire a glowing blue tear that, after colliding with an enemy, spawns a damaging beam of light (similar to {{i|Crack the Sky}}).', ["{{Dlc|nr}}Each beam of light deals quadruple (4x) Isaac's tear damage.", "{{Dlc|r}}Each beam of light deals triple (3x) Isaac's tear damage.", 'A single beam of light can damage multiple enemies.']], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['The chance to fire a holy tear (activation rate) depends on the [[Luck]] stat.', ['The activation rate is equal to 1/(11 - Luck).<ref>https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing</ref>', ['At base luck (0), the activation rate is 10%.', 'At 9 luck, the activation rate maximizes at 50%.']]], ["Its damage is multiplied from the tear's damage, not directly from Isaac's [[Damage]].", ["This means that, if the tears's damage has been multiplied from effects such as {{I|Proptosis}} or {{I|Tough Love}}, the beam's damage is also multiplied."]]]

name: Placebo
description: When used, copies the effect of the [[pill]] Isaac is currently holding without consuming it. Does not copy the effects of [[Cards and Runes|cards or runes]].
effects: [["Mimics the effect of Isaac's held [[pill]], like {{i|Blank Card}} does with [[Cards and Runes#Cards|cards]] and {{i|Clear Rune}} does with [[Cards and Runes#Runes|runes]].", ["Does not consume Isaac's held pill.", 'Does not mimic cards or runes.']], ['Will identify unknown pills when used.']]

name: Car Battery
description: Causes Isaac's activated item to activate twice on each use.
effects: [['Causes eligible [[activated item|activated items]] to activate twice on each use.', ['Of the {{dlc|r}}171 activated items, 45% â€“ 77 items â€“ [[Car Battery#No Effect|are not eligible]].']]]
notes: [['Having more than one Car Battery has no effect.']]

name: Charged Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that occasionally drops a {{E|Lil' Battery}}, gives an active item charge, or [[Status Effects#Petrification|petrifies]] all enemies in the room.
effects: [['Spawns a battery [[familiar]] that, while the player is in an uncleared room, every 30 seconds, starting from the moment it has been picked up, does one of the following:', ["Spawns a {{E|Lil' Battery}}. It does this a maximum of 2 times per [[Rooms|room]].", ['{{dlc|r}} Can also spawn a {{E|Micro Battery|n}} or {{E|Mega Battery|n}} instead.'], "Adds a charge to Isaac's [[Items#Activated Collectibles|activated item]]. It does this a maximum of 2 times per [[Rooms|room]].", '[[Status Effects#Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies for 1.3 seconds.']]]
notes: [["Charged Baby becomes very powerful as {{C|Lilith}} in [[Greed mode]], as the duplicates will continue to spawn Lil' Batteries, leading to a huge chain of familiars."]]

name: 8 Inch Nails
description: +1.5 [[damage]]. Replaces Isaac's tears with nails, which have increased [[knockback]].
effects: [['+1.5 [[damage]].'], ["Isaac's tears are replaced with nails, which have increased [[knockback]]."]]
notes: [["Does not grant penetrative shots, despite the appearance of Isaac's tears."], ["Any item that normally colors Isaac's tears red will cause the nails to become bloody."]]

name: Pay to Play
description: {{dlc|nr}} +5 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}. Most doors require one {{e|Penny}} to open instead of a {{e|Key}}.</br>{{dlc|r}} +5 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}. All locked doors, {{E|Locked chest}}s, and [[Key Block]]s must be opened with one {{e|Penny}} instead of {{e|Key}}s.
effects: [['+5 [[coins]].'], ['{{r|Shop}}s, {{r|Treasure Room}}s, and {{r|Libraries}} must be opened with a {{e|Penny}} instead of a {{e|Key}}. {{dlc|nr}}These doors appear identical to {{r|Arcade}} doors.'], ['{{dlc|r}} All locked doors, {{E|Locked chest}}s, and [[Key Block]]s must be opened with a {{e|Penny}} instead of {{e|Key}}s, including those that require 2 keys to open.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} Locked doors, chests, and key blocks gain a unique visual where their key slot is replaced with a vertical coin slot.']]

name: Eden's Blessing
quote: Tears up + your future shines brighter
description: +0.7 [[tears]] up. Grants a random [[item]] at the start of the next run.
effects: [['+0.7 [[tears]] up.'], ['Grants a random [[item]] at the start of the next run.', ["{{i|Key Piece 1}}, {{i|Key Piece 2}}, {{i|Broken Shovel 1}}, {{i|Broken Shovel 2}}, {{i|Mom's Shovel}}, {{i|Knife Piece 1}}, {{i|Knife Piece 2}}, and {{I|Dogma}} cannot be granted."]]]
notes: [['The effect still occurs whether the run was successful or not, even if the run was restarted.'], ["The effect does not work if Eden's Blessing was obtained on a [[seed]]ed run, during a [[Victory Lap]], a [[RERUN]], or during a [[challenge]].", ["Likewise, Eden's Blessing will not grant a free item at the start of a challenge or RERUN, instead granting the free item on the next valid run started.", ["Interestingly, seeded runs will still gain the benefit of banked Eden's Blessings, without depleting them. This means that it is possible to play an infinite amount of seeded runs, and they all start with a free item until a normal run is started."]]], ["Even if Eden's Blessing is re-rolled, such as with the {{i|D4}} or {{i|D100}}, a random item will still be granted at the start of the next run.", ["If Eden's Blessing is then regained through {{i|Glowing Hour Glass}}, only one extra item will be given.", "Absorbing Eden's Blessing with {{i|Void}} will not grant an extra item in the next run."]], ["Eden's Blessing can choose itself as the free item you gain, but will not give you an item on your next run."], ["If more than one Eden's Blessing is acquired in a single run, that quantity of random items will be granted at the start of the next run, although it's capped at ten items.", ['It is possible to obtain multiple copies of an item at once this way.']], ["If Eden's Blessing effect is obtained through {{i|Metronome}}, no extra item will be given."], ['If gained from {{I|Lemegeton}}, it will not grant an item next run.'], ["Taking Eden's Blessing and then starting a run as {{dlc|r}}{{c|Jacob and Esau}} will only give item(s) to Jacob."], ['{{dlc|r}} As {{c|Tainted Lazarus}}, the item will be given to his alive form.', ["If {{c|Tainted Lazarus}} somehow acquires the item before flipping for the first time of the run, Eden's Blessing will be consumed upon flip and a random item will be granted to {{C|Dead Tainted Lazarus}}."]], ["Using {{I|R Key}} or {{i|Genesis}} will not consume Eden's Blessing."], ["{{p|XVII - The Stars?}} can't remove the item(s) given by Eden's Blessing and using it will consume the first item(s) acquired after them or do nothing if there are no other items."], ["{{p|XVII - The Stars?}} can remove Eden's blessing and the item will be granted in the next game."]]

name: Farting Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and blocks enemy shots. If a shot hits Farting Baby, it has a chance to fart, which [[Status Effects#Charm|charms]], [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]], or [[Hidden Attributes#Knockback|knocks back]] nearby enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and blocks enemy projectiles. Upon blocking a shot, it has a 10% chance of farting. There are three possible fart effects:', ['[[Charm]]s all nearby enemies.', '[[Poison]]s all nearby enemies.', '[[Knockback|Knocks back]] nearby enemies.']], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['Farting Baby does no contact damage.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The knockback fart deals no damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} The knockback fart deals 6 damage.']], ['The charm fart deals 5 damage.'], ['The poison fart initially deals 5 damage and the poison deals 3.5.']]

name: Serpent's Kiss
description: Tears have a chance to apply a [[poison]] effect to enemies. Isaac poisons enemies on contact. Poisoned enemies have a chance to drop a {{E|black heart}} when killed.
effects: [["Grants a 15% chance to fire [[poison|poison tears]], each tick dealing damage equal to Isaac's.", ['Poison from the shots will tick 2 times.']], ['Inflicts [[poison]] on enemies who make contact with Isaac.', ['Contact poison will tick 6 times.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop {{E|black heart}}s.', ['Enemies can still drop black hearts after the poison has worn off.', '{{dlc|r}} Only enemies that were inflicted with contact poison drop black hearts.']]]
notes: [['Not affected by [[luck]].'], ['Enemies and bosses with multiple segments, such as Chub and Larry Jr., have a chance to drop multiple Black Hearts.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Although {{E|Stoney|display=Stonies}} and {{E|Shopkeeper}}s can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched."], ['If a boss would have been poisoned, but negates it with status immunity, they can still drop a black heart.']]

name: Spear of Destiny
description: In addition to tears, Isaac holds a spear in front of him which deals contact damage equal to 2x his [[Damage|tear damage]], and occasionally inflicts [[fear]].
effects: [['Gives Isaac a spear familiar that he holds in the direction he most recently shot.', ["The spear does twice Isaac's [[damage]] per tick (~8.57 times Isaac's damage per second).", 'The spear occasionally inflicts [[Status Effects|fear]] on enemies it damages.']]]
notes: [['Spear of Destiny does not replace tears.'], ["The item is similar to {{I|Mom's Knife}}, although it cannot be fired."], ["{{dlc|nr}} Despite its size, the spear's hitbox is only located on the silver part and the handle, making it only effective at very close range."], ['{{dlc|nr}} The spear can kill permanently charmed enemies.']]

name: Host Hat
description: A host familiar that sits on Isaac's head and has a random chance to block enemy shots and retaliate with 3 tears. Grants immunity to explosions.
effects: [["Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a 25% chance to be blocked. When a projectile is effectively blocked, Host Hat fires 3 bullets similar to the {{E|Host}}'s.", ["Bullets fired from Host Hat use Isaac's [[Damage]] and [[Range]], and copy Isaac's [[Tear effects]].", ["The bullets do not use Isaac's [[Shot Speed]]."], 'Can block:', ['Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), but their lines of fire harm Isaac.', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', 'Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.'], 'Does not block:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}).', 'Lasers or beams.', 'Lines of fire from fireballs.', 'Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.']]], ['Grants immunity to explosions.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Grants immunity to bullets falling from above.']]
notes: [['Does not protect against exploding [[Rocks#Mushrooms|mushrooms]].'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} Isaac becomes immune to {{E|Mom}} and {{E|Satan}}'s stomp attacks, as they are considered explosions. This makes the item very valuable if trying to unlock {{C|The Forgotten}}, as it will protect Isaac from the effects of the {{I|Broken Shovel 1}}."], ["{{dlc|a+}} This item is invaluable in [[Greedier Mode]] as nearly all of {{E|Ultra Greedier|n}}'s attacks are considered explosions."], ['One of only two items that grant full immunity to explosive damage, the other being {{I|Pyromaniac}}.'], ['Although Host Hat has firing animation that expose itself after it blocks a tear, it can still block tears in this state, firing bullets as much it blocks.']]

name: Bursting Sack
description: [[Spider]] enemies no longer target or deal contact damage to Isaac.
effects: [['Certain [[spider]] enemies no longer target or deal contact damage to Isaac, nor actively spawn other enemies. Spiders that are spawned from enemies that are not affected by Bursting Sack will also remain neutral.', ['Affected spider enemies that deal no damage to Isaac whatsoever include: {{e|Baby Long Legs}}, {{e|Big Spider}}, {{e|Crazy Long Legs}}, {{e|Level 2 Spider}}, {{e|Small Baby Long Legs}}, {{e|Small Crazy Long Legs}} and {{e|Spider}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Also: {{e|Rock Spider|n}}, {{e|Strider|n}}, {{e|Swarm Spider|n}}, {{e|Tinted Rock Spider|n}} and {{e|Trite|n}}.', ["Swarm Spiders don't blink yellow when Isaac has the item.", 'Trites will still uselessly try to target Isaac.'], "{{dlc|a+}} Spiders and Big Spiders don't blink red when Isaac has the item."], "{{dlc|nr}} Unaffected spider enemies include: {{e|Blind Creep|n}}, {{e|Blister|n}}, {{e|Rage Creep|n}}, {{e|Ragling|n}}, {{e|Rag Man's Ragling|n}}, {{e|The Thing|n}}, {{e|Trite|n}} and {{e|Wall Creep|n}}.", "{{dlc|r}} Affected enemies that deal no contact damage but can still damage Isaac through other methods include: {{e|Blind Creep|n}}, {{e|Blister|n}}, {{e|Migraine|n}}, {{e|Rage Creep|n}}, {{e|Ragling|n}}, {{e|Rag Man's Ragling|n}}, {{e|Soy Creep|n}}, {{e|Tainted Soy Creep|n}}, {{e|The Thing|n}}, {{e|Ticking Spider|n}}, and {{e|Wall Creep|n}}.", ['Except for Ticking Spiders, Migraines, and Blind Creeps, all other spiders will still uselessly try to target Isaac for contact damage.'], "{{dlc|r}} {{e|Coal Spider|n}}s aren't aggressive to Isaac, but will still deal contact damage.", '{{dlc|r}} {{e|Twitchy|n|display=Twitchies}} are not counted as "spider" enemies and are unaffected by this item.']], ['{{dlc|r}} This item belongs to the {{transf|Spider Baby|n}}. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a humanoid spider.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} If either one of {{C|Jacob and Esau}} holds Bursting Sack, both gain the benefits.']]

name: Maw of the Void
description: Charged by firing for 2.5 seconds and when released, creates a black ring around Isaac that rapidly deals damage. {{dlc|nr}} +1 [[damage]], the ring can cause enemies to drop {{E|Black Heart}}s.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +1.0 [[damage]].'], ['After firing tears for 2.35 seconds, releasing the fire button unleashes a black {{i|Brimstone}} ring around Isaac that expands and contracts, dealing damage at a rapid rate to all enemies touching it.', ["The charge is completed when a red upside-down cross appears on Isaac's forehead.", '{{dlc|a+}} With charge bars enabled, there is also an indicator that displays the charge.', "The black ring deals damage equal to Isaac's current damage per tick, and ticks a total of 30 times. It lasts ~1.97 seconds (118 frames).", '{{dlc|nr}} Enemies killed by the black ring have a 5% chance to drop {{E|Black Heart}}s.', ['Black Hearts will drop as soon as the enemy is killed. (In other words, the heart will drop at the beginning of the death animation rather than at the end of the death animation.)']]], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This item does not work while playing a [[blindfolded]] character, as it requires tears to charge.', ['This restriction can, however, be bypassed by picking up {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}.', "This item's effect will not fully activate if picked up by {{c|Lilith}}; its stat ups will still apply to her {{i|Incubus}} familiar, but the ring will not appear unless she also has the Ludovico Technique."]], ['{{dlc|r}} This item will still work while playing as a [[blindfolded]] character.'], ['The ring will apply any tear status effects such as [[poison]] if Isaac has them.'], ['This item can begin to be recharged again immediately after activating it, effectively cutting its charge time in half in situations where it may be needed again quickly.']]

name: Bomber Boy
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs will now explode in a large cross-shaped pattern (roughly 5 bombs explosions wide). This also affects player-spawned {{E|Troll Bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ['Causes bombs to explode in a large cross-shaped blast by adding two additional explosions in each cardinal direction.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The damage for a single explosion is unchanged, but each successive explosion that hits the same enemy has its damage halved. The damage per successive explosion is: 60, 30, 15, 7.5, 3.75, 1.875, 0.9375, 0.46875, 0.234375', '{{dlc|r}} The damage for a single explosion is 0.75x times its normal damage, resulting in 75 damage per explosion. Each successive explosion that hits the same enemy has its damage halved. The damage per successive explosion is: 75, 37.5, 18.75, 9.375, 4.6875, 2.34375, 1.171875, 0.5859375, 0.29296875.', "{{i|Mr. Mega}} changes the explosions' base damage to {{dlc|nr}}110/{{dlc|r}}185, with the same damage reductions as above."]]]
notes: [['With Bomber Boy, [[Bedroom]]s, [[super special rock]]s and {{dlc|r}}the {{s|Mines}} can be accessed with a single bomb.'], ['Bombing the {{M|Donation Machine}} will cause a greater than normal amount of coins to drop from the Donation Machine.', ['The total amount of dropped coins is still deducted from the Donation Machine, however.']], ['{{dlc|na+}} Bombing a {{E|Blue Fire Place}} or {{E|Purple Fire Place}} may cause it to drop multiple {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Bombs are colored blue and no longer have a skull on them.']]

name: Empty Vessel
description: Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s. While Isaac has no [[Health#Red Heart Containers|red hearts]], grants [[flight]] and periodically grants an invincibility [[shield]] for a few seconds.
effects: [['When Isaac has no [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Hearts]]:', ['Grants [[flight]].', 'Every 40 seconds since activation or pickup, when the seconds on the timer hit 00, 20, or 40, while in a room with enemies, a [[shield]] triggers, nullifying all types of damage for 10 seconds.']], ['Grants 2 {{E|Black Heart}}s on pickup.']]
notes: [['Does not affect {{C|Keeper}}/{{C|Tainted Keeper}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}This item is difficult to use for anyone with red health, as it is impossible to have no red hearts without removing all heart containers (such as through [[Devil Room|Devil deals]]). It is best used by characters that cannot gain red health at all, such as {{C|???}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}}Characters can now deplete their red health fully through sources like {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s while having other hearts like {{E|Soul Heart}}s. As a result, this item is usable for a wider amount of characters, and has synergies with characters who prefer to have no red health (such as {{C|Eve}}).']]

name: Evil Eye
description: Adds a chance to fire a slow-moving eye that fires tears in the same direction as Isaac. The eye will be destroyed if it hits an enemy or obstacle.
effects: [["Isaac will occasionally fire a slow-moving eye with an infinite range that fires tears identical to Isaac's tears in the direction that Isaac is firing.", ['The chance is affected very slightly by [[luck]] and never gets very high.']]]
notes: [['The eye has the same rate of fire and damage as Isaac.'], ["The direction of the eye's tears is affected by the direction the eye is traveling in.", ['{{dlc|r}} Now fire in the same direction as Isaac.']], ["If the eyes are spawned from {{C|The Forgotten}}'s melee attack, the eyes will pick up items off the floor in the same way The Forgotten's melee attack does."], ['The eyes are not treated as familiars and therefore will not synergize with items like {{i|BFFS!}}.'], ['Eyes disappear when hitting walls, enemies, and obstacles, even if Isaac has piercing or spectral tears.', ['Familiars like {{I|Dry Baby}}, {{I|Angry Fly}} and even {{I|Finger!}} also destroy the eye on collision.']]]

name: Glowing Hour Glass
description: Rewinds time, putting Isaac back in the previous room and undoing anything that happened in the current room.
effects: [['On use, Isaac will be returned to the previous room and everything that happened in the current room will be undone.', ['Health, bombs, coins, keys, cards/runes/pills, items, and trinkets will be restored.', 'Certain consumables (such as the {{p|Joker}}) do not get restored.', 'Score and Time will reset, but about one second will be spent in unskippable animation after use.', '[[Completion Marks|Completion marks]] earned in the room will be removed.', "{{dlc|a+}} Event counters will get restored (including {{M|Donation Machine}}s, {{M|Greed Donation Machine}}s, and {{i|Eden's Blessing}})."]]]
notes: [['The Glowing Hour Glass is very useful for finding out hidden information. For example, the player can grab every pill on the floor and use them all in the same room, then activate the Glowing Hour Glass to figure out which pills are worth or not worth taking. As another example, if Isaac has {{cu|Blind}}, Glowing Hour Glass can be used to pick up or purchase an unknown item to see what it is, then decide whether or not to undo picking it up.'], ['If the Glowing Hour Glass to go back in time to previous room, without moving to another room after the activation, each use will multiply some [[Familiar|familiars]] that persist through rooms by duplicating them. (This is possibly a bug)', ['Familiars that can be multiplied:', ['[[Tainted Eve#Blood Clots|Blood Clots]] from {{C|Tainted Eve}}/{{I|Sumptorium}}', 'Blue [[Familiar#Blue Flies|flies]] and [[Familiar#Blue Spiders|spiders]]', '{{I|Abyss}} locusts', '[[Friendly]] monsters spawned by items (i.e. {{I|Friend Finder}})', 'Mini-Isaacs spawned by {{I|Giant Cell}}', '[[Wisps.xml|Wisps]]', ['Wisps from {{I|Vengeful Spirit}} act very unusual, they appear at the entrance of each room Isaac enters and shoot in the direction that Isaac currently shooting. Wisps from the {{I|Book of Virtues}} that exceed the limit of 26 wisps will have this same behavior.', ['{{I|Lemegeton}} wisps, however, do not retain this behavior and will still spin around Isaac even if they exceed they limit of 26 possible wisps, they also only multiply existing ones.']]], 'There appears to be a limit to the number of familiars that can be gained through this method.']], ['Using a {{p|Joker}} and then the Glowing Hour Glass to return does not guarantee a Devil Room for every floor as the Joker card does not get refunded. The reason for this is that you immediately change rooms after the Joker card is used, as such reverting to before it was used is impossible.'], ['Does not return health lost entering or leaving a {{R|Curse Room}}, as the health was lost in the previous room.'], ['Does not preserve the Devil Room or Angel Room door if used to return to the Boss Room.'], ["Does not turn a character back into another should they have been revived by {{i|Ankh}}, {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}, or {{i|Judas' Shadow}}.", ['{{dlc|a+}} Character changes are reverted by Glowing Hour Glass.']], ["{{dlc|a+}} Does not affect the chance for a portal to {{Stage|The Void}} to spawn (the portal will not spawn if it didn't spawn initially).", ['Does not affect the chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} or {{R|Angel Room}} to spawn (it will not spawn if it didnâ€™t initially.']], ['Using the Glowing Hour Glass to prevent picking the Glowing Hour Glass up while previously having had an active item will return the active item and discharge it completely.'], ['No Damage Achievements are still available if the Glowing Hour Glass is used to reset damage.', ['{{t|Perfection}} is still able to drop if the Glowing Hour Glass is used to reset damage.']], ['The Retro Vision [[Pill]] will continue to affect the game even after using the Glowing Hour Glass.', ["Similarly, the delayed effect of the I'm Excited pill will still occur after rewinding."]], ['If taken a hit and reversed Samson can still be unlocked'], ["If there is a Lil' Battery in a Shop, the Glowing Hour Glass can be used infinitely, by entering the Shop without a charge and using the Lil' Battery to recharge and exit the shop. This is useful for duplicating temporary familiars or {{dlc|nr}}filling up the Donation Machine, among other uses."], ['Does not remove [[collection page]] entries if it undoes collecting an item for the first time.'], ['{{Dlc|na+}} Donations to the {{m|Donation Machine}} or {{M|Greed Donation Machine}} are not reverted, and they can be reset into a working state once jammed.', ['Other counters not tied to your specific run, such as {{M|Slot Machine}}s or [[Tinted Rock]]s destroyed, continue to accumulate, allowing easy unlocking of secrets such as the {{t|Counterfeit Penny}}, the {{i|D4}}, and {{E|Conquest}} if you have access to infinite uses of the Glowing Hour Glass (see below).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Does not return keys or health used to enter [[Rooms#Special_rooms|special rooms]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Can be used to unlock multiple achievements tied to the killing of certain bosses such as {{E|Mom's Heart}} / {{E|It Lives}}.\n\n{{Dlc|na+}} Isaac's [[temporary familiar]]s (Blue Flies and Spiders) duplicate when using the Glowing Hour Glass."], ['If combined with {{i|The Battery}} or {{i|Sharp Plug}} while Blue Spiders are present, this combo can generate an infinite army of Blue Spiders.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Using the Glowing Hour Glass right after beating {{E|Mom's Heart}} / {{E|It Lives}} / {{E|Ultra Greed}} allows you to get additional Eden tokens."], ['{{dlc|nr}} If a new game is started and {{C|Eden}} begins with this item, using it in the first room will cause the game to crash.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Does not return extra lives.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} Using the Glowing Hour Glass after beating Mom's Heart in {{s|Mausoleum}}/{{s|Gehenna}} II will transport the player to the previous room without the Knife Pieces, but the door to Mom's Heart will also be closed. The following floor will be {{s|Womb}}/{{s|Utero}}/{{s|Scarred Womb}} and not {{s|Corpse}}."], ['{{Dlc|r}} Using the Glowing Hour Glass after entering a new floor will teleport you back to the boss room of the previous floor.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} {{C|Bethany}}'s soul heart container does '''<u>not</u>''' get reset upon activating this item."], ['{{Dlc|r}} If {{C|Tainted Jacob}} is hit by Esau, using the Glowing Hour Glass will return him to normal form in the previous room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The guaranteed angel room chance can be preserved if the item is used after entering the first devil room.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If used during {{E|The Beast|n}} fight, it will teleport Isaac to the center of the room and have no further effect.'], ["{{dlc|r}} May be helpful for finding {{R|Planetarium}}s, as it lets the player effectively skip item rooms while also seeing if what's inside them is worth taking."], ['{{Dlc|r}} The chance of a {{R|Planetarium}} generating on future floors can be preserved if Isaac enters one for the first time and then uses Glowing Hour Glass to leave, effectively allowing Isaac to reroll his Planetarium until a desired item is found.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The {{R|Boss Challenge Room}} re-rolls bosses on using the Glowing Hour Glass.']]

name: Succubus
description: Spawns a flying [[familiar]] that bounces around the room with a black aura, dealing rapid damage to any enemies inside it. While standing in the aura, Isaac gains a 1.5x [[Damage|tear damage]] multiplier.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar that bounces around the room and has a dark aura around it.', ['Enemies within the radius of the aura take damage. The aura deals:', ["{{dlc|nr}} 30% of Isaac's [[damage]] per tick or about 129% of Isaac's damage per second.", '{{dlc|r}} 2.5 damage per tick or about 7.5-10 damage per second.'], 'If Isaac is within the aura, his tears gain a 1.5x [[damage]] multiplier.', ["This aura stacks with other Succubi, as well as other damage multipliers (e.g. {{i|Cricket's Head}}, {{i|Sacred Heart}}, etc.)."]]]]

name: Wooden Nickel
description: When used, has a 50% chance to drop a random [[coin]].
effects: [['When used, has a 50% chance to drop a random [[coin]].']]
notes: [['This is a starting item for {{C|Keeper}} after he beats {{E|Isaac}}.']]

name: D12
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Re-rolls all [[Rock]]s and [[Metal Block]]s in the current room into other random obstacles.
{{dlc|r}} Re-rolls most types of [[Obstacles]] in the current room into other random obstacles.
effects: [['Re-rolls [[Rock]]s and [[Metal Block]]s in the current room into {{E|Poop}}s, other Metal Blocks, other Rocks, and/or {{E|TNT}}.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} Poops of any type and TNT cannot be re-rolled, although other obstacles may be rerolled into them.', '{{dlc|r}} Also re-rolls {{E|Poop}}s, [[Spikes]], {{E|Fire Place}}s, both types of {{E|TNT}}, [[Cobwebs]], and [[Pillars]].']]]
notes: [['Can be used to net more of a certain desired obstacle for interactions such as more poops making {{t|Petrified Poop}} more effective or more rocks to farm [[Coins]] with {{t|Lucky Rock}}.'], ['Chapter-specific obstacles ([[Urn|Urns]], [[Mushroom|Mushrooms]], [[Skull|Skulls]], and [[Polyp|Polyps]]) can be re-rolled. Depending on the current [[Chapter]], rocks can also be re-rolled into them.'], ['{{E|Rainbow Poop}}, {{E|Golden Poop}}, and [[Tinted Rock]]s are much less likely to be created by the D12 than all other obstacles.'], ['Destroyed obstacles will not be rerolled.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} While TNT can be created by the D12, {{E|Movable TNT}} cannot be.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} The D12 will not re-roll [[Key Block]]s or {{E|Fire Place}}s.', ["It also won't re-roll {{e|Stone Grimace}}s or other enemies."]], ['{{dlc|r}} This item can rarely reroll obstacles into {{E|Reward Plate}}s, {{E|Red Button|display=Red Buttons}}, and very rarely into [[Crawl Space]]s or trapdoors to the next floor.'], ['{{dlc|r}} It is possible reroll the spikes in a {{R|Sacrifice Room}} and render the room unusable.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The D12 will not re-roll {{E|silver Button|display=Buttons}}, [[Marked Skull]]s, [[Dirt Patches]], [[Teleporters]], or Bomb Rocks.'], ['{{dlc|r}} These obstacles will only reroll into another one in this group: {{E|Poop}}s, [[Retractable Spikes]], Normal and Red {{E|Fire Place}}s, both types of {{E|TNT}}, and [[Cobwebs]].', ['These obstacles can also reroll into {{E|Reward Plate|display=Reward Plates}} and {{E|Red Button|display=Red Buttons}}, but will not reroll any further.']]]

name: Explosivo
description: Isaac's tears have a chance to stick to enemies and explode.
effects: [["Isaac's tears have a chance to stick to enemies and explode a few seconds afterward, dealing 60 damage plus Isaac's tear damage."]]
notes: [['Explosivo does damage to Isaac while in proximity to the explosion'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Tears that stick to enemies do not deal any damage until they explode.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Explosivo shots deal regular tear damage upon sticking to an enemy.'], ['If an enemy dies or teleports with an Explosivo tear attached, the tear detaches and drops to the ground. If the detached tears touch an enemy, they will stick to that enemy and explode.', ['However, when an Explosivo tear is attached to {{E|Loki}} or {{E|Lokii}}, the tear teleports with the respective boss when the boss teleports.']], ['Be careful with large-sized tears: as Explosivo causes them to grow even larger, they can completely obscure enemies and their surroundings.'], ['Explosivo is not affected by [[luck]].'], ['Explosivo shots can go through any type of {{E|fire place}} and coal from {{e|Coal Spider}} and {{e|Coal Boy}}.']]

name: Circle of Protection
description: Surrounds Isaac with a large white halo that occasionally deals Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] to enemies inside it, and can convert enemy shots into friendly [[homing tears]].
effects: [['Surrounds Isaac with a large white halo.', ["Once per second, the halo deals Isaac's [[Damage]] to all enemies currently inside it.", 'Each enemy shot has a 30% chance to be reflected by the halo.', ['The chance is predetermined, and not affect by how long it is exposed by the halo.', "The reflectable tears are reflected once they touch the middle line of the halo, and is converted into friendly purple [[homing tears]] that have Isaac's Damage and no other tear modifiers.", 'Projectiles that create other projectiles (e.g. {{E|Shady}}) do not create the projectiles once reflected.', 'Can reflect:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}), which do not explode once reflected.', 'Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), which do not create lines of fire once reflected.', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', 'Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.'], 'Does not reflect:', ['Lasers or beams.', 'Lines of fire from fireballs.', 'Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.']]]]]

name: Rune Bag
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a random [[Cards and Runes|rune]] after clearing enough [[rooms]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a random [[Cards and Runes|rune]] after clearing enough rooms.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Runes are dropped alternating every 5 or 6 rooms.', '{{dlc|r}} Runes are dropped alternating every 7 or 8 rooms.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If there are no runes unlocked, it will drop [[Cards and Runes|cards]] instead.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Rune Bag will also drop Soul Stones if any have been unlocked.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} If not every rune is unlocked, it will drop a {{p|Rune Shard}} in place of the corresponding rune.{{dlc-}}']]

name: My Shadow
description: Each time Isaac takes damage, inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies in the room and spawns a black [[friendly]] {{E|Charger}} that will attack enemies. The Charger will be killed if it is damaged too much.
effects: [['Upon taking damage, inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies in the room.'], ['Upon taking damage, spawns a dark [[friendly]] {{E|My Shadow|display=Charger}}', ['{{dlc|nr}} The Chargers deal 5 damage per hit to enemies.', ['{{dlc|r}} The Chargers deal 8.7 damage per hit to enemies.'], 'Isaac keeps the chargers when transitioning between rooms.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|ana+}} If this item is triggered in the {{s|Flooded Caves}}, there is a chance that the black charger will be replaced by a {{E|Drowned Charger}}. The summoned Drowned Charger will behave like normal black chargers, and upon death will explode into 4 blood shots that do not damage the player.'], ["Shadows of incoming attacks from above will be harder to see, as they're covered by the item's shadow initially."], ['This item can only spawn a maximum of 5 chargers.']]

name: Friend Zone
description: Spawns a white attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] somewhere between {{i|Distant Admiration}} and {{i|Forever Alone}}, dealing 45 damage per second.
effects: [['Spawns a white fly [[familiar]] that slowly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] Isaac and deals 3 damage per tick or 45 damage per second on contact.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['This familiar orbits Isaac at a middle-length distance somewhere between {{i|Distant Admiration}} and {{i|Forever Alone}}.']]

name: Pupula Duplex
description: Gives Isaac [[spectral tears]] and gives his tears a wide arc shape, increasing their size.
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]].'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 2x.', ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.6 tear size.', 'Despite their crescent shape, the tears are still considered round hitbox-wise.']]]

name: Glass Cannon
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Fires a high-damage piercing spectral tear, but lowers Isaac's health to half a heart.
{{dlc|r}} Fires a high-damage piercing spectral tear. If Isaac takes damage while holding this, he takes extra damage and it becomes {{i|Broken Glass Cannon|force=n}}.
effects: [['Fires a single high-damage [[piercing tears|piercing]] tear which can travel over [[obstacle]]s.', ["The damage dealt by this tear is ten times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 10 damage.", 'The shot has an additional 1.5x size multiplier on top of damage-increased size.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} Sets Isaac's health to half a heart with each use (half a Soul Heart if these are present but there are no Red Heart containers). This also removes any other {{E|Soul Heart}}s or {{E|Black Heart}}s, but not {{E|Eternal Heart}}s.", ['{{dlc|a+nr}} If Isaac has no Red Hearts and at least one {{E|Bone Heart}}, only an empty Bone Heart remains.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Upon taking damage, this item turns into {{i|Broken Glass Cannon}}, and Isaac will lose an additional 2 hearts of health on top of the damage he already took. Isaac gains 1.5 range and leaves a trail of red [[creep]] behind him, identical to the effects of {{i|Anemic}} for the rest of the current room.', ['If the damage from breaking Glass Cannon would result in death, Isaac will remain at half a heart, gaining half a soul heart if necessary. This does not apply if the damage Isaac took would be lethal before the extra damage is taken.', 'Self-damage (e.g. from {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s) will not break Glass Cannon.']]]
notes: [['Glass Cannon can be fired diagonally, even without {{I|Analog Stick}}.'], ['Shooting the Glass Cannon gives a slight [[knockback]] effect to Isaac, which can be dangerous in rooms with obstacles like spikes or Fire Places.'], ['Getting hit while playing {{C|Keeper}} will result into a second coin heart being damaged on top of the damage he already took.']]

name: Key Bum
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and collects {{E|Key}}s for himself, giving random {{E|Chest}}s in return.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and collects {{E|key}}s, dropping random {{E|Chest}}s in return. (He does not fill up a familiar "slot".)'], ['{{transf|Super Bum|item}}']]
notes: [['Key Bum will not pick up {{E|Golden Key}}s.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Key Bum will pick up {{E|Charged Key|n}} without additional benefit.', ["{{dlc|r}} Key Bum will leave a {{E|Lil' Battery}} behind when picking up {{E|Charged Key|n}}.", 'From a scoring perspective, Keys that Key Bum picks up count towards your Schwag bonus on daily runs. (only applies to Afterbirth and Afterbirth âœž dailies)']]]

name: Censer
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] which creates a circular aura that [[Status Effects#Effects|slows]] down enemies and enemy shots inside.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] projecting a circular aura that [[Status Effects#Effects|slows]] enemies and enemy shots within its radius and for some time once they exit.']]
notes: [['The aura does not affect bosses but slows down their shots.', ['Bosses that use tight volleys of projectiles are extremely difficult to avoid without additional items to block, remove, or redirect those shots, as the slowing effect will cause their attacks to clump together.']]]

name: Lusty Blood
description: Isaac's [[damage]] increases for the current room each time he kills an enemy.
effects: [['Each time an enemy is killed, Isaac gains a [[damage]] boost for the current room.', ['Each kill increases damage by 0.5, up to a maximum of 5 damage after 10 kills.']]]
notes: [["Some summoned enemies like {{E|Rag Man's Ragling}}s do not trigger the effect when killed."], ['{{E|Mr. Maw}} does not trigger the effects of Lusty Blood, even after splitting.'], ['Blowing up a {{E|shopkeeper}} will grant Isaac a damage bonus as well.']]

name: Lil Chest
description: Spawns a chest [[familiar]] that spawns a random [[pickup]] (25% chance) or [[trinket]] (10% chance) upon clearing a [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Spawns a chest [[familiar]] that has a 25% chance to spawn a [[Pickups|pickup]] and a 10% chance to spawn a trinket after clearing a [[Rooms|room]]. The possible rewards are:', ['{{E|Red Heart|display=Hearts}}', '{{E|Penny|display=Coins}}', '{{E|Bomb}}s', '{{E|Key}}s', '[[Pills]]', '[[Cards]]', '[[Runes]]', "{{E|Lil' Battery|display=Batteries}}", '[[Trinkets]]']]]

name: Purity
description: Boosts one of Isaac's [[Attributes|stats]] depending on the color of the aura around him. The aura disappears upon taking damage and reappears with a random color upon entering a new room. Red boosts [[damage]], blue boosts [[tears]], yellow boosts [[speed]], and orange boosts [[range]].
effects: [["Grants an aura around Isaac that grants a boost depending on the aura's color.", ["'''Red''': +4 [[damage]].", "{{dlc|nr}} '''Blue''': -4 [[tear delay]].", "{{dlc|r}} '''Blue''': +2.0 [[fire rate]].", "'''Yellow''': +0.5 [[speed]].", ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).'], "{{dlc|nr}} '''Orange''': +7.5 [[range]], +1.0 [[tear falling speed]].", "{{dlc|r}} '''Orange''': +3.0 [[range]]."]], ['Taking damage causes the aura to disappear. When the next room is entered, the aura will reappear with a random color.']]
notes: [["The tear delay boost can allow the player's tears to go over the normal maximum [[tear delay|rate of fire]]."], ['It is especially difficult for {{C|The Lost}} to change auras. However, it is possible through the use of {{i|Dull Razor}}.'], ['As {{C|Tainted Isaac}} you can easily change auras by swapping Purity for another item and picking it back up again.']]

name: Betrayal
description: Every time Isaac takes damage, a [[charm]] effect is applied to every enemy in the room, causing them to attack each other rather than Isaac.
effects: [['Upon taking damage, all enemies in the room are [[charm]]ed.', ["{{dlc|a+}} It won't trigger if there are less than 2 enemies in the room."]]]

name: Fate's Reward
description: A blue head [[familiar]] that will follow Isaac and fire tears copying his [[tear effects]] and [[damage]].
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that fires tears with the same [[damage]] and [[tear effects]] as Isaac's tears."], ['Fires at half the normal fire rate of a familiar.'], ['The familiar is not affected by {{dlc|nr}} [[range]]/{{dlc|r}} [[tear height]], only [[tear falling speed]].', ["{{dlc|r}} Since tear height and shot speed ups lower tear falling speed in order to adjust Isaac's range, increases to either stat will decrease the familiar's range, and decreases to either stat will increase the familiar's range."]]]

name: Kidney Stone
description: Randomly while firing tears, Isaac will stop firing and turn red, where he will charge and release a lot of 'tears' in one go. The burst of tears also includes a kidney stone, which deals a lot of damage.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} -0.2 [[speed]] and maximum speed.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} -15 [[range]].', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} -17 [[range]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +2.0 [[tear falling speed]].', ['{{dlc|na+}} The increased tear falling speed and decreased range results in slightly increased firing distance.', '{{dlc|a+nr}} The increased tear falling speed and decreased range results in nearly identical firing distance.']], ["Occasionally, firing tears will cause Isaac to charge an attack with his head pulsating with a red color. After the attack has charged up, the fire button can be released to fire a kidney stone that does 5 times Isaac's damage and pierces enemies, followed by a rapid, inaccurate spray of tears.", ['This effect occurs approximately every 25 seconds.', "Isaac won't be able to fire tears normally until the kidney stone has been fired.", 'The kidney stone has approximately twice the range of normal tears.', 'The barrage will continue for its full length between [[room]]s, as will the state of charging the attack instead of firing tears.']]]
notes: [['Tints tears red. This is only a cosmetic change.'], ['{{i|Incubus}} will still fire tears normally while retaining the barrage effect, making this a good item for {{C|Lilith}}.', ['The barrage from the Incubus will be in a straight line (similar to {{i|Cursed Eye}}) instead of an inaccurate burst.', 'The kidney stone itself will come out of Lilith, not the Incubus follower, even though she cannot fire tears. The barrage of tears will still only come from the Incubus. This also applies if blindfolded as another character.', 'This is the only item to be able to override the Grayscale easter egg.', 'This item does not appear to work at all for {{Dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Lilith}}.']]]

name: D8
description: Re-rolls Isaac's [[damage]], [[tears]], [[range]], and [[speed]].
effects: [["Re-rolls Isaac's [[damage]], [[tears]], [[range]], and [[speed]].", ['Each stat is given a multiplier, ranging from 0.5x to 2.0x, which applies after all other adjustments.']]]
notes: [['[[Luck]], [[Shot Speed]], and {{dlc|nr}} [[Tear Falling Speed]] are unaffected.'], ["The Tears multiplier can cause Isaac's tear delay to decrease beyond the normal cap of 5."], ["The Speed multiplier cannot cause Isaac's speed to decrease or increase past the normal range of 0.1 to 2.0.", ["The multiplier overrides the Speed Up effect of {{i|A Pony}} or {{i|White Pony}}, which normally raise Isaac's Speed to 1.5 if it is below that value.", "{{dlc|nr}} The hidden maximum Speed value also gets the same multiplier, which may further cap Isaac's Speed."]], ["The multipliers are chosen in a way that keeps their total product roughly the same; the item will most often increase two and decrease two of Isaac's stats, although it can increase three and decrease one or increase one and decrease three. Larger increases are balanced by larger decreases."]]

name: Immaculate Conception
description: Upon picking up a certain amount of [[Hearts|health]], spawn a permanent angelic [[familiar]].
effects: [['Upon picking up enough [[Hearts|heart pickups]], Isaac gains a permanent angelic [[familiar]] and generates a {{E|Soul Heart}} drop. Possible familiars include:', ['{{i|Holy Water}}', '{{i|Guardian Angel}}', '{{i|Sworn Protector}}', '{{i|The Relic}}', '{{i|Seraphim}}']], ['All five familiars will spawn in a random order, each after collecting 15 hearts.'], ['After all familiars have been spawned, a {{E|Soul Heart}} will still drop every 15 hearts collected.'], ['Isaac will look progressively more pregnant as he collects heart pickups.']]
notes: [['All types of hearts except {{E|Gold Heart}}s and {{e|Blended Heart}}s count.'], ['Items that directly add health such as {{i|Yum Heart}}, {{i|Book of Revelations}}, {{i|Satanic Bible}}, and {{i|The Nail}} do not count towards spawning a familiar.'], ['Only one of each type of familiar can be spawned.'], ['{{C|The Lost}} can pick up Soul Hearts and Black Hearts despite having no health and thus can activate Immaculate Conception.'], ['{{C|Keeper}} cannot encounter hearts, thus the item is useless for him.'], ['As the short-lived Half Red Hearts dropped by {{C|Tainted Magdalene}} also count, it is an excellent choice for her since she will constantly be picking up hearts and gain all five familiars quickly.'], ['The familiars spawned by Immaculate Conception will still spawn even if Isaac has already obtained the familiar through their respective pedestal item.'], ['The familiars spawned by Immaculate Conception will not contribute to [[transformations]], such as [[conjoined]].']]

name: GB Bug
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms|room]], applying a random [[status effect]] to enemies it hits and has a chance to re-roll [[pickup]]s it passes over.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac. Double tapping the fire button launches it forward, causing it to reroll the first [[monster]] or [[pickup]] it hits.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms|room]], deals 8 damage per tick or 120 damage per second and applies a random [[Status Effects|status effect]] to enemies it comes in contact with. The familiar also has a chance to re-roll [[pickups]] that it passes over into other pickups, {{E|chest}}s, or [[items]], in an uncleared room only (with at least one enemy alive).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac. Double tapping the fire button launches it forward, causing it to reroll the first [[monster]], [[Trinkets|trinket]], or [[pickup]] it hits. It respawns after clearing a room.', ['If it cannot reroll an enemy (e.g. a boss), it will deal 8 damage instead.', 'Items and opened chests cannot be rerolled.', 'Pickups have a 10% chance of becoming chests (see [[#Algorithm|the algorithm]]).', ['If a chest is rerolled, it has a 28% chance of staying as some kind of a chest.']]]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} GB Bug can block projectiles.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} GB Bug does more damage per second than {{i|The Peeper}}, with the added random status chance.'], ['{{dlc|r}} GB Bug is able to reroll {{e|Throwable Bomb|n}}s into normal consumables. After doing so, the corresponding {{e|Bomb Grimace|n}} will generate another Throwable Bomb, making it able to generate a potentially large amount of free consumables.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Rerolled [[champion]] enemies will retain their color, unless they reroll into a monster that cannot naturally spawn as a champion.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Caution is advised as GB Bug can also reroll certain entities such as the hot rock left by a dead {{e|Coal Spider}} adding another enemy to the room.']]

name: Sworn Protector
description: Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] which does 105 damage per second and attracts and blocks enemy shots. Upon blocking 10 shots in a [[Rooms|room]], it drops an {{E|Eternal Heart}}.
effects: [['Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second on contact ({{dlc|r}} 53 damage per second).', ["It also attracts enemy shots to itself, making them more likely to be blocked. A shot actively being attracted can no longer damage Isaac and is essentially nullified, but if it slips outside the Protector's range, it can again deal damage."]], ['Sworn Protector has a chance to drop an {{E|Eternal Heart}} upon blocking 10 shots in one [[Rooms|room]].', ['This can only happen once per room, but leaving and re-entering a room will allow another eternal heart to be dropped.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{transf|Seraphim|item}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['Sworn Protector can be exploited with the help of a {{E|Constant Stone Shooter}} to spawn unlimited eternal hearts.']]

name: Tear Detonator
description: When used, will detonate any tears currently on the screen and cause each one to split into 6 more tears which will fire in a circle, similar to Tammy's Head.
effects: [['Once activated, all tears in the air split into 6 more tears in all directions, which retain their damage and shot speed.', ['Luck-based effects from items such as {{i|Tough Love}} or {{i|Holy Light}} are applied individually to each tear.']]]

name: Mine Crafter
description: Places a {{E|Movable TNT}} barrel that can be pushed and used to destroy rocks or damage enemies. If used again in the same room while the previous TNT barrel is still intact, remotely detonates the TNT.
effects: [['Upon use, spawns a {{E|Movable TNT}}.'], ['If used a second time while the created TNT is still active, it will explode. This will consume a charge to remotely detonate the TNT instead of creating another TNT.', ['{{dlc|r}} The remote detonation can be used while the item is uncharged.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} The Movable TNT has a unique cubic appearance, but it functionally identical to a regular Movable TNT.']]

name: Zodiac
description: Gives Isaac a random [[Signs of the Zodiac|zodiac item]] effect that changes every floor.
effects: [['Gives Isaac a random [[Signs of the Zodiac|Zodiac item]] effect that changes each floor.']]
notes: [['Getting {{i|Capricorn}}, {{i|Cancer}} and {{i|Libra}} does not grant {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}, {{E|bomb}}s, {{E|key}}s or {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Getting {{i|Leo}} will not change Isaac's size."], ['If already in possession of the item given by Zodiac, most have no effect. The only exceptions are {{i|Capricorn}} giving an additional +0.5 damage, and {{i|Gemini}} giving another familiar.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Getting {{i|Virgo}} does not provide the {{i|PHD}} effect for the floor it is obtained. It does grant the chance to trigger a protective shield on taking damage however.']]

name: Toxic Shock
description: Upon entering a room, [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] all enemies, dealing double Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]]. Killing enemies leaves a small, short-lasting pool of [[Creep#Green Creep|green]] [[creep]] on the ground.
effects: [["Upon entering a room, all enemies are [[Status Effects#Poison|poisoned]], dealing double Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] and also creating a green fog for the first few seconds of the room."], ['Killing enemies leaves a small, short-lasting pool of [[Creep#Green Creep|green]] [[creep]] on the ground.', ['The creep deals 1 damage per tick or 30 damage per second.']]]
notes: [['High tear damage will cause this item to become very powerful for rooms with a lot of enemies, since they can die instantly and render the room harmless.'], ['Enemies which spawn after the first few seconds of each room are not affected by this item, e.g. Flies spawned from a {{E|Mulligan}} dying.'], ['Enemies that spawn with some form of invulnerability such as {{E|Host}}s, {{E|Wizoob}}s, or {{E|Needle}}s are not affected by this item.'], ['The poison effect only activates upon entering a room and not at the start of a wave. In {{R|Boss Rush}} and most of [[Greed mode]], the item will not poison enemies.'], ['If Toxic Shock is picked up in the middle of a room with enemies, the mass poison will occur immediately.']]

name: Spider Mod
description: Displays Isaac's tear damage and enemy health bars. Spawns a [[familiar]] that wanders around and inflicts random [[status effect]]s on enemies it touches. Can spawn a {{E|Lil' Battery}}/[[Blue spider]] upon clearing a [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Spawns a grey spider [[familiar]] that wanders around and allows Isaac to see tear damage and the health bars of all enemies.', ['The spider will inflict a random [[Effects#Status Effects|status effect]] on any enemies it comes into contact with.', "The spider will sometimes drop a {{E|Lil' Battery}} or spawn a [[Blue Spider]] when a [[Rooms|room]] is completed."]], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
